text: Great little Mexican place. Nothing super fancy but for the money you can't go wrong.
Food was priced great! Food and desert were beyond excellent. Even got a private miriachi performance on sunday evening. Highly reccommended!!!

This is one of my staple restaurants to take out of town guests to.  Their shrimp is huge, the food is consistently tasty, and the atmosphere and service are always on point.  My dad got the camerones de ajo (garlic shrimp).  I got the camerones a la diabla (spicy shrimp).  The garlic shrimp was awesome. It came with vegetables.  The spicy shrimp was ok... no veggies.  My dad got a margarita and was impressed with the size and strength of the alcohol in the drink.

This was my family's third visit to Azteca, and my fourth with my honey. It was his birthday, which I quietly mentioned to our server. Although, it was a Monday (June 1, specifically), the dining rooms and even the bar was crowded. That being said the service was prompt & pleasant. Having 3 hungry young men at the table kept the chips & salsa person busy. I knew better than to partake, because the entrées are huge. I did have a very large Margarita, and my honey and eldest son had 2 of the largest Does Equis that I've ever seen. Each time I visit I try to order something different, rather than my fave from my first Mexican restaurant in Charlotte when I arrived some 30 years ago-El Cancun. They too had an amazing air of authenticity & super food. My honey had a dish with the mole sauce (which is a delightful mix of dark chocolate & spices, my eldest ordered the Steak Azteca- a nice piece of meat with rice & refried beans. He said the steak was cooked perfectly, medium rare. The younger boys ordered the super nacho plate. I fell back on my old El Cancun fave- the large chicken burrito. I was not disappointed. It was filled with good quality chicken breast & all was seasoned to perfection. Portions were so large we all brought food home. Finally, my honey was amused to have the sombrero put on his head and have his birthday celebration. More to go boxes needed, as the boys brought home their dessert. I wasn't left out, as even though, I didn't order dessert, they brought over a couple of Cinnamon chips topped with whipped cream and a cherry! We will continue to go to Azteca, especially as summer comes, just to drink margaritas on the patio. Well done Azteca!!

I love this place! We frequent a lot as it is close to my work. Sometimes there is a short wait but they are always about to accommodate us. They have great lunch specials and you can get a lot of food for under 10$.
Loved the place! Service was really good. Guacamole on the table was just as I wanted. I will definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Ever since moving from Texas to Charlotte area, I have been trying to find The Tex-Mex food that i'm familiar with and have been disappointed over and over again here.  But someone recommended Azteca to us and I was not disappointed.  The food, while not outstanding, was much much better than other Mexican restaurants here and I especially liked how they prepared the guacamole table side.  Came at lunch time and found two very large groups (20 at each table) so expected to wait for food and drinks.  To my surprise service was prompt and food tasted fresh.  I'll definitely be back.

My family loves this place! My daughter just flew in from the UK on break from University and of course she chose Azteca for her first meal back in the States. The homemade guacamole is always a good choice and the margaritas are the best in town. Love you guys!

The guy here - Louis - was rude and racist. He could not serve us vegetarian option when we asked for the menu item without the meat. He said they don't do that. We always get that in most of the mexican restaurant we visited. This guy is a moron and seems like he is fine with us reporting this online when I said so. I would ask everyone not to visit this racist place, who can't even speak good English, I am sure he spits on the food he serves.

Service was really slow, however we were there on lunch midweek. I can look past those kind of things, next problem was our food. My buddy ordered a hard taco and two enchiladas and I ordered Mexican story fry. Food comes out and his "hard" taco is SOAKED in grease and juices from the enchiladas. My meal was alright, really greasy though. Just based off of this experience since it's my first time, I won't say I won't come back. It will just be quite a while until I give it another shot. Would not recommend to anybody.

WARNING! On June 25th, I ordered chicken tortilla soup to go from Azteca Mexican Restaurant - Smith Corners. After driving home and getting settled (nearly 25 minutes later) the container which was not secured by the manager who packed my order, spilled into my lap. I was rushed to the hospital where it was determined that I had received 2nd degree burns from their soup, through denim jeans, nearly HALF AN HOUR LATER! I have been given the run around from the restaurant, their management, and their insurance group The Main Street America Group who refuse to cover my just medical expenses or answer my questions. Those of you that know my family and I know that we are honest, hard-working people who don't ask for more than we are justly due. I am asking you join my family and I in spreading this warning by reposting this and boycotting this restaurant. If you do choose to dine with them, I don't recommend the soup.

Went late (9:30pm) on a Monday night.  It wasn't busy, but I wasn't worried about that.  Decor is nice, lots of seating.  Everything was very clean.  I was seated quickly and chips and salsa were brought to the table.  Chips were nice and hot, but the salsa was gross.  Now, having said that; maybe it was because it was the end of the night, etc.  So, we'll give that a pass.  I ordered the carnas buritto and it was super!  Portions were nice and the food was delicious.  Waiter was very attentive.  I also had a piece of 3 layer cake and it was awesome too!  Can't wait to go again!

My most FAV mexican restaurant EVER! I've been eating here for almost 7 years and won't go anyplace else! It's not fancy, totally authentic, reasonablly priced and most importantly DELICIOUS! Everything from their cheese dip, table-side guac and  homemade flour tortillas to their wonderful staff and service, this place is a must! The staff are so friendy and treat you like family. I'm not saying there's no competion but this place has it all...a complete authentic experience!

The fajitas were good, the portions are huge you can definitely share a meal!! My kids had the burritos they said they liked them  our waiter was very friendly the decor was original and some of the employees had on special cultural uniforms. Theirs a lady that brings a cart if you order guacamole and prepares it in front of your table we enjoyed that. Prices are very reasonable.
Awesome food, service and price.  We're from Texas and this is the closest we've ever found to the Tex-Mex food we love.  Try the cheese enchiladas - yummy!!!!

Was staying close by, a fifteen minute walk away. So worth the "dangerous, un-lit walk" (I was staying across the freeway and had to walk there)
Fresh guac made right in front of the table so you get it tasty just to your buds!
The waitress recommended everything, but said to try a little of everything the dish with steak,shrimp, and chicken (I forget the name) was best. It comes with beans and rice.
SO GOOD! Wish they had a location in New York City, I'd be a constant costumer ;)
Every time  I come here the service is great and food is delicious.  Use to come a lot and stopped but I definitely need to start coming back because I forgot how good this place is.

Best Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  The arroz con pollo is awesome (chicken in rice with a red sauce on top of melted cheese).  They have some tacos which are not on the menu which are my favorite. They ar called tacos de asada and they bring 4 with a small bowl of beans on the  side.  There enchiladas are excellent as well as their burritos.  To drink try the Horchara, a Mexican rice milk drink.

Very bad experience. I went with my friend. The guy who served us was very unprofessional. That spoiled our dinner experience here. He was not taking order properly. My friend ordered vegetarian salad and he brought ham salad. We asked him to get new vegetarian salad and he just removed ham on top and brought the same salad which is very annoying for vegetarian guys. Not only messed up the order but the way he talks the way he responds. We asked him to get drinks menu and he forgot that. We asked him to get salsa and he forgot that. The other guys who were serving other tables kind of sensed that we are waiting on something and brought us the menu and salsa. Might ruin your experience too. Think before you go here. I will never go to this restaurent.
The food was good, but it's a bit over priced. My burrito literally only had the steak in it.
This place has the best Mexican food ever. Large portions and great chips, salsa, and cheese dip! Really love the service also.

Good solid Mexican food, very similar to the style in Texas.  A tad bland for my family but we are more used to California/Baja style.  A nice surprise to find this good of Mexican in NC, good atmosphere and price is right as well.  Had "Super Nachos", also tried "chile rellanos", "tamales" and "enchiladas".  Overall a good dining experience.

I am not an expert on Mexican good but I know what tastes good. The food here is delicious. I have been here twice and both times were great. Sunday afternoon they had a mariachi band which was awesome and also they had the lunch menu which is a great value, too.
The service is good as they come and refill your drinks and chips without being asked.

Guacamole is Bland, staff is friendly and food is great, but they have hidden fees they charged me for limes and on the plate ordered i didnt want the sour cream, when i got my food they left out the cheese also, so i asked for the cheese that was supposed to be on my food, but they charged me for it!
Only Mexican Restaurant in town. Pico is legit, got to get the Guac, mariachi bands on Friday!

If you desire real Mexican food this is where it is at! Especially the location on Woodlawn. Great traditional dishes as well as the tex/mex so many Americans enjoy. The salsa is unique and you get a free small desert at the end of every meal.

Outstanding.  This place is the real deal.  So authentic. So tasty.  Family of 4 passing through Charlotte for the night and stopped by...left feeling like I'd never eat again for $85.  Would definitely stop by again if I was in the area.  Parking kinda sucks @ dinner time and you need to park in a shady Days Inn lot.

Some of the best Mexican food north of the border. Queso is great. The Fajitas Quesadilla is fantastic. Haven't had anything on the menu that wasn't good. Soccer is on the tv, and on Sunday's you may find a mariachi group playing.
The tacos were great but all the sides that go along with them lacked flavor. The décor and feel of the restaurant was great, but only half of a meal with taste is not a good enough reason to go back
Love this place. Go there weekly with a buddy of mine. Great food with a fun environment too. The amount of food you get is well worth the few bucks it costs. Just don't touch the hot plates.

The food here is really good, and not too expensive. They have really great lunch specials and their chips and queso are amazing. However, the service was so bad. My waiter took probably close to 20 minutes just to get our drinks and another 10 minutes to take our order (after the drinks) we were probably there for close to 45 minutes before we got our food. (We went around noon, so it really wasn't busy at all)  my friend, who I went with, asked the waiter a question about the menu, and he looked at her like she was dumb and never answered her question, instead make a sarcastic remark to her. 
To be honest, the foods good, so I can see why people go here a lot.. But personally, the service was so bad, I would rather pay the extra money for the better service then come back.
Best Mexican food in Charlotte! But the staff that greets you can be kinda rude. Prices are fair.

I've eaten here with my family at least once every other week since this place opened. I don't know how many times that amounts to??  (100 plus??) Of any restaurant in Charlotte this seems to be about the most consistent if ever been to. I've honestly never had a bad meal here no matter what I get. We usually have  large combo's  ...all under $10.-. You have to ask for some of their salsas,salsa verde, pico de gallo, and salsa de la drilla (nice heat) (all free..just ask) when they bring chips. 
Huge portions, reasonably priced home made everything! Their signature carne asada, skirt steak flame broiled to your liking is excellent, and that is around $14.- Their sweet tea is good but if you want to step out try their horchada/rice almond milk with a sweet cinnamon spice..awesome! We drive 40 miles round trip to go here.  I'm glad it's not closer, we'd probably sell our stove.
One of my favorite Mexican restaurants. The shrimp fajitas are amazing!!!!! We always receive great service when we visit and my husband love their guacamole that they make at your table.

I am from Dallas, Texas transplanted to the Charlotte, North Carolina area. As an aficionado of Mexican cuisine, Azteca Family Restaurant Is the BEST Mexican food I have EVER had. You won't find your palate wanting when you eat here. The service is excellent and the management is second to none. 

Five-out-of-five stars, Azteca Family Restaurant is a six.
Bad service.  Had to ask for salsa three times.  Guys next to us came in 10 minutes after we did and got served first.  We walked out and won't go back.

I really enjoy coming to Azteca!!  Mexican is my favorite food and this place is awesome!!  Great food and great service!  And the prices are reasonable.  I have also been to the one on Woodlawn and it's just as nice!  The servers are always upbeat and friendly.  I would really recommend you come and try :) I will definitly be coming back!  I have many times!
Food was delicious! And that's kinda surprising since California we have tons of good Mexican restaurants. But I we are ever back in Charlotte we will be back here to eat again.

This by far is one of the best Mexican restaurants. I've eaten lunch and dinner at Azteca numerous times. I would recommend anyone to try it. I can guarantee you'll love it. There are a variety of choices on the menu, but may I also add the wait staff provides outstanding service. I eat here at least once a week. I wish this place got more recognition. I've had chalupas and deluxe burrito. Both plates are under $10, yet have more than enough food.

Top notch service, great food and authentic dishes, fresh guacomole cart that comes around... Atmosphere is very "touristy" but it plays well with the ambience. If you haven't been here, you need to come at least once!

Decent mix of authentic and Tex mex on the menu, in a place attached to a rather sketchy Days Inn. I ordered a Pacifico (on tap, no less!) and the chili verde with some corn tortillas on the side. 

Meanwhile I occupied myself with the chips and salsa. Chips were okay, a little thick and not eatm, but not bad. The first two rounds are free. The salsa (red) came in a small shallow bowl, so difficult to dip. The flavor was mediocre. I asked for something spicier so they brought me their tomatillo salsa which (.first time I'd seen it) had chilis de Arbol in it. Spicy, but good.

Then the chili verde arrived, accompanied by refritos and rice. The rice was a little dry and bland; the beans were delicious!!!! A little too good as I ate more than I intended. The chili verde was okay, maybe a slightly different style than I've ever tasted. The pork was tender and served generously; the verde sauce didn't reflect the tartness of tomatillo very much and really had a stronger oregano flavor than I've tasted in other preparations. 

Service was prompt and very friendly and the meal with beer and tip was less than twenty bucks. Worth checking out.

Chose Azteca over another Mexican restaurant nearby based on the reviews on yelp and I'm glad I did.  Sat at the bar and had a 32oz beer and chips and salsa in front of me almost immediately. 
Decided to order the chicken fajitas and they were delicious. After eating all of the chips and salsa, I ended up being able to bring home 2 fajitas.  I didn't get the table side guac, but I saw it made for 2 different tables nearby and it looked great. They also lowered the price from what some people are reviewing...$6.95 for one avocado and $8.95 for 2. 
Great place to grab some delicious Mexican food. Their lunch menu looked really great and cheap too.

The food was horrible, the service was worth. My 5 year old ordered a Quesada and got a taco instead. Spent 45.00 for LUNCH. On the LUNCH special menu. Tried to explain the food was inccorect and was insulted. Will NEVER return. Was refused when asked to speak to a manager. Do not eat here. Horrible.
Very friendly - excellent for large parties great Mexican food - large potions and their make at the table guacamole is amazing - family friendly

Very disappointed with food and service. I am rarely in the University area but went to Northlake mall a few weeks ago with a friend and decided to grab lunch here. I have always enjoyed Azteca off Independence. I had been to this location several years ago and it was ok but not this time. The server we had apparently had  someplace he needed to be or would rather be. He was very impatient when we were trying to decide what to eat. Once we decided the meals were not as good as in the past. I ate less than half of mine and the server never asked if everything was ok just came by and said are you done and took my plate. Oh well, not like I would be going back here soon but now I will certainly not recommend it.

This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in the Charlotte Area. Have been many times and always a good experience. The food and staff are always great. You must get the Guacamole made fresh at your table. Love it.

Meh...Three Amigos is my normal go to spot for Mexican food here in Charlotte.  But I was feeling a bit under the weather and decided to try this place out as it's closer to where I live.   Ample parking which I liked, but food a different story.  I ordered Small Combination plate with one taco & one enchilada.  I prefer care asada as my meat option, but I couldn't get it with this combo.  It's a different combination plate of 4 carne asada tacos 12.95.   So I choose shredded beef instead.   I did not try the guacamole.  The salsa tasted like hunts tomato sauce, and I didn't care for the shredded coleslaw they bring you.  Food came out and yes the portions are huge.  I ate very little.  Shredded beef tasted very bland in both the enchiladas and taco.   Rice I thought tasted mushy, but the beans were ok.  Won't be going back.  There are far better options for authentic Mexican food.  I'm sticking with Three Amigos.

Service was quick and friendly. Chips, salsa and "slaw" come right away.  I eat Mexican in some of the best places for it, so my rating more a "global" scale. For the Southeast, this place is above average.  First: salsa is ok. Pretty watery but good flavor. Chips seem house made-also good.   The "slaw" is very good. It's basically ceviche with no meat. 

I ordered carnitas. Pork of course-they offer beef and chicken carnitas, which is weird. The portions are very large and come on a huge plate. Rice and beans were as expected (surprisingly they are sub-par at a lot of places-not here). Carnitas normally are hewn from a large roast (can be fried). They serve 1"cubes. Not really traditional. Pretty good flavor, but if you like carnitas, these won't satisfy. Served with pickled onions. Good but odd. Should be lots of fresh onions and cilantro.  Also, there was more slaw, and excellent nopal (cactus) salad. Corn tortillas were store bought, probably all that is avail here.  Guacamole is good, but not enough provided. Overall good, but I would order something different next time

I have used Yelp for over two years and have never felt compelled to review a restaurant until now, mostly because for 9+ years I worked in the restaurant industry and understand the consequences of a negative review.  However, tonight, after my Azteca Mexican Restaurant experience I can say it was absolutely one of my worst restaurant experiences.  The front of house staff was decently friendly, as was the staff who brought out the chips.  I ordered take-out and sat at the bar so I could have a margarita while I waited.  The bartender, initially, was attentive enough, in that he took my food and margarita order.  After that the bartender was slack, hostile and subjectively waited on his patrons.  I was only able to get his attention to order a second and final margarita because I was sitting in front of the beer taps, he NEVER asked how I was doing or if I needed anything else, he simply dropped the check.  However, the patron sitting a couple seats down was repeatedly asked if she needed anything or if she was okay.  Again, highly subjective!  Throughout my wait, I heard him, hostilely, yell for the "bus boy," and use unfriendly rhetoric towards other staff members, while among restaurant guests.  Highly unprofessional.  All the while, he continued to only be friendly to the same guest and no one else!  Upon arriving home, which is approximately ten minutes from the restaurant, our food was soggy and basically inedible from all the juices soaking COMPLETELY through the tortillas (i.e. holes in the tortillas).  The salsa and chips were good; however, for $70 the quality of the food and margaritas is much overpriced!  For the sake of other staff members and guests of Azteca Mexican Restaurant, I hope that this was an isolated incident, but for me this is the only and LAST time I will visit this restaurant.

Pros - fresh

Cons - limited to 2 small baskets of chips (before charge), small entre, loud music. 

Taxco in Huntersville MUCH better!
A "hole in the wall" restaurant with really delicious authentic Mexican food and a wide variety to choose from :) The indoor decor was really beautiful too and the service was wonderful.
I ordered a fajita quesadilla and why I got was a fajita burrito swimming in a pool of fluid which caused the bottom to be mushy and pasty...quite gross!  Don't think I'll be back!!!

I'm almost afraid to give them a good review because I don't want everyone to crowd the place.

For a coworker and I, this is a weekly lunch stop.  We love the lunch specials.  For the price, quality, and quantity they can't be beat.

My husband and I just moved to Charlotte from Ohio and we have been on the hunt for a good mexican place. Needless to say we are still on the hunt. You would think the closer you get to Mexico the better the food, but that is not the case. 
When we got to the place, there was a long line so we thought we were going to have to wait but we got right in. There was a live band playing music which was very nice and set the mood. The service was very prompt and polite.
 The chips were just standard chips but the salsa was what I called onion soup with no flavor or heat, and they also served us with what looked like coleslaw. YUCK! I have been noticing that all the mexican places we go to have very soupy and or watery salsa which makes me very sad. My husband and I just got back from Cozumel and it was the most flavorful and thickest salsa you could ever have! 
I ordered small combination number one (Hard taco and enchilada) and it was inedible! The taco shell was soggy, I had the server bring me a new shell but that didn't help. The beef in both the taco and the enchilada was a low grade beef like taco bell but with no seasoning (Must be the lack of dairy farms in the area). The enchilada tasted like a soggy diaper! I couldn't bring myself to even eat it. The rice was dry and tasteless and both the beans and the enchilada came with some sort of yellow cheese on top... that tasted awful. The beans were also watery underneath all the yellow cheese. 
My husband got the chicken fajitas and we shared it. He seems to like all the food but he was a little tipsy from the very strong margarita. I thought the fajitas were just okay, the onion in them tasted like a sweet onion which i do not fancy. I ended up asking for more salsa because I was still hungry! 
However at the end they brought some sort or sweet tortilla dessert. I thought that was a nice added touch but not enough to make me want to ever go back. 
We paid 33.00 for 2 people and one margarita, so it was pricey.
Either way the hunt is still on for a good mexican place in the Carolina's.
Everything from this place was five stars. Food taste like heaven and the service is absolutely wonderful! Great place to have a great time!

I was staying at a hotel nearby, and most everyone says as Aztecca is the place to go for good Mexican food.  The outside is pretty lit up easy to find, inside looks like a typical Mexican place. The service was outstanding, however the food that I ordered fell a little short of my expectations. I Ordered the Carne Asada tacos, the upgraded one on the menu. When they came out the tortillas were soggy, I think they were supposed to be, but I just didn't care for that much. There wasn't a lot of Carne inside the tacos, and the pico de gallo was a strange lettuce combination that I also didn't very much care for.  The chips and salsa we're good however.

Very good food here! The plates were huge! 
The salsa was awesome! Horchata was delicioso! I'll definitely go back for a good Mexican meal!

We are there on a busy Sat night but were seated promptly. Service was excellent and food was out fast. Have to say everything was very good and was kicking my butt for having gotten an appetizer at the bar before going to the restaurant. Will definitely be on our go to list when back in town.
Excellent Mexican food! Good price! Complimentary sopapillas when you dine in. I recommend the Steak Torero. You're missing out if you don't eat there!

Azteca is my favorite restaurant!!! The food is always fresh and hot! The service is always excellent as well!!! The margaritas are on point!!! I use to order Arroz Con Pollo for years at Azteca on Woodlawn before the one near NorthLake Mall was built.  But ever since the one on Smith Corners Blvd was built, I am a more frequent customer because it's closer. Now I order Fiesta Jalisco. I am addicted.......you know I have to wash it down with a margarita or two!!!

Azteca has been a favorite of mine since way before Yelp, so I am disappointed that my first visit since that time was my least favorite.
I met my two best friends for what has become an annual before Christmas craziness dinner. 

 Azteca does have the best pico de gallo of any other place and our queso was delicious as well. My friends enjoyed to very delicious margaritas while I drank a cold Negro Medelo.

 Dinner is where I found my self a bit disappointed.  We all ordered combination plates, mine was the taco with ground beef.  Our service was slow for the night and my plate arrived warm with one side of my corn tortilla taco completely soggy.  

We had a very long wait for our checks which were split incorrectly and there was further confusion about how my one friend's visa was charged.  The waiter was was very appologetic and the situarion was resolved, but very awkward.

I am a great fan of Azteca, and I chalk this visit up to an off night.

Started with a virgin pina colada..the glass of which was humongous. But i loved it.. Their complimentary chips were fresh and crispy, the salsa was tasty too. We ordered the guacamole and this part is interesting : the waiter made delicious fresh guacamole direct from the avocado fruit, right in front of us :D :D. For the main course, i shared the enchilada , tostado combination with my mother. it was good..
I took away one star because being a vegetarian, all dishes come with the same same black bean filling. so apart from the presentation all the dishes taste pretty much the same. So for this I wont blame it on the restaurant but ya just doesnt make me want to give full stars.
Nice interiors, friendly waiters and good food.. u shud definitely go if in the area ..totally worth it..
Great place. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in the Charlotte area. I recommend the guacamole. Service, environment, and food were all great. 5 stars!

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant, and in my opinion the best one in Matthews and maybe even Charlotte. It has great food and never once has anyone I know been disappointed here. It's service is good and quick. The food is great and seems to be always fresh. Definitely recommended.
Food and prices were good.  We had two plates that had mushrooms, one with chicken and one with shrimp and were pleased with both.  And, of course, we loved the cheese dip!

I've never had a bad meal here. I love Mexican food, but I'm such a picky eater it's kind of difficult to choose something. The servers here are bilingual and some of them struggle a little with English, but they're always polite if they don't understand. They always manage to get my food right, also. The wait on all aspects of service are a little long, no matter if it's busy or slow.
First time and I can tell this place is very authentic. We got the cheesy bean dip and it was to die for! Shredded beef enchiladas were amazing! We will be back soon! :)
It is my preferred Mexican place when I want good Mexican food!  Have been going for close to the 11 years that I have lived in Charlotte!  The best Mexican food that I have had outside of Mexico

Great Mexican food!! This place is has great food, being from California you aren't going to find much better. Prices are fair and they have a great bar, I highly recommend a top shelf margarita vs the house as its just around a $1 more. I eat here at least 2-3 times a month and the food is consistently good. They have hand made fresh tortillas and have a cart that will come around to your table and prepare fresh guacamole. Sundays and Mondays they have live mariachi too.

The only complaints I would have is service is a little lacking once they get busy around 6pm and food maybe slow to come out as well. The inside as far as the tables and some of the decor could use an upgrade as they are pretty old and the benches at the booths are well used. 

On a side note, I'm actually surprised by any bad reviews here but I've been told by others that a certain manager doesn't work Mondays and things aren't the same when they are not around (Never been on a Monday so I can't say myself.)

 Just wanted to add one more thing anyone that disputes the authenticity of the food or  the quality of the food. Check this place out between 6ish and 8 in the evening and check out the amount of Hispanic people there if it were as bad as the 1 or 2 star ratings some of the people have given I don't think they would be eating here.

My husband and I are new to area and decided to try it out it took a long time for some one to come take our order the restaurant atmosphere and food was pretty good until that giant cockroach ran across my table and into the mini blind. We notified waitress but all she cared about was cashing us out we couldn't even enjoy our dessert I had to get out of there I was disgusted and itchy. I can never go back after that

Awesome atmosphere here.  They have a mariachi band, fresh ingredients for guacomole and salsa, great margaritas, and great food.  I had the pollo chipotle and it was fabulous.  Definitely a great place for your go to Mexican restaurant.

Our favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. The Fresh Margarita is not to be missed. The spicy salsas actually live up to their name; the table side guac is fresh and consistent; and our favorite dishes include Carne Asada Tacos, Expresso burrito, Pollo Poblano, and really most anything we've tried. Oh, try the bar area- Carlos and Juan will take excellent care of you!

Hubby and I decided to go for Mexican and stopped in for a bite tonight. We pulled up and it looked like there was going to be a long wait for a Friday night. The hostess got us seated in less then 10min which was FAB! We decided to get the chips and queso to snack on while waiting for our food to arrive. I ordered the mango margarita which comes in a huge glass, so be prepared to come thirsty. While we waited for our food I noticed they had carts going around making table side guacamole. How cool is that? -Wish I had read T.T.'s post before going. 

Food: My husband ordered one of the large specials... The plate was HUGE! I still have no idea how he ate the entire meal. I got a smaller plate the chicken chimichanga, very tasty, not the best I've ever had but definitely very good and authentic. 

Service: The waiter we had was fast and always seemed to be right there just when we needed something. He was very attentive. My husband is a tea guzzler and his glass was never empty. 

I do have to say that this is a very family friendly restaurant. Be prepared to see kids and people of all ages dining. I would suggest if you have a choice between Azteca and Montery I would definitely go with Azteca, hands down! Great people, great food, great ambiance!
This place is my absolute favorite! Been going here for years now. Their guacamole is on point, their Deluxe Burrito is the best and they have very good service.

Decor and staff were very nice, EVERYTHING else lacked luster.  Margarita poured from giant plastic container (not made fresh), tasting mostly of sour mix, bad tasting liquidy salsa, overly dried up rice, and WAY greasy tacos that completely fell apart.  Oh, and I asked for guacamole and it never came.  Would not go again.
The atmosphere and decorations are much better than the food. Not the worst place but not the best either.

I have been to Azteca in another location before, but 1st time at this location.  Excellent Mexican food, good service.  Always my favourite item is Chicken Carnitas extra spicy, and the food was within the normal wait time (around 30 minutes), waiter checked on us few times to refill water and chips etc.  Overall it was good experience.

I have been here for lunch several times, but we finally went for dinner last night - it was hopping! We each had a Fresh Margarita and it was delicious - made with fresh lime and orange juice. We ordered the fajitas (one shrimp. one chicken) and the Enchilladas Suizas. The portions are HUGE and we couldn't finish it all - try as we might. (No problemo! Leftovers are another meal in the future!) It was very busy with a mix of groups of friends to families to foursomes in booths. Obviously family friendly and very noisy, but not in a bad way. Will definately be back!

I had many wonderful meals at Azteca throughout the past year. But this past visit on 1/10/2017 my meal was horrible! I ordered a green chili pork burrito. What I got was a soggy, barely warm burrito with 2 pieces of meat and covered with sauce that tasted like watered down tomato soup. (Which I believe it was) The waitress was nice about it and assured me that was the correct sauce so I ate 1/2 of it. I felt ill the rest of the night. I won't be eating there again for quite some time

I have passed this place for over a year and the parking lot is always packed. The food was pretty good but for the $20 price tag for steak tacos I expected more. The portions were very large however so I guess that balanced it out. I was only able to eat half of my meal the portions were so large. I got 3 tacos and an entire plate full of rice. Only issue with my food was that the tacos were drinched in salsa to the point where they were falling apart (the salsa was just poured over the entire plate and not on each taco). 

As for the customer service everyone was very nice and polite. I would definitely go back here again, but just order something different.
The food is always great. The people are nice. Service is excellent. I've eaten there 10 times now and every meal was a good experience.

We have lived in Matthews 8 years and have been to Azteca several times but this last time was awful. We sat for over 20mins waiting for a server to take our drink order. 
We ordered cheese dip and it was brought out 3 mins prior to our entrees.   We asked the server for the cheese dip 3 times. 
My husbands food came out cold. The plate was hot the burrito was cold. When he told the server he asked if he wanted it really hot and brought back the same plate re heated in the microwave. 
He also took chips off another table and said they were meant for us but put on the wrong table. 
We did notice the owner asked several people input area about their meals but she did not do us. 
Very disappointed with our visit.

Right after we moved to Charlotte, I was talking to a local in a bar about how I wanted great Mexican food. He directed me to Azteca, and told me not to worry about the fact it was connected with a Days Inn.

That was 8 years ago, and after trying numerous Mexican restaurants in Charlotte, Azteca remains far and away our favorite. The food is delicious and the portions are huge for the price you pay. Service is always friendly and prompt. The restaurant is hopping on a Friday or Saturday night, and it's always a fun place to hang out. 

The mariachi band that plays on the weekend is a blast. On one of our last visits, they asked us if we wanted them to play us a song. We said sure, but we didn't know which one, so we suggested they play us their favorite song. They chose Elvis, which cracked us up.

My husband loves the Arroz con Pollo. I switch around dishes, but lately my favorite is the Pork Carnitas. For $11, you get a plate with so much food on it that taking home leftovers is a must. We've had nothing but great visits to Azteca!

I'm giving this 2 starts because of the terrible service. We have not had a refill on our drinks in over 15 minutes, waited for extra chips and still didn't receive our extra sour cream that we will probably be paying for on the bill. Not to mention while we're getting terrible service the servers are all gathering around chit-chatting. Don't sit at any of the booths by the bar. 

The food is great, guacamole is 5 stars, sweet tea is another good perk, wish I could have enjoyed this place and given credit to the food. 



UPDATE: went back and had the same person as our waiter lmao go figure. The food is amazing and the margarita's are strong. Our waiter definitely did better this time and didn't forget about us.
Love this place!  The cabbage salsa they serve with regular salsa and chips is delicious.  Great variety on the menu.

Summary: Excellent food!!! The guacamole was made right there at the table. The service was wonderful. The Marriott cheese band was great. I would go again.

My family and I were traveling through North Carolina. We decided to stop and have dinner at a Mexican restaurant. This one popped up on yelp it looked like a good place to go so we tried it out.

We shared the tres alteca and a Texas fajitas. The food arrived hot and fast. It was way more than three people should eat, but we tried. It was excellent. For new people going I would definitely recommend the homemade guacamole and tres alteca.

I love Azteca!  This location is large and bright, and is a great place for larger groups.  Although it always seems busy, I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated.  My favorite meal is the chicken fajitas, and the serving is more than enough to share with another person.  Service has always been fast and attentive.  Top shelf margaritas are generous with the liquor. ;) 

My only complaint is that they recently changed their chips and I really dislike them!  They are thick and seem stale.  But, I'll still go and skip the chips, and have the complimentary sopapillas for dessert.

I visited Azteca while I was in the Charlotte area on a business trip and I am not sure what the hype is about. I am from Texas and know real Tex-Mex and this is not it!!! 

I am rating the food 1 STAR and customer service/ambience 5 STARS.

Our waiter was very friendly and always had a smile on her face, I really liked her, but the food was very gross! My coworker and I shared the Fiesta Azteca which is a sampler platter and it was not very good. The chicken flautas were so dry drenching them in hot sauce didn't fix them! The potato skins were greasy and soggy, not crispy. And bacon wrapped shrimp were burned to prediction with a black charcoal taste! For a $26 appetizer, I was hoping for something more edible. 

Will I be back? Yes, for the margaritas! NO FOR THE FOOD!
Great atmosphere and awesome true Mexican eatery! It's tucked away in front of an old motel and doesn't look like much from the outside but do not let that fool you!!

I really don't understand why this place is packed at lunch time.

I ordered chili relleno and it's probably one of the worst rendition I have ever had. Rice and bean are average at best. Underneath the saltiness, the food was frankly tasteless. Salsa was very watery.

It was the first time I saw Shirley Temple and Roy Rogers on a Mexican restaurant's menu. Really?

I would give it zero stars if I could since I never actually ate the food other than the chips. The chips and salsa were good. The water was wet. That's about all i can say since we waited 35 min after placing our orders before we ever saw our waitress again. We only saw her again after my husband walked over to the bar to complain that we haven't even had water refills. The bartender was surprised but no apologies. We asked for a manager and only then did our waitress see him and run in the back to get our food. She blamed the kitchen for being slammed but once I touched the plate I knew she either forgot us or didn't care about her table since the plates and food were cold. 
We only get to eat out once a month due to budget and we weren't waisting our time or money here. Once the food was dropped off no one checked on us or the food. We walked out, left the food on the table. Again we only had chips, salsa, and water. They were not slammed or even busy. And no manager ever came out.
Love all of their locations. I always get enchiladas, and the meat is seasoned perfectly. Much better than other locally owned Mexican restaurants in Matthews or southeast Charlotte.

I'm only giving this place  2 stars because I liked their chips and service. Other than that I would give it 1 star. Yet another disgusting mexican restaurant in Charlotte. This place is  crawling with horrible food. well, first off I guess this isn't really Mexican food. My husband and I threw most of our food away. Way over priced!! I have no idea why anyone gave this place and Monterey good reviews. bad taste in food, I guess.

I went here for my birthday and wish I hadn't. The service sucked as my friend kept having to track someone down for chips, salsa, drink refills, and everything else. The ACP sucked in comparison to other places I've been.
Its ok. Nothing to write home about. Kind of cheezy touristy decor but some of the other reviewers seemed to like it. Struck me as kind of a Applebees over decoration in mexican theme.
They are crooks & bamboozled me for a meal that I did not even enjoy! Beware of their pricing and I will never eat there again!
Outstanding!  I have been to this restaurant many times and it only seems to improve every time! Service was great and the food was wonderful! Authentic Mexican food!

We decided to try this place. We have lived in Charlotte for 9 years always looking for good Mexican. Too bad on this place we had high hopes. Starting with the salsa. Absolutely no flavor. We also tried the verde salsa like water but spicy hot. No flavor. Then on the margaritas. Wow what a disappointment. 

Inside is nicely decorated and the service is fine. Prices are way too high especially for the quality.   Save your money and try another place.

My husband and I came here last night to grab a quick dinner.

Chips and salsa came out fast (with some slaw that we didn't eat). The salsa was decent. A bit runny but the cilantro in it was flavorful.

We both ordered margs, as they were on special. Huuuuuge drinks! Very tasty. I could probably have handeled mine a bit stronger :)

We got the cheese dip as an appetizer. Very large portion that probably could have fed 8 but, of course, we devoured! It was very tasty and a good consistency (aka, not super congealed white stuff!).

We split the shrimp fajitas for dinner. Definitely plenty for two! They came with rice, beans, a small bit of guac, onions, peppers, and shrimp. Slightly dissapointed in the refried beans cause they were fairly flavorless. Plenty of shrimp to go around!

A-Ok meal!
My burrito was decent and the service was really friendly. They give you free chips and salsa and a sort of dessert chip at the end which was a nice touch.

Every time I come to Azteca it's been a great experience.  Never have to wait too long to have a seat and the food is great. We go here a lot for birthdays because the food is so good and reasonably priced

Aztecs is typically a decent choice for Mexican food in this part of Charlotte. Waiting 20 minutes when we were told a 15 minute wait. When we went to check on the status they said we were never recorded for a table upon arrival. Promptly left.

Been eating here for years.  Mostly during lunch.  Excellent menu selection, great service and great tasting Mexican food for a chain restaurant.  Dinner meals are huge and you'll be stuffed when you or if you finish it.

Such. Good. Food.

Seriously...huge portions, good prices, friendly service, festive atmosphere. Love it!
Food is way too over priced for what it is too expensive and not worth it honestly it's a waste of money I'd rather go to el Valle or Monterey
Absolutely great Mexican food! If I am ever back in town in Charlotte, I will definitely go again. I highly recommend this restaurant.

My boyfriend and I come here all the time! Most of the time, we have William as our server. He is attentive and amazing at taking care of us! We will definitely be coming back for the amazing margaritas and food! 

Ask for William!

Don't sit at bar! The bartender Jorge was taking care of us and he was a very disrespectful man! He screams at us like if he was angry or did not want to serve us ! He seem very racist cause he was being rude to us but to a Caucasian family very friendly. The food was good but terrible service by Jorge! If they sit you in the bar just say NO!!

There are lots of restaurants to choose from in this vicinity, and I wanted to go out on a limb and try a totally new eatery.  My husband, though, preferred to walk across the parking lot from the hotel (after he swore that I could choose--but I digress).  Well, after a sangria and Pork Carnitas, I am so glad we went to Azteca.  The dinner portion is far too big, so I neglected the rice and beans to devour the extremely tender and flavorful pork in a warmed corn tortilla topped with pickled onions.  My husband had a bean burrito meal, I think.  Who knows?  I was busy with my delicacy.  He also drank tea and the bill came to $32.  It was delicioso!

The food is good- typical Mexican food- nothing special. Service should be improved. The waiters do not speak English. I was brought the wrong dish and overcharged for it. The manager refused to correct the mistake as it was my fault because "the waiter did not understand me". We live in America and I speak English- learn English people!

We also weren't given the sweet treat at the end of our meal like the other tables were. We didn't bother asking since our waiter probably wouldn't understand us anyway.

First time here with friends and it will be the last. Sorry, but the food was horrible. Don't  know how people give 4 and 5 stars. Chips and watery salsa, to start. My tableside guacamole lack seasoning just smashed avocado with some onions and cilantro. Nothing impressive. My shrimp cocktail had a lot of shrimp swimming in a bowl of ketchup and the ketchup was hot. Yuck! Last of all the Botana Azteca had bacon wrapped shrimp completely overcooked that if it fell from the table it will bounce. Also lack of seasoning. The other shrimp on the plate was also overcooked but it was so salty you couldn't eat it. $49.00 pls tip for nothing. The only good thing was Ubaldo our waiter very attentive. I will definitely  NOT be back.
.

Looked on Yelp before choosing the place for dinner -- and we're delighted that we did.  I can't imagine a more perfect Tex-Mex dining experience.  We had no reservations and walked in 7p on Thursday evening.  The Hostess welcomed us, asked how many.  When we indicated two, we were instantly whisked away to a two-top in the bar area.  Cozy and nice.  Less than a minute after we were seated, our server appeared to take our drink and appetizer order.  A minute after that the guacamole cart came by.  If you like, they make it at your table; pretty impressive.  We declined and a minute later the (generously sized) frozen strawberry Margaritas arrived.  We gave him our order for cheese dip.  A minute later it arrived and was a very generous-sized bowl of white queso w/jalapenos.  We gave him our dinner order and asked him to please wait a few minutes before entering it!  

The queso and salsa and chips were all excellent.  My best first measure of a TexMex restaurant: chips warm and fresh.

Five minutes later I caught his eye and gave him the thumbs-up to enter our dinner order.  Gael had the quesadilla appetizer (huge) and I had my standard two beef enchiladas.  Honestly, five minutes later we were eating.  Both our meals (and the Margaritas) were excellent.

I've never experienced quicker service or friendlier staff than here at Azteca in Matthews NC.

I asked to see the manager and passed on our compliments.  We always do that when the experience is exceptional.

When in the Charlotte area, we'll enthusiastically come here again!
The food and service are excellent.  The prices are very reasonable.  My only complaint is the drinks can be a little stronger. Try the Pork Canitas.

Got very full eating here. Food was great. Was surprised with the free dessert at the end. Got steak fajitas for $13 after tax. Would come back again. Waitress was really nice too. Chip and salsa were free too.
Worst salsa I have ever tasted. They also would not modify the menu to fit my request. What kind of place doesn't modify a menu for a customer. I will not return!

Within walking distance from many hotels in the area if your flight was cancelled. Open late. Great service. I recommend the table side prepared guacamole dip. Plates are HUGE! Food comes super quick. Margaritas are a must. The largest size came in what can only be described as a giant fish bowl.
I have to give this place 5 stars. The food here is amazing. The waiters and waitresses are great and always check on you. The quesadillas are my favorite. The atmosphere here is also good.

Holy mole!  This is some good Mexican food!  Probably not the most authentic in the world but still mighty tasty.  I've never eaten anything bad here and for a while, my bf and I were on an every weekend Azteca cycle.  I love fresh guacamole and they actually have a woman who comes by your table with all the ingredients on a cart who makes it right there in front of you.  You can even pick what ingredients you want more or less of.....light onions, extra tomatoes for me please!   We told our friends who have lived here for a while that we went to eat there and they had one word for it, "Epic!"  It may not be THAT good, but for queso dip, tacos, and fajitas it's an excellent.  Full bar, margaritas, and a decent beer selection.  An added bonus: the refried beans are actually slightly spicy and tasty, not brown mush out of a can.
Just like mom and dad used to make! Good food, great customer service. They were so good that I came back two nights in a row and I'm used to authentic Mexican food from Texas.

In town for work, so by myself and got it to go. Asked for a suggestion and was not directed to the most expensive thing on the menu. The staff was very friendly and joked with me while I waited. The food came out fast and hot. I ordered the sopa de tortilla, Arroz Con Pollo (extra spicy) and frijoles negro. The portions are very good and the taste was excellent. I will definitely be back!!

Terribly plain. Haven't been to this location in quite a few years, and now that I've gone back to order some takeout food, I will not be coming back. The chimichanga that I ordered had nothing on top of it when I had asked for everything that it came with except for the sour cream. There was a tiny little dab of guacamole on the side, virtually no lettuce, no tomatoes, and the rice and beans were so flavorless that I could've made it better tasting for myself at home. Next time I'll walk across the street to Sabor Latin Street Grill where they have much better food with much better flavor and a much lower price. Will not be coming back here again.

Went to Azteca thinking it was another place Ive to in the town I live in but it wasn't. When I walked in I thought I was in a Frida movie (watch the movie) everyone was dressed in authentic Mexican clothes the women had on Chiapas dresses and the men in don Quito minus the hats. The decor was very traditional and felt authentic . I almost felt like I was in Mexico. I was greeted by the manger and the staff as soon as I walked in . I got seated right away,my server from Venezuela (forgot the dudes name bit very polite and friendly)was at my table ready to take my drink order. I only ordered a beer and some shots. I was in town visiting a friend from my old neighborhood. I ordered the fajitas with everything steak,chicken and shrimp. The food was good nothing impressive about it or The restaurant. I will say the staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd definitely go.back when I comeback to Charlotte
The salsa was delicious. Full of flavor. Their meals are large. Our table of 5 took home as much as we ate. All the food was good and the staff was very attentive. Will mark this to come back.

been coming here for many years ... since they opened in what used ti house Mcguffy's, if that tells you anything.  Anyway, it's our go-to Mexican place.  The food is always good, and the service acceptable ( has actually improved in recent months as they've hired more people).  Take a look around ... lots of Hispanic people eat here.  That's got to say something.
Love Azteca!  Great atmosphere and good food!  Always a fun time with friends at Azteca.

When I think of good Mexican food in Charlotte, this is the first place that pops into my mind. I would've never thought to go to this place since it's randomly attached to the Days Inn but I went here on a whim a couple of years back and have been going ever since. They have fresh salsa along with warm, crisp tortilla chips and have a guac dude rolling around to each table if you so choose to indulge. Their portions are the size of a baby and they offer margaritas in different fruity flavors that are quite strong. I've tried different combos and like I said before, with portions the size of a baby, I often have leftovers. The nachos were amazing as well and were the size of a toddler and cheaper than my margarita (I found this very amusing) I've found service to better in the bar area when I go and you can't beat dining with Telemundo and ESPN in the background! They also give you free little cinnamon crispers topped with whipped cream after your meal. Yay for anything covered in whipped cream! Anytime I've gone there, the service and food are consistent which is a big plus in my world.

Boy, do I miss the salsa here!!! Actually, I really miss all of the food here.
I didn't discover Azteca until my last year of college when I moved to the Northlake area.

This was a frequent dine-in and take-out spot for me. The salsa was always on point with lots of cilantro and onions. I actually try to base my own homemade salsa on the salsa here. It's just that good!

The cheese enchilada has always been good here as well as the beans.
Everything here just always tastes fresh.

They also have massive burritos I've seen my friends order.

This is one of my favorite restaurants overall in the Charlotte area. It's also less gringo than some of the places in University.

Enjoyed eating here on Sunday with a group of 8. We were seated promptly when we showed up without making any reservations. The waiter was extremely helpful and was attentive. He came back every time someone was running low on drinks. We always order  the guacamole that they come around and make fresh and its some of the best guac I have tasted. The location itself is wonderful and the space is quite big and they utilize it well. 

The food itself is some of the best Mexican food I've had in the Carolinas. I constantly ask my friends "is it as good as Azteca?" I usually order the chicken carnitas or arroz con pollo and I have never been disappointed. When I used to live in Charlotte I would frequent here for lunch and their specials are excellent with many starting at around $7. 

Overall great place with excellent affordable food.
The service was terrible. The food was very basic. The quesadilla seemed like it was microwaved. The salsa for the chips was terrible, it tasted like onions. I'll never eat there again.

My family and I eat here on a regular basis. The food is always phenomenal and service is great. Juan is the best waiter, he is personable and makes you feel welcomed. He went out of his way to make sure we were all satisfied and went above and beyond. The food is seasoned wonderfully, this is authentic Mexican food. They have the best horchata in Charlotte!
Great Mexican food, ample portions.  I had a large burrito and sides were huge.  Friendly staff. Our group received a complimentary dessert.  Guacamole made tableside was delicious!

Staying at a hotel near by so I ordered my meal to go.  Cute place, seemed very authentic.  Next time, would love to eat there.  My entree was so delicious, I could not stop eating it.  Highly recommend you try it.  You will enjoy your food and you won't leave hungry!

The arroz con pollo is killer!  Get there early at lunch!  The lines can be atrocious.  Tasty margaritas are worth trying as well!  The service is always warm and friendly.  Come hungry....there's a lot of food on them there plates!
You've got to eat here! They have a Mariachi Band that plays to you on Friday nights... who doesn't love that? The guacamole is so good and fresh- made right at your table.

The chips were the best part about this place! 

The rice was terrible. Our meals were not great. 

The ladies room was out of order and strangely enough they seemed like they didn't want me to leave. They directed me to a shady bathroom past the servers, the dishwashers and cooks in the back. It was boiling hot back there with all kinds of smells. Yuck!
Awesome service and an amazing wait staff!! Food is always impeccable and presentation is wonderful!! This is one of our favorite restaurants! You will not be disappointed!!

Saturday night. Party of 20. My friend and I ordered: Super Nachos and Camarones con hongos. (Mushrooms). Good. We had a lot of fun. Singing Karaoke till they were  closing. I highly recommend the "Margarita". Pedro was a great waiter. Thank you Azteca. Definitely coming back!
Ps: you can't go and skip the guacamole with chips.
And there's more parking in the back.
from all the aztecas rest in charlotte this is the best one.  me and husband we are fun of all the aztecas, rest.  great service and delicious margaritas

Meh, I've had better. Went here for lunch the other day and the place was packed. Seated right away and was met by the server instantly with chips. There was a little man walking around with a make shift cart offering tableside guac. A little odd and pricey. $6 for one avocado or $8 for two...hmmm...ok. Not bad for price of tableside guac if the portion matched the price, which it did not.

Ordered the combo place of tostada, enchilada and taco. Came with typical rice and beans. The portion was HUGE! Could barely finish it and had to wait to start it because it was so hot. Hot like it was sitting under the lamp too long. Flavors were just ok. 

All in all, decent, though not a place I'll likely return considering all the other good Mexican restaurants around town.
Great place!! Delicious, fresh food. Great tableside guac. Big fan of the arroz con pollo. Great takeout too!!

Good Mexican food quick. Good prices and family oriented. The price is good and definitely will be back again. The tableside guacamole is cool too. I like how the staff is dressed up and they treat everyone awesome.
The food was good. Big plates, they barely fit on the table. Food was pretty quick. Kinda shady area, and small parking lot. You can park in the hotel parking lot.

This is probably the WORST customer service I have EVER received. Called and made a reservation for 15 on Thursday for tonight. They wrote it down for the complete wrong date. They then refused to seat us until our whole party was here even though THEY messed up our reservation. They told us they had a table for us and then gave it away even though they told us it was available for us. The woman at the host stand yelled at the host who told us our table was available in Spanish saying they couldn't seat us without everyone here and we were only missing one person. We have been here over an hour and still have not been sat and have had all of our party for 45 minutes. Bar service is awful as well. The guy totally forgot two of our drinks and didn't listen when we told us to split it. Never coming back and still haven't even eaten.
Edit: just ordered and my quesadilla came an hour later and wasn't good at all and my boyfriend's order was completely incorrect. No point in sending them back because they'll just spit in it. Never coming back.

I have to say that I am pretty disappointed. Service tonight was very slow, and frankly the food was totally unremarkable. I had the Tres Azteca, and while the flavors of the steak and chicken were almost alive, the shrimp was DOA - clearly overly freezer burned and rubbery, and had no discernible flavor.
I asked for *HOT* salsa to liven things up, but their offering was, again, fairly flat.

The flavors did not excite me, the service was tepid, the price was reasonable - but I won't be back.

When I went to check in on Yelp, I couldn't believe I haven't reviewed this place before. Azteca is one of the best Mexican restaurants on the north side of Charlotte. They have a traditional Mexican menu, with lunch specials as well. A great staff and quick ticket time, this is a great place for lunch and dinner. Highly recommend this place if your in the mood for Mexican food in the Charlotte NC area.

Based off of reviews we decided to try this place. First of all I have no idea why some people would be discouraged because it's connected to a Days Inn because it's basically it's own little Mexican place with cute outside seating too. The prices are great and portions are too! We split the large combo and added a taco to it and everything was awesome! We are huge Mexican fans and will be back!!

Not too happy with this restaurant. The portions are big but they give you more fat juice than meat. I ordered the chicken with sour cream which comes with green peppers, I did get a wholleeee bumch of peppers but not really any chicken, it was greasy and not really what I've had before with other Mexican restaurants. My wife's dish was good though, she had the chicken fajitas

The service was good!  But they literally brought my food out on a serving tray! Definitely worth the money! I got the Pollo Con Crema (sp) and It was delicious, so if you're ever riding down Woodlawn and want to get your belly full definitely stop by!!

Oh my god! The closest to authentic moms Mexican food I've ever tasted! I had a chicken & pork enchilada with salsa verse drizzled all over just like I like it. & surprisingly the beans which are bland at most Mexican restaurants, were very tasty. Five stars for really yummy not your average Mexican food!

I don't think I would describe this as authentic as much as what Americans expect for a  Mexican restaurant, but it is very 'Fiesta!!!"  in decor, with lots of tile, colors, booths and tables that can be put together for groups and large families.  Chips and sauces/slaw provided.  We've eaten here many times over the years.  Good value.  Portions are huge.  Table side guacamole is good.  Near the airport and a good place to  have a quick meal with friends who have a 2-3 hour layover.

I LOVE AZTECA!! It's a definite on Cinco De Mayo this place is packed and the Margaritas are HUGE!!! 

I love the hot fresh chips and they're salsa is good too!! I think this place is better than Cantina and it's definitely more authentic! I always get the same thing its a dish with shrimp and vegetables with rice and cheese sooooo good!!

The value that you get in unbelievable for 2 people it ends up to be $17 can't go wrong!!

Shady location but amazing food and service. Live music was very good. Makes you think you really are in Mexico or Cozumel! Bring your family and friends you won't be disappointed. One negative is parking is really limited
I always feel like I'm on vacation when I'm here! Such a fun atmosphere and great food!

When someone at work says "Mexican for lunch?" They can always count me in!

My coworkers and I arrived a little after before noon and the parking lot was already packed. I was pleased that even though the lot was full there was no wait and we were seated immediately. 

No sooner than we sat down we had a basket of chips and two different salsas. I really liked their salsa. I wasn't a fan of the chips because they were not served up hot but I ate them anyway because the salsa was just that good. Spicy and delicious...just like I like it. 

The menu had great variety and the prices were excellent! I ordered the Deluxe Taco Salad with chicken - It comes in a tortilla shell with tomatoes, guacamole, sour cream and cheese. 

Our food arrived so freaking fast! My goodness! What a major win for the very hungry lunch crowd! 

My salad was just okay. Don't get me wrong, it was not bad by any means and the portion size was not a problem. It was the tortilla shell. It was not crispy like I'm used too but that's just my personal preference. I still loaded it up with salsa and enjoyed every bite.  

For the prices this place is a great deal for lunch. I'd definitely come back, there's so much more I have to try...See ya soon Azteca!

Girl's Night Out= Mexican Night! Oh yeah!!! 

Azteca's always a good choice! The margaritas are big and strong ( as they should be) and the food is solid every time. I ordered a taco salad with chicken. It was a good dinner, we had a great time and if I'm in the area I'd stop here again!

This place is a scam! 
Even though they are busy, the quality of food is below par. We went there tonight for end of year celebration. We ordered a deluxe burrito and a paella Mexicana. 
The beef burrito was small and salty. 
The seafood in the paella was not fresh. They seemed to be frozen seafood. The mussels were rotten. The rice had a strange sour taste. Just disgusting for a $21 paella. 
Never again!!!
Great food. Has been awhile but need to return more often. The waiters and staff Are wonderful will return again. Ole

Growing up six miles from the Mexican border, I'm convinced "authentic" to me is not what others consider "authentic"! 
 
For being in North Carolina, thousands of miles from the border, this is pretty darn authentic by my standards!
  
It's a Sunday afternoon and the place is packed with hispanic families!  That's an automatic one star for me!!!  This usually means the food will be more homemade type Mexican food and less commercial like you would get at a Carlos O'Kelley's type place.  Then the guacamole cart comes around and fresh guacamole is made at your table!!  And BAM!  There's three stars!  The guacamole was AMAZING!!!  You get to pick all of the ingredients as well as how spicy you would like it.  

Then our orders of chile verde, a heaping ceviche (complete w Tapatio) and a combo plate of an enchilada and avocado tostada comes out just as we finish the guacamole!  Four stars!!!  The food is delicious, the wait staff is helpful and prompt.  Just when we realized we couldn't stuff out faces with one more bite, out came a perfect-sized portion of buenelos type dessert with strawberry sauce FOR FREE!!!!  And before you know it we are at FIVE STARS!  

We ate at El Charo in the same area a couple of nights ago and they don't come close to Azteca!!!  So ignore all of the stars El Charo got and go to AZTECA!!!!
Best shredded beef and fajitas i have found. Great atmosphere, fabulous service and i always leave happy.
Subpar to say the least... Definitely won't be eating here ever again. Very bland food. Blah.
Their nachos tasted like shit and i didn't even know that was possible. It was also expensive. Just stay away from this place.

Good meal tonight at Azteca.  This is our go to for good Mexican food.  Unlimited chips and salsa keep coming to the table.  The servings are large, so you won't go hungry. I like that they have the daily specials on display in the waiting area.  I'll be back.

Seriously some damn good food here.  The place looks like a total crapfest from the outside, especially being right there at a hotel in a dubious neighborhood, but trust me, once you go in the weird doors (the entrance always seems like it's in a transitional state of construction) you'll feel like you just discovered a hidden gem!

The not-so-good: If you're not with a large group, I recommend asking for a booth, because they tend to crowd the tables a little close.  Sometimes it feels like they're pushing you to join another party the way the tables get too close.  And then there's the waiters... I've gone here dozens of times, and at least 75% of the time I've had a weird waiter ogle me.  Even when I've gone with my father! They can be kinda shameless. Wear a turtleneck if it'll bother you that much.

And then there's the good.. which far outweighs the negatives: Their food is freakin' amazing, and plentiful!  Expect to get a big basket of warm chips & salsas as soon as you sit down.. They'll keep filling that up as soon as it empties, but save room for the meal- the food is the star here! Their shredded beef is spiced perfectly. (Most dishes come with ground beef, but they will upgrade if you ask - and it's a million times better!)  I love their flautas, and their enchiladas. (I'm a sucker for a good enchilada!)  I highly recommend their enchiladas suizas (green sauce and cheese- really really good).  There's really nothing bad on the menu, ever. And no matter what you order, their portion sizes are huge!  

Don't feel bad about being too full for dessert.. they'll still bring you a little sopapilla with strawberry sauce & whipped cream with your check! It's the perfect little ending to a fantastic meal!
Great authentic Mexican style food. Didn't know the price of my drinks, but they were well worth it. Had a great lunch...I'd come back again.

Absolute worst Mexican food I've ever had.  Carnitas burrito, the carnitas.. so bland and looked boiled.  The burrito itself was covered in some red sauce that reminded me of canned kids pasta sauce.  The sprinkling of shredded cheddar on top really put me off as well.  

The salsa for the chips was the same red sauce with some onions and cilantro.  Flavorless, worthless.  This place sucks

Working in Charlotte for a month. Stayed very close to Azteca and we couldn't stay away from this place it was good the 4 times we visited! I have been to a good 25+ mexican restaurants back at home in NYC and plenty in Texas, this by far the best I've had. 

Would definitely recommend, come hungry they have combo diners that are huge plates. Will need to be rolled out when your done eating lol. A+

Decent Mexican food.  Actually not all that exciting.  The burrito chicken is a little rough, though the other parts of the burrito/meal (cheese/wrap/guac/beans/rice) helped make up for that.

Also they gave out chips and salsa at the beginning and a cinnamon chip at the end, so that was nice.

All in all, ok.

This place is hustling and bustling when we first got here - always a great sign during lunch. I came here with coworkers and we were promptly seated. Chips were provided with salsa and a pico type topping. The lunch specials from 11-3 on weekdays were amazing. I ordered the shrimp fajitas and they were cooked well and it was very tasty. 

Will return.
I had the carnitas burrito. Was not expecting it to be in the Day's Inn but it smelled amazing so don't let that throw you off,

Great Mexican food with very large portions! I have never seen so much food in my life! The fresh guacamole made table side was delicious. They also had some different things that you don't normally see at Mexican restaurants such as a salsa/pico slaw with the chips and salsa and also a slaw with the combination plates. They also have a free cinnamon tortilla chip with whipped cream and strawberry at the end! I would definitely return!

My wife and I used to have dinner here at least 3 times a month, but the last couple of times have really let us down. The very last visit was it for me. The food quality is horrible and they try to make up for it with huge portions. I ordered a dish with steak and they asked how I'd like it cooked. I requested rare but when it arrived it was well done. The rest of the meal was just as disappointing, so do yourself a favor and pass this place by.

Rip off. You must specify "the margarita on special" they advertise a drink special, you ask for that drink, they bring you the bigger version and charge you that price. When questioned, I was told there was no special. It's on the website and their board at the entrance. Manager no help. Says he'll talk to bartender to make sure it doesn't happen again. No offer to refund the additional money charged. Food definitely isn't worth all the trouble.

The first impression was a good one.  The host led us to our table and I couldn't help but notice the murals of Aztec leaders and ancient designs painted on the walls.  The dining area has a warm and inviting feel.  Festive music can be heard but not too loud.  After being greeted by a waiter in traditional garb they immediately brought us their house chips which are light and crispy and they'll bring as many as you can eat.  

The salsa is watery, chunky, lacks any kick and I didn't find the pico de gallo appetizing either.  But the guacamole is made fresh table-side by a charming woman who doesn't speak much but smiles a lot.  You get to choose how spicy and whether you want onions, cilantro, lime, or all of the above.  She then muddles it in a stone serving dish and lets you taste-test it before she sets it on your table and moves on.

The ground beef tacos are too greasy.  But the flank steak in the Tacos al Carbon is sublime compared to the other items I've tried so far.  The menu is huge so there are still plenty of items to try on return visits.  For the value and down home atmosphere it's a great alternative to the other high (snooty) and low (scary) Mexican restaurants around town.

This is my favorite 'dirty' mexican restaurant. I say that meaning the type of mom & pop Mexican place you think of with the combo meals that have a variety of things with rice and beans.... not your "upscale" mexican like Cantina. 

Food is always good, and comes out pipping hot! Huge portions, and they have a great little patio area for the nicer weather months! Parking is a little weird though, most of it is back by this sketchy motel.
During lunchtime. Very good. Chicken soup some of the best I have ever had. The pico great also.

Worst experience 

After waiting for an hour we left, the team is giving priority to friends 

Very upsetting and disappointing

Loved this restaurant
the fajitas were fantastic
the waiter was wonderful
Loved the band
Great atmosphere
thanks

Food was not even close to being authentic Mexican.  I have never had mexican topped with cheddar cheese.  We had 3 people in our party and they gave us 1 very small bowl of salsa and when we asked for another one we were told there would be a charge.  Terrible food and service and kinda pricy.  Would not recommend.

Absolutely terrible service! Yes, they seat you quickly, but the menus were thrown on the table and the server just left. Didn't ask if we wanted a drink or anything. They actually didn't say a word to us. The waiter took forever to serve us and never came to check on us to see if we wanted or needed anything else. I really wish I could have gotten his name, but maybe it helps for the establishment to know that we visited on 2/25/2017 around 8:30pm and sat directly across from the kitchen. When the waiter finally came back we asked for the check and waited a long time again for him to come back to the table. We were ready to leave and late for a meeting with some other people, so we decided to go to the counter to pay, but wow, he sure was quick that time to come to our table to tell us to pay at the table after waiting a lifetime for him to show up! Apparently, he thought we were trying to leave without paying! I was livid and have never been treated like that before! Good Lord! We didn't want to spend the night there! 
     I came here upon recommendation from some of our employees who like to eat here, but it is definitely not a place I care to ever visit again and I certainly would not recommend it to anyone that I know. We were treated like dirt! It doesn't help that it is also located in a sketchy part of town. The only thing good I can say about this place is that the food was OK. 
     If you are interested in great tasting Mexican food in a better area with better service, try Salsas in Steele Creek. Better service, better & safer location and a more pleasant staff. There are also many things to do nearby that you can walk to, safely.

I have yet to find any amazing Mexican in the Charlotte area, but Azteca was pretty darn good. The atmosphere is really fun and inviting with all of the decor of a Mexican joint. The waitstaff is all dressed like bull riders and a man comes by with a fresh guacamole cart if you want some. The chips and salsa were great and plentiful. We also got the cheese dip which didn't disappoint. The chicken enchilada and shredded beef taco were both very good. The meat was clearly fresh. I was disappointed with the chile relleno. My boyfriend loved his food (we got the same thing). They give you a little free dessert thing at the end which is a nice added touch. The service was amazing and fast!

This is one of our favorite Mexican spots which is pretty consistent. Their chips are hot and salsa is pretty good,  I really like the fact that the queso ( white cheese dip) comes in a bowl size fit for sharing. For ex, Cabo's comes in an ittybitty  small as a finger bowl. It  is $5, plus it too runny for me. Anyway, Azteca's servers have always been attentive and quick for our needs.
