The food is reasonably priced and portions are nice.  He loves the chicken and shrimp fajitas and I really like the Pollo Poblano. Here, it is just right &  not too sweet like some other spots.

Brought some out of town friends here last night. Got to the restaurant around 7:10 or 7:20.  Waiter was so in-attentive it was embarrassing. It took forever to get water, then drinks, then refills. Most Mexican places serve your food so quickly you barely have a chance to enjoy a basket of chips. We went through 4 baskets and waited an hour for our food, keep in mind I took forever to get chip refills. 

I like to think I have appropriate expectations for food quality and service on a $10 meal but this was terrible. This was our 2nd time here and we won't go back!  Waiter was very rude and unaccommodating.

Love love....love Azteca. Their made to order Guac is the best.  
    I've eaten here quite a few times throughout the years and have yet to be disappointed. Their Carne Asada is delectable as well as the Arroz con Pollo. 
    I highly recommend the margaritas too!
Azteca is great for large groups because of it's lively atmosphere.

I give this a 5 star for a Mexican restaurant that you don't have to speak Spanish in order to eat here. Being part Latino, I'm used to a little more traditional style of cooking and  Azteca does not disappoint. 
As far as the Guacamole, let me just say that my boyfriend will not touch the stuff at other places or at home but LOVED Azteca's. I have to admit, it was better than my mothers, and that says a lot. It is pricey for Guacamole but well worth it. If all you eat here is this then you're far ahead of other Mexican restaurants. 
I usually eat Arroz con Pollo or Carnitas which are always great. On my most recent visit I had the Carne Asada. IT WAS HEAVEN! The carne was juicy and very flavorful and the mixed grilled vegetables were a nice surprise compared to what other places give you. 
The ambiance is great and I don't think they have a single unattractive waitress there. The bar is a good place to start as it's in the center of the back part of the restaurant and they make a frozen margarita that is Muy Deliciouso!!! 

Only gripe.......it's not close enough to my house!
We went there to celebrate my friends birthday, and they didn't even come to our table but once. It seemed like they completely forgot about us. No celebrations were had, not even a "Happy Birthday"

Ordered the taco and enchilada lunch special with rice and beans. The food had no seasoning and was flavorless. The chips were served with salsa which was OK. Service was good. Probably won't come back here again and will head to La Unica or Monterrey in the future. The decor was nice inside but didn't make up for the disappointing, bland fare.
I love this place! They have the best fajitas, very flavorful! Also, the staff treats you like family. Best Mexican restaurant I have been to by far!

The pros:

- Good service.  The hostess was friendly and seated me promptly.  Though my friend hadn't arrived yet, there was no prob to get a table and wait at the the table.  Throughout dinner our server was courteous and quick.  We also had, who I think is a manager, check on us a couple of times, and made sure we were ok.

- Fresh guac - As Dave S. pointed out (and thank you for the rec on this place!) there's a guy that goes table to table and offers fresh guac.  We sampled a bit and really liked it, so he served us a fresh bowl of it.  It's creamy, fresh, and very good!

- Basket of tortilla chips and salsa - The tortilla chips are right out of the oven, and are warm & crispy to perfection.  They serve them with a small bowl of salsa and a small plate of salad.  It took a lot of self control to not inhale the whole thing!

The cons:

- Few vegetarian/vegal options - The menu only has about three things to select if you're vegetarian and/or vegan.  Also my cheese enchillada was very bland and was brought out without any sauce on it, which was kind of odd.  I've had cheese enchilladas at so many other Mexican restaurants and they always serve it with salsa verde or standard red salsa, in this case I had to ask for a side bowl of red salsa.

- Mariachi Band - Ok, they're not a total "negative" but it was a little distracting having them blast their music at our table right when my friend showed up.  We hadn't seen each other in 2 years and were ready to catch up but all we could do was shout at each other b/c the band chose to perform right at our table.  As soon as we answered their request of what type of song to play, and they played a good chearful piece, and after we tipped them, they left, then we could actually eat and talk without raising our voices.  But the music was good and they were a nice group, so it's not all bad, just not great timing on their part.

Verdict:

I'd probably go back here if I was in the area, but not likely to go out of my way.

Tucked away near Northlake Mall, you can find yourself some pretty good Mexican food. Fellow Elite friends recommended Azteca, and it was a hit! The food was delicioso -- good chips, great tacos, your choice of black beans or refried beans with your meal, and excellent rice as a side. Good drink selection and fair prices. Nice but not huge outdoor seating area. Great service and friendly staff. Obviously popular with the families, but don't rule it out if you're younger and unattached! This is definitely a good option when you're in the area and jonesin' for a quesadilla and margarita.

I'm not a huge Mexican fan, but I always have a good time when I come here! (Go on Fridays. That's when the mariachi band comes :D) A little after we were seated, the mariachi band came over to our table. They asked if they could play a song for us. OF COURSE YOU CAN!! But umm.. we didn't know what song to request so we asked for a "happy" song haha (I guess I should brush up on my latin songs beforehand next time lol) They were so sweet! Near the end of our meal, they came back to ask if we would like another. Of course we said YES! Don't forget to tip btw :)

There was a birthday party beside us and the servers embarrass the birthday girl/boy with a sombrero hat as the mariachi band gathers with birthday songs :) It is a great place for birthdays. The space isn't that big, but they can accommodate large crowds. Plus, being here always makes me more cheery!

Amazing amazing amazing Mexican food. The special menu has real Mexican food, just like you get in Mexico. (Not the American version of Mexican food) The staff was super friendly and actually knew the best food to order. Get the guacamole made at your table, it's incredible. All in all I will make Azteca a stop for lunch or dinner every time I'm in the area!! Fantastic!!!!!

Charlotte, NC seems to have a problem (at least in my part of town) with Mexican restaurants that have decided to go upscale and charge you too much for the simple dishes we all know and love.  Azteca hasn't gone this route at all.  In fact its basically in the lobby of a Days Inn.  Thank you for protecting what Mexican food really is Azteca.

Ate dinner here with my Father, my wife and kids.  The waitress did a great job.

I had the Baja Fish Tacos.  Excellent! 

My 5 year old had the chicken fingers and they were very good as well.

For some reason it was very smokey the whole time. Perhaps their kitchen draft hood was having issues.

We will  be back.

The best advice I can give you is watch your account if you pay by debit or credit. An extra $1 was added to my purchase when I looked online. I guess they figured most people wouldn't notice. Of course  $1 is no big deal, but it's the principle of it that leaves a bad taste in my mouth. Not to mention bad business practice. 

The food itself was pretty good, but the portion size wasn't particularly the best. I am a big fan of chicken fajitas, so I already anticipate restaurants putting more onions and peppers than anything. But here they put a VERY little amount of chicken. Much less than any other place I have been to.

Impressively consistent poor service.  Been there 12 times but the tasty guacamole and carne asada can only distract me for so long before I break! They are downright mean and lazy.  Go to Don Pedro.  Same corporate owners and recipes but better staff.  'Nuff said!

Ok so we were refried bean boozled!!!! My husband usually doesn't complain BUT tonight he had a whole lot to say! The wait wouldn't have been so horrible if we actually had somewhere to wait. 

Got seated at our table and served cold stale tortilla chips, but the guacamole made table side was good.
Didn't get our drinks until about 12 mins later after being seated ( who doesn't give free refills on shirley temples anymore?) Food came out and it wasn't worth the wait! 

Don't know how they received the 4 star rating I really don't see how this qualifies as such.

Visited Azteca for a birthday celebration on Cinco De Mayo which means it was super packed and busy.  We waited almost an hour for our table.  The service was really not that great.  We had to ask for things multiple times and gave up after they never gave us hot sauce.  On the flip side, the food is cheap, with many entrees less than $10 that will more than stuff any person, so that really cancels out the bad service.  All in all, it was OK.  I've been to the one on Woodlawn and had a much better service experience, but maybe it was different because it was on Cinco De Mayo.

You can get a "free t-shirt" with a margarita, but the margarita is $11 which is more than most entrees, so it's really not that great of a deal, but still fun.
It's ok. Tables are half the size of an average restaurant table. I guess they did this to maximize space within the restaurant. The beans and rice were very, very good.  Also, a bit pricy.

Our group of 8 ladies really enjoyed dinner on August 19th at 6:00pm. I ordered the Chimmichanga with shredded beef, came with re-fried beans with cheese and rice. It was steaming hot & very good. All  our dinners were served within 10 minutes which I thought was great with all the various orders. Our waiter was most pleasant despite a few confused "seniors' in our group! It was my 1st time here and at the end of dinner, he brought 2 small plates with sophapias with strawberry glaze and a dollop of whipped cream that was delicious. Great little extra to top the dinner off. 

I will return!
My shrimp ceviche was enormous and very good. Service was great, everyone made sure I enjoyed everything.

Great service n good lunch choices
Very little wait time til you receive your meal
Cheerful n friendly wait staff

I wasn't even in the mood for Mexican. I just needed a place to grab dinner near my hotel on a national holiday, and this place fit the bill. Wow - it is surprisingly good! Charming decor, good service, really fantastic carne asada. So happy that my hotel is way over on this side of town and that I stumbled across this place. :)

Excellent Mexican food. Glad I looked at Yelp first. Staying nearby for a couple of nights. Read the good reviews and decided to try it. Granted, it was late on a week nite but the service was excellent. I had the chorizo burrito which was fantastic. I don't see chorizo served at a lot of Mexican restaurants. 

Well done!

Clase, lo dice:

Buenos Dias.

Me llamo Daniela.

Como esta usted.

Quiero comer en Azteca.

Quiero comer en Azteca todos los dias.

Okay, maybe not todos los dias because I would be as big as una casa but frequently. I am a seafood enchilada junkie and they are not a common in charlotte as I would have thought. Azteca serves up a mighty delicioso set of two Enchiladas de Camaron with an 18-wheeler's worth of rice and beans (the tasty ones, not the ones that taste can-y). Add the standard basket of chips and salsa, but with pico de galo and additional hot salsa (you may have to ask) and complimentary sopapillas and you are bound to be both happy and unbuttoning sus pantalones when you leave.

Does it have a hint of standard American Mexican restaurant to it? Si. But its tasty and satisfying.

I suppose there are both pros and cons in having a pretty solid Mexican restaurant right up the road from your home. The obvious pro being the accessibility to great food and drink (generally Dos Equis or Modelo for me), followed swiftly by the obvious con of un-doing your exercise routine for the day. 

But in any case, I generally enjoyed this restaurant with the exception of cost. In the grand scheme of things, it isn't necessarily pricey. It is generally comparable to other Mexican restaurants. For me, if I'm looking for a quick, around-the-corner Mexican restaurant- this is definitely the place to be. If I'm looking to penny-pinch, I'd drive a few minutes down WT Harris towards the university and hit up Zapatas (my absolute fan favorite). 

I generally liked every other aspect of this establishment. The atmosphere and décor were set perfectly for a Mexican restaurant. Good ambiance. The food was well prepared and was pretty delectable. Beer was flowing. The service was spot on. What more can you ask for really? 

There were specials here, which most looked appealing. 

Definitely worth a try!

My wife and I love this place, it is off the beaten track, which means no waiting, and the noise level is low.  The food is delishly, outstanding, I love it all (except for refried beans, I don't like refried beans is why).  The vegetable are fresh and and the food is served piping hot, nothing sits under a heat lamp.  The wait staff is very courteous and friendly.

I've been to Azteca a few times, but this review is about our most recent visit on a Thursday night. When you pull up, it usually leaves people scratching their head as it is next to a days inn that has seen better days. However, don't be deterred! I've seen other yelpers tag it as "dirty Mexican", which is what my wife and I jokingly call it as well. What you get is a pretty authentic experience with some really simple and delicious Mexican food (think meat, rice, beans, sauce). 

We pulled in late (~10 PM) to grab a quick dinner and ended up sitting outside on the patio. They have a decent drink menu to go along with their expansive food menu (also be sure to check out the menu full of photographs for a few kicks) and I ended up getting a 32 oz sugar creek pale ale that was on special - I soon realized my mistake when the massive glass hit the table as I don't do math well (almost 3 beers!) after 10 PM. We ended up splitting a fajitas plate as the portions are huge and even I couldn't finish one myself. 

The staff is always super friendly. I had flashbacks to our travels to central america as the waiter's common responses come in Spanish and he tolerated/helped me with my poor broken Spanish. There is a bit of a culture gap here, so you may have to work to get your bill. I ended up closing up at the front due to the late hour and they were closing down. 

All in all - a fun place to go and grab a simple but tasty meal!
This place was awesome! Really great service and the food was delicious! Would recommend the chicken fajita quesadilla and the coco margarita! Both were soooo good!

Stopped here because it was close to our hotel, very glad we did!  First things first, the staff.  We were greeted immediately by a friendly young lady, and then every member of the staff we walked past on the way to our table said hello.  It is a big comfortable restaurant, very simply done.  The menu is large, something for everyone's taste.  Our sever was with us immediately and we had our drinks in minutes.  Complimentary chips and salsa (with pink chips) were very good!  We both ordered a taco salad and it did not disappoint!  Large portion of ground beef in a tasty shell!  Our beverages never went below half, and as a plate was finished, it was removed.  I couldn't leave without trying the flan, another excellent choice!  We left feeling full and had two drinks, chips and salsa, two taco salads, and a dessert for less than $24.  As we were leaving, every member of the staff we walked by said goodbye and thanked us.  In a time when it is difficult to have employees pay attention to you (because they are on their phones or talking to each other), that was definitely not the case here!  Nicely done!

The food was okay, but I sat at the bar and my service was terrible. I had to ask for chips and salsa 3 times. I got my food before my chips. I asked them to make fajitas spicy and for some reason it was sweet? WTF?
I asked for hot sauce and did not get it, until a waiter that was cashing out noticed and brought it to me. I tipped that waiter that who was nice enough to take care of me 5 times more than my actual waiter.

Good value and service.  Fajita order was easily shareable and a bargain at $12.95.  Burrito wasn't huge but good flavor.  Chips were  very good.  Seemed more substantial than most places. Would  go back again based on the price.

I love the food here. I come here often. The dishes are large and there is always some leftover to take home. I always order the Mexican stir fry which is chicken and lots of mixed veggies. My girlfriend always gets different dishes and I eat off her plate. The staff is friendly, the beer is always cold and the music is lively. We always end with fried ice cream. I love love love my fried ice cream.

Feels like home.. no, not Mexico! California!

Very authentic Mexican style food. Love the salsa and the tableside guac. My enchilada suizas plate was HUGE. Really tasty and the people who work there are so sweet.

It's connected to a Days Inn - so can look kinda shady, but its definitely a family place you can go for a huge margarita and some yummy Mexican food.

We had a group of 10 in town for an event on Friday night. Found this place for dinner on Thursay and everybody was glad we did! First it is the real deal, the staff could not have been better. Everyone's meal came out together and was great. Did I mention that it was a terrific value because it sure was. If you have the opportunity to stop in do it.
Not your mom's arroz con pollo.  But a suitable alternative.  Nice variety on the menu if you are looking for a little more than your typical Mexican favs.

I eat lunch here once a week and occasionally twice. Prices can't be beat - particularly the lunch specials - and the quality is always excellent. Great service and excellent value for the money. Azteca's food is always delicious - I don't think I've ever had a bad meal in the 5+ years I've been frequenting the place.

Hmmm, well here this goes....

For starters, very fancy beautiful, colorful restaurant. Fast paced and steadily busy from what I see. 

I've been here a few times.  The menu is huge with selections /dishes. The downside from this place in comparison to other Mexican restaurants is this place is pricey on their menu. I can get the same quality of dishes for lesser price somewhere else. 

With that being said, they have some of the best Queso in the area!!!. They serve you a huge bowl for $5.50. I am particular over salsa. I personally enjoyed theirs. It's full of onions, cilantro and peppers drowning in a garlicky tomato puree. My husband didn't quite like but he's no fan of onions as I am. The Chips are just ok. 

The service was decent,  no complaints.  

I may return someday when I forget that I don't like the flavor of their steak or the Tostado soup was not chicken broth tasty. For presentation. It looked awesome! The taste just didn't sit well with me. Maybe on a Queso quest, I'll be back!!!

A defining trait of a good Mexican restraint can be found in their salsa. This salsa falls short, tasting like tomato soup with some chopped onions in it. And if you find yourself not a fan of this watery red liquid, well to bad. Because, you are about to see that exact red sauce on every plate that comes out. That's right, enchiladas covered in the "salsa" , burritos drenched, fajitas swimming in it....they put it on everything with a shameless pride. Also beware Saturday nights, it is Spanish karaoke night, and the music "horns mostly" are turned up to ear splitting levels. A request to turn it down and be able to hear the person across the table, will be met with a smile and an "okay" without any results. Send three people and it'll still be a smile and an "okay" ...which is how I would feel if the manager came up and asked me how my meal was. (Smile) "it's okay"

Service here is not good at all. I came Tuesday evening at 9pm with a friend and we wanted some good Mexican food. We got greeted fine and sat close to the bar area and a older gentleman tried to take care of us. The aguas frescas were ok. We put in an order right away because we were really hungry and waited more than 45 minutes for the tres Amigos plate. We just decided to leave because we stayed hungry the whole time. No extra chips or salsa were given to us. Do not recommend this place at all
Me and my sister go here for her birthday it is authentic and fresh, my favorite salsa pico salsa, once you have tasted here you will never go back to Taco Bell.

My best friend and I came here Friday for dinner. I had the small portion of their chicken fajitas it was ok. The service was also ok I can say that they have good chips and salsa. I'll be coming back to this restaurant

Azteca is suprisingly a great place to take a huge group for lunch.  They're speedy, you can call ahead and reserve a giant table, and they don't complain too much about haveing 20 seperate checks.

I normally order something small off the lunch menu, because I inevitably fill myself up with chips and salsa before my lunch even comes.  I always save room for the desert at the end!

Pro tip: if you're trying to get out of Azteca to head towards Billy Graham, go out the back of the parking lot to come out at the light.  Making a left onto Woodlawn is just plain crazy.
Very delicious food. Great bartenders and servers. Muy delicioso! The shop is conveniently located. Lots of good choices for the beer and a good margarita if you'd like. You can't go wrong here.

Came into town to do some shopping. Ate hear because we love, love mexican, however they charge for chips and salsa after 2 baskets, they don't put cheese dip/sauce on anything without an upcharge. Even normal dishes that should have it. Because let's be honest that is the best part about mexican food. The chimichangas and rice where dry. It was also really expensive for mexican. $15-$20 a plate. Not ideal for the mexican food I was served. I'm not bashing, just trying to help out fellow yelpers.

I have been coming to Azteca for over 10 years and they never disappoint.  This is as authentic as Mexican cuisine gets ,as I know, in Charlotte. I have tried to go to other peoples go to spots and they just don't compare to the amount of flavor that Azteca has. They offer you salsa, slaw, and chips with each meal. The choices they have are endless. You cant go wrong with anything that comes with their refried beans and rice, it is LIFE. Margaritas are great. Its my tradition to come here every cinco de mayo (get their early, its everybody else's idea too), but they always have shirts with a margarita purchase every cinco de mayo and it makes the experience that much more fun. They end your meal with a little sweet dessert of a fried cinnamon chip.

My first meal at this restaurant was sitting at the bar.  I had the shrimp fajitas and enjoyed them tremendously. Flavor was great. The service is very attentive at the bar.

We went back the same week and had the shrimp fajitas again.  Again I really enjoyed them.

Then we went again a couple of days ago and shared the chicken nachos.  There was plenty of chicken for both of us.  The flavors all worked together.  There was a good balance of all ingredients including cheese, guac and sour cream.

Want some chicken soup to brighten your day?  They got it and you should, too.  Very good and oh, so much chicken.  Azteca has also a wide variety of Mexican food and is more than your average "chicken, rice, and beans" joint.  I think their food is done well.  Best Mexican ever?  No.  That doesn't exist in Charlotte.

About the only thing I dislike is their parking--very crowded (and yes, weird parking at the motel).  Other than that, I say "give 'em a whirl!"
The arroz pon collo was a great dish! The plates full of chicken and veggies to fill you up! Make sure to ask for the soft shells to go with it!

This is my 2nd time I been here. I feel like if you're looking for authentic Mexican than this is the place. At one point in the past, they have a station in the restaurant in the front that they make tortillas from scratch. But since they gotten soo popular and demand is high that it's impossible to make it from scratch up front. 

I ordered the shrimp fajitas with corn tortillas. I really really like it.. The green and red peppers with the onions were perfect. The shrimps was not overcooked and plenty of it.. Corn tortillas came warm.. My company ordered chicken fajitas and 3 beef hard shell tacos. They finished their meal and smiling so I'm assuming it must be good. We were starving so there wasn't much talking at all. 

The gentleman that was waiter did his job. Did his thing! I wouldn't say he was on top of thing but he manage.. But he wasn't bad either!! 

Overall I would love to go back and try a few more things on the menu. But knowing me, I'll get the shrimp fajitas again!
Great service, big portions, affordable prices. I love the queso and enchiladas! My go to mexican spot in North CLT.

The food here is great. There is a Mariachi band that plays Friday nights that is really fun! But don't waste your money on a pitcher of margaritas. They are not very strong, and very sugary! Probably go for a single top shelf margarita if you do!

My wife and I ate the tacos here and were very disappointed. The soft shell tacos seemed to have been dipped in oil. They had grease dripping off of them. The meat in the tacos weren't very good either. The ambiance was nice though. The waiters were very friendly.

Basic boring Tex Mex, but hey the place was packed. They know what brings them in, so who am I to judge.  

There were some nice touches that bring it up a notch or two over similar restaurants - generous use of cilantro, pickled onions and cactus salad with the carnitas - but they were negated by the over cooked carnitas meat, packaged corn tortillas and tasteless Huevos Rancheros. 

The restaurant itself is huge and colorfully appointed; service is very good. The bill for lunch was very inexpensive. Despite everything this is actually one of the better choices around Northlake; but that says more about the dearth of good dining options in that area.

This Mexican food is absolutely AMAZING. I had to scoop up my brains off the floor and put them in a doggie bag because my mind was blown. My assumption is there is an underground grow room with avocado trees as the table side magician making the guacamole has the freshest avocados ever to be grown. Post guacamole heaven we moved on to the entrees. I honestly don't even know how to put this into words. I ordered the deluxe burrito with rice and refried beans. "Deluxe" is the biggest understatement I've ever heard. This is the mac daddy Mercedes Benz shut your freaking mouth and say "ah" burrito. Chicken beans rice tortilla salsa sour cream guac tomatoes lettuce all checks across the board. Lastly let me say the house margarita with salt on the rim is like Jose Cuervos gift to man to enjoy with a meal suitable for the last supper. Azteca, I love you, and I will see you again soon.

Pleasantly surprised! Even after reading the positive reviews for Azteca I was still a little hesitant walking into the place. I have dissonance around finding a good restaurant attached to a mid-range hotel. 

When you walk in, it's like walking in a little tunnel. The front area is really small too and if you arrive with a lot of people, your personal space bubble becomes almost non-existent. We asked for a booth and yes, the tables are very close together. The staff are friendly and they especially warm-up if you speak Spanish. 

We ordered the "Macho" and veggie fajitas. Very good and large portions! We also ordered the fresh guacamole since many of the previous reviews raved about this. Even though it was delicious, I thought it was a tad pricey ($7 for one avocado) after thinking it was only $3 (I guess I mis-read the menu). The salsa was on the watery side and I'm accustomed to the chunkier, but it was still good. 

As we were leaving, a table was having a birthday and it was such a fun site to see! Most of the staff came out singing and sombreros in hand. At the end of the birthday song, one of the waiters got up on a chair and was pretending to do a little strip-tease with his apron. Hilarious. 

Good food, good fun...and if you are lucky, you'll witness a birthday celebration!
The food was pretty good for Mexican food in the south.  Salsa was good, tacos were soggy, tamale was good, service was fine.

I am a Mexican food groupie it is one of my favorite things to eat I have had it many places and Azteca is the best.  The guacamole is delectable made fresh table side avocados, tomatoes, fresh cilantro, lime, onion, and jalapeño. The chips, salsa, and pico are free and always tasty as well. I have tried many of the dishes offered and my favorites Arroz con pollo, Fajitas, Taco Salad, Tamels and the super burrito. The Spanish rice and beans are scrumptious. It is pretty much always busy at Azteca but weekends expect a wait how ever on weekends they have the fresh corn tortilla stand open and they make them fresh to order yum! Service is hit or miss depending on who you get and how busy it is last night for example it wasn't super busy but our server was very slow it took 20 minutes to get the check after I asked for a to go box. Lastly if you want a fun place to celebrate a birthday this is it they have a huge sombrero and
A full band including a guitar to sing to you and make you feel extra special. I love everything about the food here and I think you should try it!
Best carne asada in town and lets don't  start talking about their handmade tortillas ... Delicious!!!!

Good food, nice space, BUT they do a TERRIBLE job at handling large reservations. Twice in the last year, they accepted our reservation for a group of 20-30 people, then when we showed up (on time, both times) they said very plainly and unapologetically that they had decided to give ALL of our reserved tables to other groups before we arrived. They didn't offer any solution other than  just waiting, and for 20-30 people, that meant waiting for at least an extra hour. So if you have a large group, don't bother trying to make a reservation here; and if you do, don't fool yourself into thinking not means anything.

The food and service are spectacular. I would drive to Latin America to experience it all again. The fajitas were spot on, and the margharitas were enormous and delicious. At least 5 different servers asked if I needed anything and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. Also free chips and salsa. Will come back next time I am in Charlotte

Decent food, but nothing to write home about.
Dining room is tight... booths are only fit for thin people and even then it's a tight squeeze.
Food is overly greasy, salsa is watery, chips are mediocre and limited.
I really do not see what the big deal is about this place... it's decent, but nothing to rave about.
The best thing about the place is the fast service.
You could do better... you could do worse, but  you owe it to yourself to try some place different if you believe Azteca is "great" or even "above average".

Who doesnt love this place?! COME ON! Ok, well I could live without the salsa, but the pico is ooooooh so good. I also dig that they offer Sol beer which is not easy to come by. I admit, I am not one to order the same thing every time I go out to eat, but I just cant stay away from the arroz con pollo. ARRRRRIBA! Take a bunch of amigos/amigas and enjoy a margarita or two and eat up...then go home with the leftovers. My guy and I had leftovers and I made a freakin casserole with them for god sakes. So much food!

I had great service at Azteca but I was not really impressed with the food or the prices. It's very expensive for a Mexican restaurant. You are guaranteed to spend more than $10 per meal. The chips and salsa were good but they gave us two little tiny bowls of the salsa and that's it. No refills on chips no refills on salsa. We had a group of 4 which included two big boys that obviously could kill the salsa in two bites so I didn't even get to have any. Bummer. Then everything was so expensive I tried getting the cheapest thing. I wasn't impressed with mine considering it was still around $14. Just an okay experience at Azteca. We won't be back. There are many options for great Mexican food in the area that are more suitable for our price range.

So I have to update my previous review from a 4 to a 2 and echo what a lot of other reviewers are experiencing - what the hell happened, Azteca?  While they have updated and spruced up the interior, quite honestly the food is not as good as it used to be and the newer staff needs some more training.

I know I am a fatty, but if I come in at 11:30 am, I expect lunch portions and lunch prices.  On a Thursday visit, I did get an extra flauta (I thought the menu changed, I didn't realize the waitress had done a dinner order), however that was not a good thing.  The flautas used to be crispy with well flavored meat.  The shell for mine was mushy instead of crunchy and the beef was dry, tough and flavorless.  For $7.25 I would have been irritated enough - for $10, I was kind of pissed.  The rice and beans are the same eh, fine, they have always been, cheese dip was good.  The chips tasted different and not in a good way.  I don't eat the salsa, so I can't speak to that.

I did see a several people that have been there forever, but I did see a lot of new faces too.  From the other "meh" reviews and my past two experiences, I do believe I will be heading to 1900 for Mexican lunches and Monterrey for dinner - Azteca just isn't cutting it anymore.

We were visiting from out of town and found this spot as it was near our hotel.  The exterior was a little underwhelming, but the dining room is very inviting, cute bar area, and very friendly staff.  The bottomline is the food though, and it was excellent.  The house Margaritas are good, and our entrees were all very good, an excellent value for a mid-range priced restaurant of this type.  If it was located in Minneapolis it would be in our regular rotation.  Highly recommended.

Date of my visit: 8-March-2017
Time of my visit: Lunch

My co-worker took me to this joint.  It was busy!  I like and hate busy.  It was a 10 minute wait and we were seated.

The server came over almost immediately and took our drink order.  Shortly there after we ordered.  I ordered burrito deluxe, it came with rice and beans.

It did not take long for the food to come out.  I was slightly disappointed with a portion (sorry for not taking a picture).  It had to be one of the weirdest burrito experience ever for me...  What I was expecting to be inside (lettuce, cheese, etc.) of the burrito, was on top of it, the meat (steak in my case) was wrapped inside of the tortilla...  Taste wise, the steak was okay, about what I was expecting.

The nice touch was desert at the end.  What bugged me the most was our waiter waiting for me to sign the credit card receipt... Overall an average, C experience.

Just like a childhood movie favorite that is not quite as good when you revisit as an adult....Azteca did not hit the spot like it used to years ago in college. I had fond memories but when I visited a few week ago the food was greasy, over portioned and over cooked. The salsa was pleasantly flavorful but our entrees had a not so fresh suspect look about them.
Hands down the best chicken fajitas I've had in my life, and I'm a Mexican food snob!

No. I'm sorry.  No offense to Carolinians, but this is not good Mexican Food.  It doesn't taste right and our food was just funky.  Additionally, the service was not very good.  The husband had a combo with tacos and he asked the waiter if the hard taco shells were made in house or if they were the pre-made type.  He was told they were made in house.  Maybe they are, but they look very pre-made - he was kind of ticked.  I had flautas and they just were not great.  The rice was super boring, neither of us finished it and at some point we realized we never got any chips and salsa?  What Mexican restaurant doesn't give you chips and salsa?!?!?!

We were bummed, but I learned on this trip, don't eat Mexican food in the south... both of our attempts failed miserable.  

Cannot recommend.  DON'T DO IT!!!
Try to eat here every time I'm in town. Ask for the cactus salad YUM. Great lunch specials. The cheese dip is great with the fresh tortilla chips.

Best Mexican in Matthews.  Usually get the steak fajitas, very tender meat with great flavor, onions and peppers always sliced thin and well grilled.  Super service.   The drinks are phenomenal, I love the coconut margarita and the Pina colada.  The cabbage slaw pico that they bring out with chips is unique and so flavorful...very fresh...

Had a terrible experience here.  First we ordered cheeses dip and once it came there were no chips.  By the time our chips came, the cheese dip was cold - wasted $5.  Then we waited 40 minutes more before asking for the manager.  The food came 5 minutes later and the manager didn't show up for another 5 minutes! No apology, just excuses that they were so busy that even he had too work in the kitchen so everyone's food would be hot when served.  Food was okay at best.  We will never go back.

Oh my heavens!! This is hands down the best Mexican restaurant I have been to! So thankful for the kind couple who directed us here. Food is phenomenal, service is great, the wait time for our food was pretty quick. The portions are large large but honestly makes for the best leftovers!

We have ordered take out from here several times and finally stopped in the other day for lunch. They have amazing salsa, lots of cilantro which I happen to love. They don't have many vegetarian options on the menu but they do a have a few. The vegetable burrito was delicious and the portion is huge. The waiters were nice and quick with everything. All in all I would def. go here again and we will continue to get take out from here all the time!

Yummy queso! I had the Azteca combo, steak was perfect and a lot of food for the price. We sat at the bar and service was not that great, seemed the 1 bartender was running around a bit. But overall, I'd come back

Huge portions and great "dirty" Mexican food! Don't let the fact that it's next to a hotel scare you off! 

The chips and salsa aren't amazing, but they are free. They also serve their chips with a cilantro coleslaw that I really enjoy. 

The deluxe burrito is the size of the baby and I'll give you props if you eat it all. At $9 it's always my go to meal here. It also comes with a side of refried beans and rice. 

The fajitas are also great and big enough to split with someone. My husband and I opt for the trio, which has steak, shrimp and chicken. The meat is cooked perfect and it has a great variety of peppers  and onions with it. Very tasty dish! Make sure you ask for extra shells.

AY AY AY que bueno!!!!!!!!!!

So these might be the most friendly people on the planet. This is some damn fine Mexican food. You can absolutely get a cheese chile relleno off menu which is so great. We got a ton of different dishes on two visits and I might almost drive the seven hours again just to eat here another time...

Azteca is a down home sort of Mexican restaurant and I'm sure lots of people enjoy it but it's not for me.

The place has a lot of charm with the decor and authentic sounding menu items (I have no knowledge of Mexican cuisine). However the booths are spaced way too closely and you end up banging knees with your dining companion if you sit across from each other. I'm all for a good banging but not in the knees thank you very much.

You get some chips and weird salad thing as well as extremely watery salsa to start off your meal while you decide on what you want. It's kind of nice but the salsa is mostly water so it just slides right off the chip. The food comes out blazingly fast though which is a great bonus if you are hungry and don't want to eat tomato water and chips. Almost everything comes with a salad of wilted iceberg that you can totally skip over, rice and refried beans. The beans and rice are really too salty to eat much of on their own though they were okay with what I ordered which was some sort of well cooked sirloin. Portions are huge, but I was still hungry afterwards because I did not eat most of it.

I was in such a rush to leave that I actually forgot my credit card here and had to return the next day to pick it up. I do not think I will return however if you like this sort of thing go for it.

We sat at the bar. Service was minimal and not unfriendly but not too welcoming. Fajitas were pretty good. Expresso burrito (pork) was absolutely tasteless. Sauce surrounding it seemed like just thin bland tomato paste. Margarita was fine (giant and super sweet like a lot of other places)

We recently moved from the San Francisco bay area to Charlotte and we were so happy visiting this restaurant.

Great atmosphere inside and outside, good hostess and big shout out to our server who was very courteous 

Don't forget to order the pitcher of Margarita 

Big portions of food which was so delicious  

Must go!!!

WOW, was I pleased I found Azteca Mexican Restaurant while on my visit to Charlotte. Azteca is NOT just another Mexican Restaurant. The Food and Service were awesome. They have menu choices that stand out from a lot of other Mexican restaurants. Their salsa was very tasty. They will even make fresh Guacamole table side. This is a MUST GO TO!!!

Visited October 2016

This is my favorite place to go for more authentic Mexican food.  Azteca has a huge menu and they serve you huge portions.  This place is large so you rarely have to wait to be seated, even on the weekends.  Everything I've eaten here is fantastic, and I have never been able to eat all the food that I'm served.  The best part is that they serve you free sopapillas (tortilla chips with whipped cream, cinammon, and strawberry sauce) with your check.
We loved it!!! Yummo :) Love the men serenading each table and the table side guacamole!!! Dessert was to die for! We will be going back!
This is by far the best Mexican in town! Service is always on point and willing to go the extra mile. Sunday's our my favorite with the live band.  We drive 25 min to go here if that says anything
Great lunch specials, fast and courteous service, great food!

I wanted to like Azteca because I have always heard such good things from other people, but it just didn't do it for me and I honestly couldn't wait to get out of there.

Went for dinner on Saturday night, got there early and were sat right away.  The chips and salsa were good.  I ordered a Paloma, which was tequila and grapefruit juice and more, but I don't think its what I received.  I could have sent it back but it tasted fine, so I drank it.  We had some queso to start, that was also good.  For entree I got the camarones mexicanos, basically shrimp with onions, mushrooms, green peppers, in a tomato sauce with rice and cheese.  First shrimp tasted very fishy, the rest were better.  But the dish had a sourness to it, the mushrooms were the worst offenders and I couldn't figure out why so I stopped eating them.

So the food overall was fine but the restaurant kind of skeeved me.  There was water underneat my feet so that bugged me, then one of my friends touched some gum stuck under the table and at that point I was done.  I mean I know we're at a restaurant at a Days Inn but come on!!  Finally our server was just not very good or friendly and I sat with an empty water glass for a while.

So I gave it a shot but I doubt I'll be back.

My family took my father- in- law to eat here today, for fathers day and I  was not very pleased. It seems that we as americans did not get the full experience of the restaurant, nor did our waiter engage us to do so. I noticed they had a cart that went around the room, but we had no clue as to what it served, due to the fact that our waiter did not educate us on what it offered. Our waiter seemed to only understand his on dielect because he did not bring us everything we ordered. I was very disappointed as we sent close to 70.00 on this restaurant. I will never go back. Wendover location is the best hands down.  Also, the wait staff should write down what is order as we had to ask for several items that he  claimed to not have understood we ordered several times. We gave him gradituity, but he really was worth it.

The food was delicious, humble but super tasty like authentic Mexican cuisine is. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was pleasant. I found out about this place yesterday and had lunch there, today I came back to have their dinner!

The hubs and I went to Azteca for a late lunch after I read some decent yelp reviews. And it was just that... decent.

The interior and decor is pretty neat. We just got back from Mexico, so it was nice to see some authentic art and hear authentic music again. The place was not busy when we went, and initially, service was fast. We got our drinks and chips right away. Then after saying we needed a minute, we got about 10 before someone came to take our order. No one checked on us during the meal. 

The food was good, not the best Mexican, not the worst. The salsa is a little watered down, but I liked it. I got a quesadilla and hubs got fajitas. Both portions were huge. After dinner they bring a little fried pastry for a sweet bite on the house. 

For a casual Mexican meal, Azteca did the trick. I would come back.

The size of this restaurant is absolutely much more roomier compared to the South Blvd. location. If you've been to one of the Aztecas in mid or lower Charlotte, then you won't expect to see anything different on the menu. However, what you can expect to see is a change in staff every six months or so. I believe they've changed owners once or twice during the time they've been open and have shuffled around the waiting and managerial staff. For the better though. They seem much more helpful and coordinated with their food runs and service. 

The food of the restaurant is decent and hits the spot. There isn't really anything special with their enchiladas, tacos, or tamales. I'm not an expert on Mexican cuisine, so I could be totally wrong, but those three items seem to be pretty uniform at any Mexican restaurant. The thing that really bothers me though is the lower quality of meats they have switched to. The chicken tastes like it comes from a Swanson Chicken can and the ground beef they use is the highest amount of fat possible. 

HOWEVER, those are the combos. If you really want the "quality" meat and flavor, then you have to go to their speciality items or fajitas and pay a little more money for quality. Nothing wrong in that, amigos. Having learned that the combos aren't really good anymore, I've switched to the Carne Asada and the meat is muchhhh better! Now I actually feel like I'm spending my money for a good reason. Fajitas are starting to show a little more bell peppers & onions than meat lately, so they're starting to slack on that, but the fajitas are pretty standard once again. 

I gave it four stars because of the lack of quality they're starting to go to now (I know, the economy excuse), but everything else is great in the restaurant. Friendly staff, clean tables, and decent prices for dinner. Lunch prices are excellent, so don't be afraid to come here for a quick bite if you don't want the same old $5 sub down the road.

Been eating here ever since they first opened. Something between 15 and 20 years ago.LOVE it! I'll admit sometimes the cooks might be having a bad day. But we all do. The manager has always stops by to greet me while I'm there. And is always concerned about our meals. He has always made our visits pleasurable, corrected and even replaced an order for us if we didn't like it or if it wasn't done right. Please people before you bash or give a bad review, give a restaurant at least 3 or 4 visits before you bash them. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. The food is amazing

Yesterday for lunch my friend really wanted to eat here, so in an act of almost unfathomable generosity I said OK!  I know I'm selfish!!!

The Wait staff seemed like they did not want to be there, though that has no effect on my review!  The seats were very soft and comfortable, though that will not effect the outcome of my rating it is nice to be physically comfortable.

The food:  Chips, plain, little or no salt, 3 stars!  Salsa, good flavor (better than many), too watered down 3.5 stars.  Steak Fajitas good flavor, better than some, 3.5 stars.  Flour Tortillas 4 stars.  The Pico was better than most 4 stars.   Vegetables, good quality 3.65 stars.  My overall rating of this place is compared to similar Mexican Restaurants.

I can NOT say that I am a fan (so I do not give them four stars) they get 3.25 for me = A -OK!  Though I would not chose to return here  would come back if I really wanted to join my group of friends who chose to.  Many places I would not, so that says something good about this place!

Just had dinner their with my family who lives in Charlotte.  This is as good as it get's to authentic Mexican food.  The food was fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this place.  Just found another great restaurant to eat when I come to town.

I've eaten here so many times...everything is good!  Affordable, delicious, family friendly.  The fresh guacamole is delicious and so are the margaritas.  The mariachi band is fun and they really "do it up" for your birthday!

My favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte.  I love this place and have been here a thousand times.  This is my go to when I am in the mood for cheese and carbs.  It's inexpensive and delicious.  Get there now if you are not interested in the upscale Mexican places and want something super casual.

So disappointed. This was our favorite place but today the beef was so bad in our fajitas and Deluxe burrito that it was not eatable. Do not know what the new taste is for their beef but it will be hard for me to go back.

So when you walk in the greeters are dressed in Mexican dresses with Mexican colors. It was really cold in the restaurant. You get chips and salsa for free. This guys walks around making tableside guac. We got it and it wasn't so great. Needed more lemon and jalapeños. Wasn't spicy enough. I ordered fajitas and didn't like them so much. They were kinda sweet. Maybe the onions were caramelized too much. I didn't care for the meat. It wasn't strips of meat it was more like bits. I asked for extra rice and all they did was spread it on the plate to look like more. The sweet tortilla chips they gave with the bill were the best part of the meal I think.

ARROZ CON POLLO!!!!  This place is worth it great staff, great atmosphere, awesome food even down to the little tortilla wit whipped cream and strawberry sauce at the end of the meal. The guy that comes around with the guacamole cart makes killer guacamole. The portions are massive I consider myself a big eater and I have a hard time finishing my meal. The staff is great they come into my store after hours and are just as friendly at that time as they are when at work so I guess that means they are sincere. Great place

Delicious food and yuuugggge portions. We went on a whim for lunch on Saturday afternoon after looking up some options for Mexican on Yelp. I found out later that it's a favorite of many of my food-loving friends. There were chips on the table within minutes of sitting down, salsa and coleslaw as well, though I would have liked a bit more salsa in the bowl and it was bland. 

My husband ordered the burrito especial and myself the enchiladas suizas (green). My plate was larger than I've ever seen for one person. The enchilada portion was two large and the plate was filled with rice, beans, and slaw. I loved the rice and beans most! The verde sauce was also lacking in flavor, some heat would have been nice. My husband was completely pleased with his meal and is already planning our next visit. He even finished off my plate and left ready for a nap. For about $20 we left full following excellent service.

The atmosphere is awesome, great decor.   Don't let the little entrance next to the Days Inn fool you.  I wasn't too impressed with the food.  It was just okay.  The salsa is not good - very runny.  But, they do give you a delicious  slaw with the chips.  Prices are really cheap - great lunch specials.

Staying in Charlotte for a week, asked the Hotel desk person where was a good Mexican restaurant. She raved about Azteca so thought I should give it a try. I walked in and was immediately  greeted and asked where I wanted to sit. They brought over chips and salsa [?] to be honest it really wasn't salsa it was very very watery with some raw onions.. almost no spice at all. I had to add salt to get any flavor at all.

 I ordered the Pork Carnitas Plate. The plate its self was HUGE, however the pork carnitas took up only 1/8 or less of the plate. There were two sides of what i'm guessing was like a "fresh" vegetable salsa maybe. I tasted it but it was really odd/dry/no taste. Then the rice & refried beans. The person who made the beans must have made the salsa for the chips as well. They were very very thin...to the point they would fall though the tines in my fork. No cheese on them and again no seasoning/spice. 

Now i'm honestly not trying to be negative towards the restaurant everyone else seemed to really enjoy them... so i'm guessing it has to be that with living in California we have real Mexican food practically on every corner especially with the taco trucks and they are not afraid of spice at all. It was just very different and didn't appeal to me at all...if i came back I would not give them another try...Sorry.

Food was great.  I got the dos compadres which has steak and chicken.  I really enjoyed the food.   Also they sang to other tables for birthdays and it was different because they had instruments like they were in a band.  I was staying in the hotel next door and as I came out another guest in the hotel ask me about the food and I did recommend him to go there

I didn't think I could find a decent restaurant in the area but this was a nice surprise. The service is friendly and pretty quick. I had the guacamole and mojitos, which were both very tasty. Then shared a fajita plate. This is definitely one of those places where you should share a plate, they are ridiculously big.

Ohh ask for "pico de gallo" when you get your chips. It's a small plate with cabbage and salsa, pretty good.

My and my family's all time fave Mexican place. When we started going 15 years ago, it looked like a real hole in the wall. They've renovated and it's actually quite nice inside now. The front patio is the best place to sit when the weather is pleasant. 
The portions are huge, so you really get a bang for your buck (this includes margs, sangria, and the draft beer. Make sure you hire a DD lol).
You really can't go wrong with the menu, but some of my faves:
Vegetarian burrito, deluxe burrito, Popeye quesadilla, seafood quesadilla, camerones con ongos (shrimp and mushrooms). 
Tableside guac is a must. Queso is good too though. Of course, complimentary chips and salsa and pico, plus complimentary dessert (cinnamon toasted tortilla chips with honey, whipped cream, and strawberry sauce).
Friendly and fast service. Parking may look small, but there's more in the back. Fun place to go for birthdays...free sundae and humiliation for the birthday guy or girl (they must wear a sombrero and be sung to by a mariachi band).

Best of Charlotte please! I just came back from the dullest, blandest, most tasteless Mexican dinner ever!! I only gave it 2 stars because of the waiter, the food wasn't worth even that. 

I knew that I was in for a bad time when I saw so many happy old "gringos" leaving the place. That was  a sure sign that the food is closer to Howard Johnson than to Mexico. Sad but true, sorry. Authentic? The place is just like the set for an old Zorro TV movie and it's all downhill from there.

For starters the salsa was so watery that I finished the bowl before I even noticed. I never order nachos before but since they were loaded and topped with Jalapenos I went for it. Pickled jalapenos that is - as hot as kosher pickles. The waiter was embarrassed and rushed some sauteed jalapenos over to us. Still mild but at least they were real.

 I ordered a combo, I always do on a first visit  in Mexican restaurants. All three items, Taco, Enchilada and Chile relleno were stuffed with the same totally tasteless ground beef. No spices of any sort, the stuffing reminded me of a can of Spam. 

Honestly, anywhere closer to the border this place would have been laughed out of town. Martin Mull might approve but unless one was raised on sliced Wonder bread and mayo I'd pass.

The service was good but the food, drinks, and decor not so much. We went there for lunch and the waiter quickly took our order. While we waited, the musicians came over and asked if we wanted a song. We politely declined but the table in front of us accepted and in turn we received a song anyway. lol. While we waited for our food I took in the decor and noticed how outdated and dingy everything seemed. I started to feel a little uncomfortable because the place looked like it hadn't had a thorough cleaning in forever. Our menus were dirty and grimy too. The food arrived and my taco was soft and mushy and the shell split right down the middle and the mushy beef filling spilled onto my plate. My chicken taco was only half filled and tasteless. My boyfriend ordered a sizzling fajita and offered me a taste. It tasted way better than the tacos. He ordered a Mojito and he was shocked when an electric green liquid came out. It was literally the color of green kool-aid or some crazy kiddie drink and it had little green flecks floating in it. We assumed the flecks were bits of mint but the drink had no mint flavor at all. It did have plenty of alcohol but no other real flavor. We may give them another try but will most likely try a different location.

If you're looking for authentic Mexican in Charlotte, go here! Great service, great atmosphere and great food! We were so impressed and will definitely be back! Tip- ask for the hot sauce because it is delicious!

I came here to eat from California. First impression, excellent service, guacamole made table side was delicious. We ordered the large and it fed 4 people comfortably. I ordered the fajitas, my dad ordered a combo platter with tamale, taco and enchiladas, which were good. Excellent value, nice salsa, plates are very large and the pico that comes with the chips is really good. The downfall is the rice and beans were tasteless and stale. One star off for the rice and beans. Overall a pleasant experience would recommend for decent Mexican food and an affordable price!

The food here is so amazing! I came for lunch about a week ago and I was so happy with everything. They made the guacamole fresh right in front of us! It was sooooooooooo soo good. I ordered 2 enchiladas one chicken and one cheese
Everything was hot and tasted great! The margarita my friend got was HUGE 

Great value and great qualities.

I am not a mexican food expert but this place was pretty darn good!  The outside looks kinda sketch and it's attached to a Days Inn which makes is seem somewhat suspect. But once you walk in it's fine.  

We walked in and were immediately seated and served delicious chips and salsa (only the first 2 bowls of chips are free as I saw on the menu) not like you need more than that but just sayin...

I had a combo plate of a taco and an a cheese enchilada with rice and beans, it was enormous and only about $7, I also had a giant peach margarita that was delicious.  That cost more than my meal ($8 I think?) but I had a rough day and it was worth every penny.  

Consensus - cheap, decent mexican food a short drive from my apartment.  Sold.

This is definitely not a restaurant I would recommend. The food is bland and greasy. The service is not that great either. It used to be a decent place to go but has gotten worse over the years. There's too many other good Mexican restaurants in this area to waste time & money at Azteca.
Don't be fooled. Charlotte doesn't seem to have much to compare. I'm a tough critic because I'm from the west coast. Not that great.

I took my daughter and her friends to a concert last night in Charlotte.  After I dropped them off I searched Yelp for a Mexican Restaurant in the vicinity and found Azteca.  I was seated immediately in the restaurant and received a menu, my chips and saulsa and my drink order was taken.  

I ordered the Pollo Crema and guacamole.  Soon after I received my ice cold draught beer and a waiter came to my table and prepared the guacamole to order using a fresh avacado, onions, tomatoes and celantro. My only disappointment is I ordered a small portion instead of the large.  Moments later the entree was served on a huge dish full of rice and beans with my chicken.  The cream sauce was rich and eating it along with the guacamole was to die for.  

The server was exceptional too and he frequently checked to ensure the food was good, my beverage was full and chips were aplenty.  I have eaten Mexican food from coast to coast and this was by far the best I've ever had.

Staying in hotel by Azteca Mexican. Husband ordered take out, Sopa Azteca large $6.99 for me and Pollo a la crema $14.49 for him, paid $34.10 and a tip!I Walked to pick up order my phone number receipt (with order written correctly) Thought it was a bit high. Got back to hotel opened the bag, soup  was mixed seafood $19.25 Pollo crema $12.25 Called immediately and was told that I should have read receipt when I picked up order..THEY WERE RUDE and acted like they didn't speak English. 
Apparently Azteca Mexican Rest takes  advantage of hotel guests!!! Guess they can't make an honest buck!! What happened to pleasing the customer? BAD BUSINESS PRACTICE ... I intend to tell everyone I know not to support this business

Honestly, I don't know how this place has such a good rating. It's subpar Mexican food, at best. I recently moved to the area and have been looking for a new go-to Mexican restaurant and this is most definitely not it. I gave it two tries, and I won't be giving it a third. Maybe my standards are very high, but back home we have a variety of non chain brand Mexican restaurants that are AMAZING.

Don't get me wrong - it's NOT bad. It's just not good. And there are definitely better options (I just have to find them still).

I had a late dinner with a friend of mine and I was noticing the decor. Everything in the place is spot on clean there was no dust anywhere not in the table chandeliers not even in the exposed rafters. The music was authentic the food was fresh and everyone was very nice and cordial. This is a great place and I will be back.

Finding reliable, consistent Mexican cuisine is not easy to do, but we've found Azteca to be completely consistent across all meals and all locations.

Most recently, we ate at the location on Independence. We've tried everything from the chicken tortilla soup (huge portion and very delicious) to the taco salad (meh, it's a taco salad). What we generally order, however, is the pork carnitas. Always very tasty and not over cooked.

Atmosphere is typical of Mexican restaurants in the area, but we have found the consistency to be the key. And, if you're into drinks, they seem to have a ton of mixed adult beverages that practically glow in the dark. The margaritas are very good, so we hear.
Good service. Average Mexican food. Bathroom horrible condition. Only stopped here because we were in a hurry. Parking around back in seedy motel parking lot.

This was a really good experience. Despite the fact that it kinda smelled like cigarettes, we (me, gf, kids) had a nice lunch. 

The prices are insanely cheap for what you get. The kids meals, bean burritos with beans and rice, were only four bucks, and they couldn't finish them. The adults got avocado tostada and veggie burrito. She couldn't finish hers. I finished the burrito but I never give up (when it comes to eating).

If this place weren't three states away I bet it would be a regular spot for dinner. Next time I'm in East Suburban Charlotte I'll probably come back.
Good, authentic Mexican.  Big portions and low prices.  Try the carnitas de puerqo.  Nice atmosphere and friendly wait staff.

The beau and I came in late on a Friday night, but the restaurant was still packed. No wait, quickly seated over at a booth near the bar. 

We each ordered a drink - I had a margarita (fairly good, had better!) and he had a draft beer (Modelo - can't go wrong!) 

At first the service was fairly good - we quickly received water and the drinks that we had ordered from the bar, but then after that it was like we were nonexistent. 

We ordered cheese dip that took forever to come out (very nice portion size I might add though). Their salsa taste like marinara sauce and its watery- it's horrible. However, their hot salsa (upon request) is great though, if you haven't tried it- and care for spicy-it's wonderful!

We sat and waited for almost 25 minutes when I finally got up and found our waiter and told them we were ready to order. Then by that time we sat for another 30 minutes waiting on our food when they weren't even that busy! 

The food it's self was pretty good though, I had chicken fajitas and the seasoning on the fajitas part was great! My boyfriend had a chicken quesadilla and he really enjoyed. 

However, at the end of the night when it was all said and done we decided that we wouldn't be back here unless we were in a pinch for something quick. We decided that there were other Mexican restaurants with better customer service in Charlotte!

I travel a lot and this may be the best Mexican Food in the country.  Anytime I am in Charlotte I make sure to eat here at least once.  Very traditional look and feel to this place.  Staff is very friendly and recognize me even when it has been a year between visits.  Seems like about every 20 minutes you hear them joyuously singing happy birthday to a customer who is wearing a large sombrero and blushing.  Really feels like the people who work here love their jobs and the customers they serve. 

The Tacos Al Carbon is such a perfect dish, made the right way with skirt steak cooked to perfection and queso fresco cheese crumbles, combined with pico de gallo unlike any other I have had.  All this carefully wrapped in corn tortillas that melt as soon as you get them in your mouth.

The chips and salsa are good......... the guacamole that they make at your table fresh is outstanding and it is fun to watch them make it.  They even let you tell them how much jalapeno to put in depending on how hot you like it.  Queso dip is very tastey as well.  

Food seems to always be out promptly even when I have brought large groups.  I love everything about Azteca except I wish they had one in AZ.

Ok service, not prompt, but friendly. House margarita, big as yo face, portions big as yo face. As far as taste, it satisfies. It is defiantly real Mexican food. Did it blow my mind? No. Would i come back? Most likely. By no means the best, by no means the worst.

So disappointing.  6 months ago we were visiting Charlotte, and the mob around the restaurant forced us to give up and go elsewhere.  We really looked forward to our next visit to Charlotte, so we made a bee line to Azteca.  No crowds on a Friday night:  should have been a red flag.  Good cheese dip, and the "slaw" they serve up front is great.  But the very expensive margaritas were bland, we professional margarita consumers could detect no tequila.  Entrees (deluxe nachos, chimichanga, taco salad) were all very large but very flavorless.  Alas, such a disappointment.  We'll try somewhere else next trip!

I can't ever complaint about this place. It has never disappointed me and I have been visiting since I first moved to Charlotte in 2002. 

Their Tortilla Soup is excellent. They even serve the broth on a separate pot to keep the tortillas crispy for you.

Still on the hunt for great Mexican food in the Charlotte area.  Came here because of the reviews on Yelp and it looked pretty authentic.  Upon arrival, I did have some second thoughts.  Conveniently located near a Days Inn that may or may not offer hourly and monthly rates.  If fact we had to park facing this motel in the back of the restaurant.
As we were walking toward the front of the restaurant, a kitchen employee did come out to cut or peel a vegetable over a trash can.  Hmmm...
At the hostess station, we were asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside on the patio.  We chose inside because it was still hot outside.  No sooner that we sat down we were greeted with the loud mariachi band.  They are good but they are loud.  And the trumpet is even louder.  Anyways, because the mariachi band is loud, the patrons are even louder.  There was a table of 2 families sitting and the women were literally yelling at each other to tell a story.  It was quite obnoxious.  They had small kids with them who were wandering around the table and when the mariachi band came to their table.. of course one of the mom's stood up on her chair to do a dance.  In all my years of going to restaurants, I have never seen that.  I don't frequent strip clubs but I imagine that's what happens there.  
Oh..the food.  The chips were good but the salsa was one step above tomato juice.  I asked for a spicier version and they brought a green salsa that had a little spice.  I ordered the Expresso Burrito which was supposed to be Chile Verde, rice, and beans.  Turned out to be chunks of pork but they were lean and tender.  Overall, decent Mexican food with a not so decent experience.

So my friend and I went here for lunch and was very disappointed in the food and service. For starters, our waiter had a terrible attitude. When we asked for a menu, he seemed to catch an attitude with us for not telling him what we wanted to drink first. After we had to get our own menu, he then went on to take our orders very poorly. It seemed to take forever for our food to arrive, and when it did, it wasn't what we ordered. I won't count this place out yet. They have one more chance with me. If next time is the same, stick a fork in it!

The entrees are okay but have a salt taste. The tables are tile-topped so the tile grout collects dirt and germs. I have been in better Mexican places where the tops are custom and very colorful however they have a piece of glass or Lexan over top of them to keep the eating surface clean. Last time I was in here there were 2 kids running around their table and the adults, including the waitresses didn't care one bit that my ears were ringing from screaming. I guess that is an occasional part of the "authentic" experience. The prices are a bit high for the quality of the food. The food isn't horrible, but it is really just average. People rave about this place, even going as far as saying its the best Latino food they've ever had, even traveling to Latino countries. I don't get it. One of the same yelling children was licking the top of a salt shaker in front of the adults and wait staff, nobody seemed to care. I had to tell the waitress to probably remove that salt shaker since the little girl was licking it. Beware salt shakers at this place with clogged tops, it may be from dried saliva. The place has a nice decor but overall they stay so busy (again, I am baffled as to why) and that causes the cleanliness of the place to be below average. Wait staff is friendly however can be too long between table visits, and then when at the table once can be pushy. Unfortunately I will come back as my girl and her family say its the best, driving 40 minutes from home in SC to come here. I have eaten Mexican food my whole life, authentic and otherwise, and this place to me is average at best. Not positively memorable in terms of deliciousness, cleanliness or value. Yes you get a lot of beans and rice with the food but that's like going to Thanksgiving at someones house and bragging about the portions because half your plate was piled with Stove Top. If my experience here improves, I will be sure to apologize and update my rating, but after 3 or 4 visits, I am doubtful.

The food here is great!! I was quickly seated the server was friendly the chips were warm and the salsa was pretty good. I ordered the vegetable chimichanga that was amazing .. My favorite part after the meal is that you are brought a cinnamon chip with whip cream and strawberry sauce . This place is one of my new favorite places..

Ehhh I'm updating my review because I want to give them kudos to how well they handled the HUGE cinco de mayo crowd. My coworkers and I showed up around noon and the place was P - A - C - K - E - D. We were group of five and were able to be seated immediately.

Our waiter came to greet us and let us know there was a margarita special: order a margarita, get a free t-shirt. Unfortunately, the waiter failed to share that there was a price markup during the ordering process, but more on that later.

Two baskets of chips and salsa were brought out for the table and our food orders were placed. We plowed through both baskets of chips and salsa and another waiter kindly brought out two more baskets while we waited. Our food did seem to take a little longer than normal but it ended up being all right in the end. I went with the chicken carnitas lunch special and liked it, nothing great but good enough. 

Once it was time to cash out, my co-workers who'd placed margarita orders were shocked to see that the amount was $11-$12 for their drinks rather than the normal $8 or $9 for margaritas. Just would've been nice if the price increase would've been explained.

I went solo a few weeks later because I had a vicious craving for huevos rancheros. I was disappointed once my food came out because there wasn't much egg (huevo) to be found. I ordered the rancheros with chorizo and it was basically a plate filled of chorizo. The beans and rice were not that great and it was just, overall, not a good meal. I was very disappointed.

Can't say that I'll be going back anytime soon.

According to this reviewer, this is the best Mexican food in Matthews.  Each meal comes with a complimentary basket of chips and salsa, and the portions are very generous and generally delicious.  I highly recommend the Arroz con Pollo.  

Service is prompt and polite, and the interior is clean and charming in a constructed-before-we-were-concerned-about-stereotypes sort of way.

If you are in Matthews, this is a much better bet than Monterrey or that sketchy place downtown.

Okay when I kept reading massive portions, I was still surprised. Pictures do not do it justice!! Check my photo, standard size steak knife, MASSIVE plate.

Excellent service, all the food was really tasty though rice was average at best. The food is plentiful though so you'll get full even if you leave rice!

Shared cheese dip with the table and ordered the carne asada. It can be hit or miss, but not only was Azteca's good, it might be THE best carne asada I've ever eaten at a Mexican restaurant! 

If you want good grub, good service and a great value, don't hesitate to eat here. It'll be a staple stop whenever I'm in Charlotte!

Margarita was awful, sour & served in a warm glass. Food was okay at best. Salsa is very watery, has a chipotle / smoke flavor which I wasn't a fan of. Much better Mexican places out there. Staff was friendly and quick.

My husband and I love this place, the staff is always friendly and you are seated quickly. Some nights they have a mariache band that comes in and goes from table to table taking requests. They also linger around at your table for a tip, which is slightly bothersome. It'd be better if they had a sectioned area to perform and people to come up and dance and leave tips. But regardless, the food is yummy and they have a HUGE drink selection.
This place is a gem. It's great food and great service. Alex has been such a wonderful waiter and made our experience a pleasure each time.

My favorite Mexican food in north Charlotte! We always sit at the bar where the bartender, Nacho, (yes that's really his name) takes great care of us. My fiancé and I always get the cheese dip and arroz con pollo (with cheese sauce instead of tomato sauce).  The service is always on point and the portions are huge!  The restaurant stays pretty busy even though it's off the main road but there is plenty of seating.  Clean restaurant and always an enjoyable experience!

We rarely go out on my birthday because it's a major dining holiday - Valentine's Day.  But this time the whole family got together and I chose Azteca, thinking it wouldn't be "too" badly crowded.  Well, it was full, but SO festive and fun!  We sat at the bar while we waited for our table for 7, and the bartender was entertaining and quick with our margaritas, even making a little virgin margarita for the youngster with us.  We got our table fairly quickly, and we kept our waiter entertained and coming back and forth pretty quickly, too, considering the room was full of party groups.  As always, the food was filing and delicious!  This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants, and it was really good to be back, and share it with 3 in our party who had never been.  They are now fans, as well.
Seriously good food.  Sat at the bar, had a couple top shelf margaritas- they were good - and beef fajitas.  The food was solid, tasty and authentic.  Good service too.  I'll be back for sure.

We've lived nearby for a little over 6 months and have only heard great things. We decided to take advantage of the good weather and head over for dinner on the patio. Initially I was concerned the patio would be full since every time we drive by its crowded. Thankfully, it was pretty empty! Lucky us.

First off, the service is pretty poor. They weren't very friendly when we were asking/waiting to be seated. Second, we had to ask several times for more chips since they only put about 10 chips to each basket. The longer we waited, the harder the bowl of queso we ordered got. In the first 30 minutes we waited 15 minutes for more chips and a refill on our drink. We finally got our food and, not surprisingly, the order was wrong. We just sucked it up and didn't say anything since we figured it would take another 30 minutes for them to correct it.

Overall, food is about 4-stars, but the service was at best a 1.5. I'll be generous and give Azteca 2 stars.

Hit or miss on food. I went back a few times. If you go during a busy time, food may not be done well. On slow days, the food is on point. Overall, this is probably as good as you can get in Charlotte. Doable.
