We chose this restaurant based on it's proximity to the hotel plus it's status on YELP and couldn't have been more pleased. The food and service here were nothing short of amazing. I couldn't decide what to order because the selection was ginormous and chose a combination place consisting of 1 enchilada, 1 chili relleno and a hard taco with rice, beans and their famous slaw. The cost for this ... on the largest plate I've ever seen ... was only $9.99. AMAZING! I had plenty to take home and devour later, which always makes me happy. There is a table side guacamole cart that is nothing short of incredible that you absolutely have to partake of. We ordered ours with all of the ingredients and couldn't help making the 'mmmmm' sound with the first bite. I never considered cilantro in making guacamole.  We ordered the small and it was plenty for the two of us.  We also treated ourselves to a pitcher of margaritas. The price for this HUGE pitcher was $25 and would have been a sufficient amount for 4 people. The two of us overindulged .. ;) .. and had plenty left over that we had to leave behind on the table. It seemed such a waste of the best margaritas (the ingredients were perfectly proportioned) that I have had in a long time. Actually thinking of coming back here before I leave Charlotte. OUTSTANDING.

Top shelf margaritas were excellent. Guac made by our table was good and to order. Yay jalapeños. Chicken enchilada was great - not too heavy and he sauce was yummy. Aztec steal and butterfly steak was 3/5 stars bc while steak had good flavor it wasn't very tender. Shrimp were good. Kid's chicken quesadilla was 3.5/5 because wasn't well put together but chicken had good flavor. Flan was great - former flan lovers, this one is for you!

Just great Mexican food with out all of the high class fluff that has permeated the  genre. I try something different every time and recommend it all.
The food is delicious and served piping hot. The entire staff is super friendly and attentive. I don't know if it's every night or just weekends, but they have a live mariachi band that is really good. So bring a few dollars to tip them and request a song.

Food was great!! My friend and I randomly chose this place for brunch one Sunday when we were both craving Mexican. We didn't see this coming but apparently it's a popular brunch place I mean seriously people were moving towards this place in hordes you would think they were giving away the food. We would have not waited but thankfully the patio was first come first serve so we were able to sit immediately due to everyone else seeming to be a large party. The service was just ok but honestly I think it was because they were basically under attack by the amount of people trying to eat there so not holding that against them they were just trying to survive at that point. Given the busyness of the place the food came out rather quickly and the micheladas we had were to die for. Definitely recommend this place and don't be scared away if it seems really really busy!

Good food, Good price. We went around 4pm on a weekday, not very crowded, which is good. The meal protein was very big, both my husband and I got a doggy bag.I love the deep fried flour tortilla, it's flaky and delicious. Difintnaly will come back here again.

Ola!  Please be seated amigos and...amig-etts.  The side effect of the great food here is me, all of the sudden, thinking that I can speak Spanish.  I love making up words while drinking a one gallon margarita and stuffing my face full of tamales, guacamole (made fresh in front of you), and saucy satisfaction.  This is the best Mexican food I have found thus far in my short tenure in Charlotte.  I have been here almost ten times and I haven't had a bad experience so far.  Now, I don't order the combo dishes, I typically get something like Pulpo, or some chicken, seafood, or meat dish - reliable broad spectrum quality.  I am getting excited about my next visit just writing this.  I envision my next entrance with me bobbling up on a donkey as I rock out a poncho with sombrero and sunglasses with a fork in a napkin sheath.  Don Quixote can inspire.  More re-fried beans please.
Best Mexican restaurant in my opinion in Charlotte. Guacumole is phenomenal!

Having been to most of the area Azteca's this one ranks lowest. 

First strike is being attached to a shady Days Inn. Other than that once you get in the door, its typical Mexican chain restaurant fair inside.
Everything, and I mean everything my wife and I ordered came covered in greasy cheddar cheese. Not even a real Mexican cheese, but grocery store pre-shredded cheese.

Our server was very attentive, even took his lunch break at the next table over so he could keep his eye on us. Even though someone else has "covered" his break they both ended up serving us. So great service.

Food quality at other Aztecas just seems higher, and cleaner.
I have to say I wasn't too impressed with this place. Food was ok but the service was pretty awful. No salsa or drink refills. Ive been twice now and I don't think I'll go again.

I was meeting my date in the North Lake area, and my friend recommended Azteca in the past, so we decided to check it out!

I got there before he did, so I grabbed a table and ordered a Dos Equis Amber, my favorite, and it was on special!  They brought me chips and salsa to munch on, which were good.  I asked if they had anything spicier- and my server, who was very attentive, sent over one sauce- checked in with me, then sent an even spicier salsa once he realized I could handle it.  I'm all about hot sauces and salsas, and they were both great!  The hotter of the two was pretty crazy I have to admit.

Anyways, my date arrived and we ordered a little later.  He ordered a burrito, which he enjoyed.  I got the mixed fajitas- my usual at a mexican restaurant- and they were decent.  Portion was good for the price- I believe it was around $12.  The shrimp were kinda small, compared to my favorite spot, Three Amigos, in Plaza Midwood.

It's a big restaurant!  If you have a big group, it would be perfect!  Very attentive service, and I loved the tortilla treat at the end.  Who doesn't like honey and whipped cream?!?  Yum.  I'll hit it up again if I'm in the area!

My husband and i decided to check out Azteca because we were in the Matthews area and he has a Mexican craving!  Other Yelpers had good things to say- so we decided to check it out as well.

When you pull up I like that it's in its own little building.  A little confusing where to turn in off busy 74 but we figured it out.

When you walk in, you feel like you're really at a Mexican restaurant!  I have been to Mexico quite a few times- and this place definitely has a more authentic feel than most.  I'd also say that it looks nicer and more upscale than most.  All employees are outfitted in traditional clothing which makes you feel like you are getting ready for an experience!  We sat outside, and enjoyed the patio.  The inside was very nice.

I ordered fajitas, my husband got Arroz con Pollo.  I enjoyed my fajitas but the portion was little small in my opinion.  The flavor was good but I could've used some more chicken on my sizzling plate.  My husband's plate was huge!  More like a platter!  He gets that meal often at different restaurants and he liked that version quite a lot.  

Service was honestly a bit slow.  There was a very large party inside and they must've been struggling keeping up with everyone else.  If service was on point I could give at least a half of a star back!

All in all a good visit with modest prices.

I go here pretty often, once a week or so. I have never had a bad experience. I always take friends here from out of town and everyone loves it. If you go late at night the guacamole man will dance on the table! 

Pros: awesome service. great prices.

Although I gave four stars, I did see a cockroach crawling on the wall in our booth. Other then that this is my absolute favorite place to get Mexican food. I guess a roach is expected, really gives that authentic feel.

Have enjoyed eating here for years!  Great service and really good food!  Have taken the entire family there and they don't miss a step. Guacamole is made table side and is very tasty. We normally have chicken chimichangas which are always fantastic!  Husband changes up from time to time and has never been disappointed. 
Would recommend to friends...good friends...

I believe there are two Azteca locations in Charlotte.  I've been to this location many times but honestly it's not my favorite Mexican restaurant in town and don't plan on going back.  They give you chips and two types of salsa at your table upon arrival.  You can tell in the picture that the salsa is very watery, which makes it difficult to stay on the chip.  They currently have pink tortilla chips for breast cancer awareness, which I thought was pretty cool. I've ordered many different things on the menu over the years but today I had the taco salad.  They load that salad shell up with shredded chicken.  Honestly, there is more chicken in the salad than lettuce.  I've had to order extra lettuce on the side before just to really make it into a salad. Don't get me wrong, I'm not complaining. They have different lunch specials from day to day. Service has usually been quick.  I've been there previously with large groups and the service was also quick. They prepare guacamole table side if you wish.  Their cheese dip is delicious. At the end of the meal they bring everyone at your table a desert tortilla chip with whip cream and strawberry drizzle. It's very tasty.  I included a picture of it in my review.  This is the larger of the two locations and can accommodate large groups.  It does get very loud at peak times and especially at night on the weekends. I prefer other Mexican restaurants but this ones not bad. It's worth giving it a chance.

Azteca has the most giant plates I've ever seen. They are the size of semi truck tires. It's spectacular.

In addition to piling on the food like they're feeding wild animals, it's good quality stuff. There are tons of vegetarian options, and the margaritas are big and cold and sweet and salty...yum!

I've been to Azteca several times, but I'm always surprised by the little sopapillas they bring at the end as a complimentary dessert. Isn't that a wonderful little customer service bonus? You get used to the free nachos at Mexican spots, but the free dessert pushes Azteca over the line from a 4 star to a 5 star for me.

The latest time I went there, I was with a group of about 15 people. We didn't have a reservation, but the staff set us up in the middle of the restaurant with a huge table, and they weren't even grumpy about having to split all our checks. The food is fresh and good, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. It's probably my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte, and you can always count on bringing home leftovers for lunch the next day!

This place basically sucks. I'm very patient when it comes to service because I'm a server so I know how it is to be busy and having to greet a table when you're running around. When you walk in, there wasn't a hostess in sight  until a couple of minutes so I assumed they were busy. I sat in the bar area. After being sat multiple people saw us and never once greeted us until about 10 minutes later. I thought about just getting up and leaving but I was hungry. Good portions of food but it doesn't taste good so that's pointless. I wouldn't go back.

Friendly host and staff! Margaritas were amazing, I recommend the top shelf! The queso was very good, I could've taken some more heat though. Salsa was different, very liquidity but I also understand this is an authentic Mexican spot not the Tex-Mex I grew up on. I would've take more heat in the salsa as well, but I just really like spicy foods. Got the camarones Mexicanos and it was very good. Our server provided us with hot sauce that was perfect! Overall a great place to eat and quiet, not super glamorous in decor but that doesn't bother me.
Holy YUMM! Above and beyond goodness. Fresh guac made to order, in font of my face. Even a little dessert fried goodness with the check.

Loved the decor of this place, just the right amount of crooked, colorful paintings on the walls. There was a lady singing with the mariachi band when I walked in, which made me immediately like the place. I knew I was in for a good experience. 

I wasn't super hungry, and because I did my research, knew I couldn't finish an entire entree. So, I got a seafood quesadilla which consisted of a crap load of shrimp smothered in cheese, guac and sour cream. I mean, this thing was pretty gigantic for an appetizer item. My friend got the Idaho Nachos, why, I don't know, but it was pretty much huge potato wedges with pieces of chicken, all covered in cheese and sour cream. Strange, but it worked. I know, not typical things you'd order from here, but they were all satisfying and I know I'll come back here for an enchilada next time. 

The waiters were attentive, and a few were even rather good looking, hellooo Alejandro ;D. I digress, but anyway, our glasses were always full and they were very generous with the chips and salsa. They even gave us dessert which was a puffed up, fried tortilla drizzled with honey and cinnamon. 

I'll be back Azteca!

Have been going there for over 20 years.
The food and service have always been good. Then on the evening of march 24th we went to have dinner with some friends there. The food and service were good as usual, But, when we were done eating, we were just sitting there talking with our friends, as friends often do when dinning together, and our waiter proceeds to tell us that if we are done 
can we be on our way because they have people waiting to be seated.
Kind of baffled, we were like okay....
Then as we left there were barely a few people waiting.
Guess I should've ordered desert or a post dinner drink so that maybe they would have allowed us to sit and visit for the amount of time we chose.
I didn't think this was a very good way to treat a long time good customer,
Or any customer.
Probably won't be back any time soon,
Or recommend to others, as I wouldn't want others to experience this type of treatment. 

-Regretfully let down
Absolutely amazing every time we come here for dinner. The service is too notch and the food is on point. We always get the table side guacamole - it's a must!!

Not a bad place for your Mexican food.

Food - if you order a small platter, you will get a good amount of food. The larger platter will fill you up and beyond. If you are like me, I had to pack the rest for to-go. I believe waiting for our food, while loading up on their salsa/guacamole sauce + chips, really got me. Don't scrimp on the guacamole, it's good!  The tamales/enchilada combo was what I had ordered. Although, the shredded beef tamale was not wrapped in the corn shuck, which takes the fun out of unwrapping your tamales.  Enchilada looked messy, but surprisingly good!! Overall, I'd come back, when I feel for Mexican.

Service - good and attentive.  No complaints here.

Place - you get a good Aztecan vibe! 

**Cinco de Mayo is coming up, order their house margarita, you get a free shirt!

Pretty good food. Came with my family. Great service. Good parking. Good portions and pricing. Not such a good location. Old and in the cut location. Passed by it for years and never checked it out. Might go back when I'm in the mood for Mexican.

My motto is do no harm but I wanted to be fair..I took 5 of my family members there and we had dinner. My mom and I had fajitas - ALL of the servings are huge by the way - the free chips and salsa were tasty as we waited on our food... I did have to go find our waiter at one point - after tracking him down he was more attentive the rest of the night...

The flavors were okay? I don't know how else to describe it - nothing was stand out except portion size - classy presentation and meh service

Absolutely delicious!!!!

Carne asada, tacos, enchiladas, quesadillas, etc....dinner was PERFECT. I love the homemade tomatillos hot salsa. Free sopspias (so?) for dessert were very good. Top notch service and very clean. We can't wait to come back!!!
Great food & large portions. Friendly staff & prompt service. We always try different dishes each time we go &  they are consistently delicious.

This place is hard to find since it's off from the main road.I like the decor and service. Our server was very nice. It's a big pricey for a place like this. The food are ok. My brother's stake was hard to cut. I ordered Taco which came in with rice and beans, and I liked it lot. I might not go back again and definitely going to find another authentic Mexican place. Sorry! :(
Great service, great food. Get the queso and quac. This place is excellent:) their portions are large but the service is on point too. Affordable date night or bring the kids.
The salsa was like water..very liquidy. I was already not thrilled with the food, but then got very sick as soon as I got home and was vomiting all night. Will definitely not be back.

Full disclosure: I'm not a big fan of Mexican in general beyond tacos that I cook myself at home. 

That said, this place is pretty great. Price is reasonable for the mountain of food you get with most meals, and the service has always been friendly and fairly prompt when I've eaten here. I've only ever been for dinner, so one of these days I need to do the lunch test and see if it's doable in a 'typical' lunch hour or not. 

For the one or two times a year that I am in the mood for Mexican, I go with Azteca!

This is going to be a mixed review.   We have been here many times and enjoy the food.  Unfortunately there are a number of servers that are not good.  

The portions and food are done really well.  The Carne Asada is always a go to favorite.  The Chile Verde is also another good choice.   

Unfortunately we just don't frequent this restaurant that much because of the poor service.

You don't need to order the Speedy Gonzales to experience extremely speedy service! They are FAST!

Food is spectacular. I recommend checking out their "special" menu that has pictures and everything... those aren't your run-of-the-mill items... we tried a dish that had fish, chicken and steak (and I wish I could remember the name of it!) Anyway, my boyfriend and I split it... it was so much food! Absolutely delicious though... more authentic than other menu items. The chips/salsa were plentiful and their fresh-made (in front of you) guacamole is delicious.

Love the sopapillas you get before you leave! Great touch!
Love this place. Food is amazing!! Big portions and not expensive! I always et the chicken chimichanga and I couldn't be happier!!
My favorite Mexican place in Charlotte by far. Great staff, super quick service, and delicious fare at reasonable prices. My favorite is pollo asado, but you simply can't go wrong. The real deal!
Authentic Mexican, total dive but great value for the amount Of food you are served. Service is always fast, and they tons of seating inside and on the patio. You never have to wait long for a table.

I love mexican food and I like Azteca restaurant around charlotte so we picked this spot since we were having a surprised B'day party for a friend who lives near by. The staff was courtious enough to work with us on the suprise B'day party. We were constantly going back and forth from our table to front door to see and make sure if they arrived or not so that we can supprise them and they didn't mind at all. 

We were total of 16 folks all together and they took really good care of us. Even after the supprise, they brought drinks on time, the food were ordered and it came in resonable amont of time considering we were big group. 

Even in between the supprise, apatizer and full dish items, we were hanging out like it was our place. No one bothered us and staff was very helpful in filling in our refills. 

All in all we had a plesent experience at this location.
Great restaurant for authentic Mexican quisen. They also have a bar.  I got the fiesta chimichanga. It was mouth watering.

I have been coming to this location since 2001. The place has not changed very much, typical 
"Aztecan" theme. Very colorful, one thing I can say is this place is very clean. The food is amazing the closest thing you will get to going to Mexico. I love the arroz con pollo, the wait staff has changed a little bit and that is why I am giving it four stars.They need to have a little more friendliness I shouldn't be able to read I don't want to be here on your face.
Awesome! Go on a Friday or Saturday night. Not only do yout get delicious traditional Mexican fare but also a fun atmosphere!
This place is sooo good!!!!! And the desert they give you delicious. Second time here and I'm happy. Large portions for cheap
They have the Best Salsa I have ever ate. I will be back to get more of this. An the Nachos was really good. A lot different than I have back home from where Im from.

One of the better Mexican Restaurants in Charlotte . Old school menu with Combo platters and platters. Been there many times over the past few years, I kind of feel like food quality is getting less. I ordered a Chili Rellano and it was burnt but filled with delicious cheese and Mexican Crema. Guacamole is good but expensive because they make it tableside . Chips are just meh. Waiters and Waitresses are very nice. You won't be overwhelmed with compliments when you go but it's not terrible .

I seriously want to jump into a bowl of their steak fajitas and eat my way out. They are by far the best in Charlotte. Fresh gaucomole cannot be beat, and you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't order it.

Never even knew about this place until I started hearing rumblings about this must eat place off Woodlawn.  I love Mexican food, probably my favorite, so I decided to give it a shot.

Meh...what's all the fuss about?  Very typical Mexican food.  Blindfold me, put a plate from Azteca or a place like Monterrey and I promise you I couldn't tell the difference.  

That being said....it's good.  I've been here several times and never been disappointed but at the same time, never overly impressed.  In the restaurant business no bad news is probably great news so take that as a compliment Azteca!

Service is quick and polite always.

Here in Charlotte from out of town. Just had an awesome lunch. Great drinks, guacamole at the table was made to order. The fish tacos were awesome and my wife had shredded beef tacos, the beef was very tasty.  The pico de gallo at the table was the best.
Big portions and nice staff, but the food wasn't as good as I expected :( but Im from San Diego where Mexican food is highly rated :)

Great staff. Super friendly. 100% authentic Mexican food. Not fancy but sooo good! Don't be scared when you pull up and it's connected to a days inn! Their fajitas and mojitos are yummy and their table side guacamole is a must. Ask for Nery, he's a great server! Sit on the patio if the weather allows! This place is consistent and reasonable.

I have been to Azteca many times and have always been satisfied. This time not so much. I can't put my finger on the reason, but I have to wonder if this time was an exception, or if the place had changed. Before this visit I would have rated Azteca 4, but now it's a generous 3.
Authentic mexican food for a great price! Delicious margaritas && tasty tacos! Always great service && very clean.

Friendly staff. Food portions are huge. Wide variety of menu options! The pitchers of margaritas is definitely for more than two people. Highly recommend this local establishment. Will definitely come back here the next time we are in town.

Si se puede! Yes I can eat Mexican two days in a row. This was Round 2, a quick lunch with friends. Apparently the cure for a hangover is their house made sopa, so off we went to this spot I had no idea was even here, stuck on the side of a Days Inn. I have to say, I was really surprised. The decor is fantastic, I instantly forgot I was mere yards away from South Boulevard and was transported to a Mexican hideaway. While I was headed to work and stuck with water, my friend had a beer the size of his face (hair of the dog that bit him.) 

The food was delicious. I had the Lunch Special #38- Avocado Tostada- and got a kick out of saying it- 38 Special! Ha! It was really delicious, even the rice and beans which I normally shove to the side. We enjoyed our sopapillas for dessert, and then had a quick photo shoot on the mechanical donkey by the front door. Sorry to say it's not plugged in, but it's good for a stationary picture! I will definitely be back- their dessert menu alone is tempting me!

I love this place. Food comes out fresh and hot. I also appreciate that most foods are not over salted. The portions are big. The tortilla soup is great but it's a bit salty for me so I have to water it down a bit. When I get home, I add some rice and more water and I can get another two servings out of it. :) I also love the live mariachi band on the weekends. My kids have a ball there.

Arriving here you must first clear a gauntlet of bees, get passed the gross garbage can holding the door open. Then once you get you order (to go) you are given the tiniest (about 1/32 cup) of salsa. The owner, Maria, says that's all I would get with my $18 order. Any more salsa I have to pay $1.25 for the same 1/32 cup size. RIDICULOUS!!!!
We went here for lunch today and it wasn't very good.  Food was bland and didn't taste all that great.  Nothing special...
Damn good food!   I love Mexican and its a hidden treasure.   Note you can get hot sauces to go.  Bring empty jars and get their green sauce its like fire.  La mejor comida mehicana en el sur este!!
Terrible, slow service. Server was rude and tried to charge everyone extra for more expensive entrees than what we ordered. Food was mediocre. I will never go back.
I ate here one night with my mom I was very disappointed the food wasn't good I ordered fajitas they were bland the salsa was watery as well

I don't know how authentic it is but I love their Mexican Stir fry dish. The location makes it easy to get to. The food in the menu is exactly what comes to the table. Just as you ordered it. The staff is attentive but I wish it was a little faster.

It was very busy when we went. The waiter took too long to come and take our order. The food took a long time to come to our table and our order was brought to us at different times. My bacon wrap shrimp was way over done, dry and hard. The beans and rice was not bad. My wife wants to give this place another chance. I dont.
Great place. Good prices. Wonderful service. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was that I thought there rice could be better.
Love this place!  The pickled cabbage that comes with the chips and salsa are my favorite.  Big selection for the money.

I'm in Charlotte for a week.  I have no problem eating this for dinner every night... but my waistline will!

Tons of tasty food for a really good price.  Wow!  Solid rice & beans served with a side of cole slaw -- and this was the SIDE to my entree (tamale/chile rellano/enchilada combo).  Today was takeout, but tomorrow -- going to try the dine-in option!!!
Great service... I'm from California and this is just as good as the Mexican food I have had in California.

I don't recommend calling here for takeout. The person taking phone orders kept putting us on hold, then switched us over to someone else who is unfamiliar with the menu. When picking up our order the person was very unfriendly. Food itself was underwhelming. Just go to Chipotle, less hassle.

We went to charlotte for the nascar race and stayed at a hotel near this restaurant. The location was very convenient since it was right across the street and we were pretty tired. The food was great! I had the shrimp enchiladas and they were pretty good. We also had a margarita pitcher which was good too. Service was excellent. No complaints.
Amazing service and food. Had the carne asada plate. They definitely give you your money's worth of food

I've been going to Azteca since I was a little chica. My dad would order "Mucho Margartia and Little Rockas." That meant daddy had a rough week. The servers have always been super personable and helpful especially if it's your birthday. They make the most commotion of any restaurant I've been to. Out comes the drums, guitars, triangles, a cow bell, a wooden flute, and this one that sounds like your going up Thunder Road (wooden roller coaster, for you non-Carowindseres).  So much is going on... Can be fairly terrifying at first. 

And then they bring you food :) My fav, which is not on the menu anymore, are the three steak carnitas with cilantro and onions served on corn tortillas dipped in salsa with a side of frijoles. What great prices too! They now have a fresh salsa/guac cart AND a woman making fresh tortillas. Looks like a pretty hot job, but she is so cool under the pressure. I never finish all of my food, so then!.. I get to reminisce the following day. 

Deeelightful.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte! Fast friendly service the food is always great and hot. Salsa is amazing. Highly recommended

Staying close to the airport for an early flight the next morning, we were just looking for sustenance. Decor was over the top colorful and overflowing. Oh well, at least the chips were good and warm and service was fast and friendly. I asked the waiter for suggestions and went with the arroz con pollo expecting a bland Americanized version. Looking around, most of the patrons were Mexican families, a good sign. The plate was the size of a medium pizza and overflowing with food. More like a stew, the entree was huge, full of flavor. The best I've had by far. Authentic Mexican. Outstanding.
The food was fine and served in a timely manner (refills were slower), but the waiter was rather short with us as he was the other times we were there. Otherwise it was okay.
Guacamole is on point. Service is great, the best I've seen. The food was good.
Seriously best Mexican food I have ever tried! Love coming here and getting steak tacos or carnita tacos. I truly believe they would be more popular if their location wasn't so hidden.
Food was so-so but I have had much better Mexican food elsewhere.  The place definitely needs to be rennovated and enlarged.

Loved it. Was starved after a long day with no lunch and found this place before flying home the next morning. Absolutely the best table side made guacamole I've ever had. Because they keep it simple. Perfectly rip avocados, minced onion, salt, fresh squeezed lime juice, a little jalapeno and tomato and a little cilantro. Then lightly smashed up to stay chunky. Was worth every penny. Then had a carne asada with grilled shrimp plate and everything was very good. Asada flavorful and tender and grilled as it should be. Great service and they make a decent michelada too. I will go back here again.

It's solid Mexican food with good service. Decent chips. Decent salsa. They even have a slaw like salsa that is tasty.  The actual food portion sizes are smaller than what I think we typically get. But they give you plenty of rice and beans to make up for it. It might just be me but I think their prices are creeping up a little as well. 

The best part is the unexpected little treat at the end.

We enjoyed our meal tonight, the Paella and the Dos Amigos were both awesome!! We eat at a lot of Mexican restaurants and I highly recommend this one! The staff was friendly and attentive, we had a great experience

This is, by far, our favorite Mexican place in the Charlotte area. Although they have other locations, I think this is the best one. If you like Fajitas, they have the best! The beef is nice and tender and very well seasoned. The service is just as good as the food! If you want a delicious dinner, at a reasonable price, you won't be disappointed here! Skip the mall restaurants, you won't be disappointed!!

We needed somewhere to go around 9pm for dinner. We have been wanting to try this place out for a while and it's always busy. We were seated immediately and our waitress was incredibly sweet. The service was fast, the food was tasty, and the portions were huge. The menu is endless and there is something for everyone! Definitely going here again.

This is my second visit to an Azteca, but first to this location. The service was spectacular. They had us covered on everything before we even had a chance to tell them we needed it. Drink refills, salsa, chips. Was great. Food was great as usual. Both our meals were right, no issues. Just like the other location, would not hesitate to come back.

We sat outside since it was a nice night. There was a party of 10 outside that immediately started doing shots. Add that to the fact that 5 of them were smoking and it took away from the experience. Our server did his best but was a bit overwhelmed from the large party. And was asked to take photos by 3 different tables. Tacky on the patrons part. He was clearly struggling as it was. The food was good, even though one of our orders was wrong. We chalked it up and took it. It was close. Fajita chimmichonga instead of just chicken. Still was good. Would definitely go back.

The absolute best Mexican food in Charlotte. Great service, great food and a great atmosphere. 

I had tried several places since Texas and Azteca is by far the best in Charlotte.

Went there a couple weeks ago for a business lunch and am catching-up on my reviews. I have eaten at this location many times and have never had a bad meal. It seems like the portions have gotten smaller though. It is always jammed for lunch but usually you are seated quickly.  The food is good and I especially like the pica de gallo (salsa).  The fact that they have been in business for so many years shows that they know what they are doing.  The prices are very reasonable.

My go to lunch spot if I'm meeting people out. Big fan of the chicken fajitas. You really can't beat fajitas for $8, and they're good! The service is always great and the food comes out quickly. Never been there for dinner but it's always super busy when I drive by!

I like the feel of this restaurant with nice lightings, buzzing with people and delicious food, though I must admit, the additional parking area shared with days inn looks kinda shady. Was here for dinner with my wife and was greeted with smiling staff, you do have options to sit out and have food but I preferred sitting indoors. The chips and salsa were good, but not anything extra ordinary. The dinner portions of fajitas and one more dish(forgot the name) were more than enough to make you full so be sure if you are bigger groups to not order too much. The taste was good, liked the freshness of the veggies and the chicken was well fried and all items were served hot. The tortillas were hot and were freshly made. This is a must go if you like Mexican food and with so much Mexican families coming to this restaurant, as I could see from the crowd, am pretty sure this is closest to the authentic taste they have in Charlotte. Please try it out.

I would not recommend this restaurant if you are served by Jorge. He barely acknowledged us as we were seated at his table. With a very stern look, he greeted us by abruptly asking us what we wanted to drink. Without even a faint smile, he was gone. The only time Jorge came back was to give us our check. Even that seem to irritate him. He was truly unpleasant and made our visit very disappointing. Although we should have left or gotten another an table, we were so hungry we stayed. We complained to the manager who was more defensive than empathic. Again, we were rather surprised with his response as well. As for the food, it was mediocre at best. There are plenty of other restaurants in the area. Do try those over this one.

I've been going to your restaurant since I was a little girl and it's literally one of my favorite places in the world to eat! Their service is awesome their customer service is awesome and everytime I eat there the food is always great!! To me you guys have the best fajitas in the world, anytime I want Mexican food you guys are the restaurant I choose!!!

Came to Azteca after a day of shopping in the area and made a last minute change to our dinner plans. Our group wasn't very keen on fast food so we picked a restaurant near our hotel and settled quickly on Azteca. In retrospect, we should have read reviews before deciding on this restaurant. Chips and dip were served when we sat down but instead of red and white sauce we got red sauce and Cole slaw. Kind of interesting for a Mexican restaurant. My dining companion had chicken fajitas, I had the chicken taco salad. The fajitas were very well prepared and the chicken was delicious. The taco salad was not very good. Chicken tasted funny and was served with cheddar cheese instead of the typical Mexican cheese which mixed differently with the chicken. Overall, I would not return to this restaurant but it wasn't too terrible for a last minute late meal.

Meh.  

The best thing here is the chips and salsa which while I love chips and salsa, it's not enough to make it a meal, especially after spending the afternoon drinking beer.

I ordered a combination of enchilada, taco, and tamal.  The taco consisted of mostly shredded lettuce.  The tamal was chicken, I was expecting pork.  And while there were no noticable flaws with the chicken enchilada, it really had no flavor.

The plate was huge but it was filled mostly with rice and beans.

Another flaw was I ordered an unsweetened iced tea and while the original order was correct, the refills were not.  This happens a lot in Mexican places.  If I wanted to drink sugar water with tea coloring, I would have ordered it!

And the worst thing of all from this experience is it sat with me the rest of the night...and not in a good way.

Azteca, what happened?  You were always an option for decent Mexican food but today's visit you were quite below average.

The service was good as it usually is here but my combination of chicken enchilada and beef taco had absolutely no flavor.  Couple that with the usual flavorless beans and rice and it was quite bland.  How could this happen at a once decent Mexican place.  Did you take lessons from Tres Pesos across the street?

Meh, I am sorry to say that I will not be returning here.
Best Mexican restaurant on the north side of Charlotte! We love La Unica, but the wait is much less here and the food is insane!
Love the food. But I was disappointed when order takeout and order pico de gallo salsa with chips. Got home and had their normal salsa not pico de gallo which I paid extra for.

First time here. Will be coming back. Server was fast and on attentive. He kept our drinks topped off! A must in my book. I got a shreded beef chimichanga. Delicious! Rice had some hard dried out spots, like i got the scrapped sides of the pan. My girlfriend got the arroz con pollo. It was ok... Tasted like cambells tomato soup... Overall was good and will be back to try something else!

Another Mexican restaurant that doesn't look like anything spectacular from the outside, but the inside doesn't disappoint. I'm starting to think the trend is that the worse looking the outside facade, the better the food & prices are. This Azteca may not have the best Mexican food, but it's pretty good, especially for the price.

Nothing really stands out to me about any of the lunch plates I've gotten, but I just know I leave very full. The place is a tad bit on the smaller side, with some odd booth arrangements, so expect a wait if you go during the lunch hustle & bustle. It can also be a pain getting in & out of the parking lot but it's well worth it.

Azteca is a lot more popular than you'd think from 1st look, but there's a reason people keep going back & waiting for tables during lunch. You'll leave full without hitting the wallet too hard.

Ahhhh, Azteca. You never disappoint! Another one of my "go - to spots", my best friend and I frequent here. Salsa is okay. Margaritas are always good! Everything I have ordered here has been yummy. I'm obsessed with cheese enchiladas though. And the rice and beans is soo GOOD! 

They can make guac at your table. GUAC! @ THE TABLE!!! And if you're lucky, you'll get the live mariachis to sing for you. Don't forget to tip them!

Don't forget to save room for the OH SO DELICIOUS caramel cheesecake. It's a MUST HAVE!!

Great lunch shortly after we landed at Charlotte airport! Fresh tortilla chips and salsa almost immediately appeared at our table when we were seated. The pork carnitas were spectacular and came with a nice variety of fillings to assemble soft tacos with. We also had the shredded beef chimichanga, which was tender and flavorful. The meal was hearty and topped with complimentary dessert of fried tortillas sprinkled with cinnamon sugar, a dollop of whipped cream, and strawberry sauce. Would certainly go back again!

2nd Time here, first was great food and drinks, 2nd time I wasn't as impressed, although my parents swear by the camerones Mexicano, which in my opinion was bland and an eye sore. The staff seemed unorganized and a bit lazy. The dishes aren't as well put together as they should be. The steak on the fajitas was a little tough.

08/24/11

Last meal in Charlotte before our flight.  Nice, bright atmosphere, and the restaurant was very large, which I couldn't tell walking in through the front door.  I liked the wood furniture and decor.  I had a feeling I'd been there before, but it's fairly new, and it was my first visit...

Everyone who tried the complimentary homemade chips and salsa enjoyed it.  I ordered the Two Taco combo, where I chose a soft taco filled w/ beef for myself, and gave a hard corn taco (also w/ beef) to my nephew.  Enjoyed everything else on my plate!  The "dirty rice" wasn't greasy, and I liked the texture and flavor of the refried beans.  Mom and sis shared a fajita combo platter, with chicken and shrimp, which they both enjoyed.  I'd sampled a juice (sorry, but forgot the name) drink that wasn't on the menu, but didn't like it- tasted like cough syrup to me, so I went ahead and ordered sweet iced tea.

Wouldn't mind going back to try their other lunch combos, or to have dinner there on our next visit to the Queen City!
People need to be more friendly and genuine but food portions are big and a lot and taste good
This place has gone way down hill lately. And the manager wether argue with you than provide good service.

I am a regular here , I have come here since my granddaughter was 2 with her and before her. Tonight I was surprised. Shocked they could not get my meal correct and it's basically potato skins. Brought to me twice and not what I asked for. This really bites. 
 Everyone else food seemed to be ok but mine , I'm still sitting here waiting for the Nachos Idaho which is potato skins. More to follow.
 They said they were comping my meal third time didn't get it right either. 
 Really really disappointed. 
 Comped my meal after three tries and 1.5 hours. 
I recommend no Saturday nights.
 Jesus the bar tending do it all had to fix my meal. He could not fix the others issues but it took so long to get to him. 
 He is the guy to ask for and never fails us. 
 Tonight we were failed. How do you comp a meal and still charge for soda?

Went here while in town for the weekend with a group of four, based on the great reviews.

Service was deplorable. Immediately got our drink order -- although a drink menu never showed, up so could order only what the server told us about. After drinks, was about 20 minutes before the waiter showed up again, to take our food order. The food came out and most of our group liked theirs. I found mine so-so, with the ribeye ordered medium rare and arriving somewhere between medium well and well done. 

Our requested water for the table showed up about five minutes before it was time to leave, and we ran out of drinks about 20 minutes before our waiter checked in on us after our food got dropped off.

All in all, I've had better Mexican food, but I've far better service. Maybe ours was an anomaly, given all the other ratings, but I was pretty disappointed and probably won't repeat. Only highlight was the pleasant tableside guacamole service, although even they didn't ask as to spiciness level, something I'm used to from other restaurants that make fresh guac to-oder.

Aztecsa is decent, but is reminiscent of a tourist trap. Kitschy decor, costumes, overpriced dishes & drinks, simple dishes were full of overly processed ingredients. My man got the fajitas (which were fresh) and I had 2 burritos. The chorizo had eggs and was the best thing we had. I'll keep looking for my new favorite place.
Good choice for Mexican food in Charlotte. Enjoyed the flautas as well as the cheese dip. It is one of the best cheese dips I have had at a Mexican restaurant.  Highly recommend.

The short woman that answers the phone and takes to-go orders will mess it up every time.  I went inside today to place my to-go order (because I've learned over time that she can't speak english well enough to place an order over the phone, so I must go there and wait) and I thought things were going well, until I got back to work and discovered that I only had 2 of my 3 orders.  I checked the receipt, nope, she only charged me for 2...  why?  Why did she simply reduce the number of items I ordered?  SO FRUSTRATING!!!  and it happens SO OFTEN with this woman :-(  WHY does ordering food and giving you money have to be such a drag?  When my boss says he wants soup from Azteca, it now ruins my day because I know I'm going to have to deal with this woman... she's very nice and friendly, but not good at the job she's being paid to do.

Slow to get seated, hostess was busy playing on her phone, didn't even know I was standing in front of her. Wait staff sat me. Wait staff is fairly attentive. 5 waiters, 23 guests. Salsa was average, chips are bulk ordered.  Ordered chicken quesadilla (fajita quesadilla-chicken). 20 minutes and still no food...  food arrived after a 25 minute wait, cmon man, it's Mexican food.  Food was good though. Pedro and Alex are awesome!

By far NOT the best Mexican around! This is the only Mexican place that does not seem to know how much people love chips and salsa! Come on people put some salsa on the table! What ever that is that you put on the table with chips...ITS NOT ENOUGH!!!
They are not friendly...orders are always messed up. Filling drinks....don't happen here so order 2 at the start! Be careful when ordering they call thing by different names here! Save yourself the headache and go to another minivan place this one just isn't worth it.

I was in the mood for some cheesy deliciousness when my significant other suggested Azteca. We started with some salsa where I was schooled in the proper way to spoon it on your tortilla chip. I found the salsa just ok- I like mine a little more chunky and less watery. We also ordered a side of guacamole which  unbeknownst to me was served table-side. 

My only real gripe came from the table-side service. While it tasted good, the "chef" loomed over us for quite awhile afterward in obvious attempt to garner a tip ( there was a huge tip jar tapped over the side so that it practically touched our table and  screamed "tip me!"). My boyfriend gave a few dollars but honestly we are tipping our servers, and paying for the Guac, why don't the table-side chefs just take a portion of the tips? I just found it to be a little tacky honestly. 

The food itself all tasted delicious. I loved my enchiladas (2nd only to La Paz), and his Arroz con pollo was great too. Drinks were filled fairly regularly and service was fine. 

The decor and lively birthday celebration singing make this a nice place for the whole family. The prices are beyond reasonable too so it's definitely budget friendly.

Best of all the little complimentary dessert, fried tortilla with cinnamon, honey, and whipped cream, was a perfect way to end the evening. 

I won't hesitate to come back!

This is by far the best Mexican food I have ever eaten.  My co-worker turned me onto this place and it has ruined my previous favorite Mexican restaurants as there is no comparison.  It doesn't look like much on the outside, but the food is awesome.  I always get a Number 31 with beef and their beef is seasoned so good.  Love this place!!

Finally, I got to see what table-side guac was!  And it was so cool!  The lady comes out and asked if we wanted one or two (two is gigantic!) and then has all the spices (onions, tomato, jalapeno, etc.) and you tell them exactly how much or how little you want and you taste it until it's exactly how you want it.  Awesome experience!  The food is true to Mexican form, which is hard to find, I'm always finding Tex-Mex around here and you get HUGE portions for the price.  The plate is almost 2 feet wide.  I've never seen such a large portion.  We had the jumbo tableside guac, extra chips and salsa (which unfortunately it's not bottomless chips there :( ), 2 combo platters with 2 tacos and an enchilada, rice, beans, and cole slaw, and a complimentary dessert which they throw in like Chinese restaurants throw in fortune cookies (which was yummy) all for less than $30, plus the servings were so big I had a lot to take home.  I definitely recommend it to anyone that likes real Mexican.  I've only been able to find On the Border around here for tolerable Mexican, but I think this may beat it.  They gave us different types of salsas too.  Even the cole slaw style was good.  I wasn't really a fan of the bland one, too watery, but the second one they gave was great.  They have outside seating which was relaxing.  I wish it wasn't next to a Days Inn, but I didn't see any shady characters running around.  The bathrooms could be a little cleaner tho.
It was very good fresh food. We enjoyed the guacamole they make at your table side. The fajitas were enough for both of us!! We recommend  this Mexican restaurant.

Traveling through Charlotte? This is right off of I-77, open late and was a great place for a quick meal- we were in and out in about 30 minutes without being in any huge rush. It was a nice break from rest stop fast food options. 

Food was standard American-Mexican style. Lots of cheese, not terribly spicy or flavorful, really, and the standard menu choices. Portions were absolutely insane, which means a bonus snack further along your route if you take leftovers. 

We had queso, fajitas and a combination plate for $26. Plus, free sopaipillas for dessert!  Service was curt and efficient, which worked fine for us.

My husband and I have been looking for really good Mexican food since we moved to Charlotte. I came across Azteca when searching on Yelp! And we decided to give it a try. Upon entering, the hostess was nice and very accommodating (we had our one year old asleep in his stroller). The ambience of the restaurant is nice, some murals, a lot of brick and Spanish tile. Once we were seated, our servers took our order and brought out chips and salsa. Both tasted store bought. There was something weird about the flavor of the salsa that I just couldn't handle. It's like they put cotija in the salsa. It gave it a really pungent taste. By pungent I mean that sour tang you taste when you have aged cheese. Don't get me wrong, I like cotija, just not in my salsa. We started with Albondigas. The broth was good, but that was it. The meatballs were so dense. It was obvious that they massaged the meat too hard. We couldn't break them apart without them sloshing in the broth. On top of that, they lacked any flavor. The potatoes and the carrots were raw and so undercooked. The only thing that was cooked correctly was the zucchini. Seriously? They serve raw vegetables in their soup?? I ordered one shredded beef taco and one cheese enchilada. My husband ordered one chicken taco, one beef taco, and one geese enchilada. My son woke up and we ordered him a simple cheese quesadilla. My son's quesadilla came out first. My first reaction was "wtf?" It was a quesadilla with cheese smothered all over the outside. It was everywhere and it was so greasy, it looked like it was sitting in a puddle of orange oil. I pushed it aside. There was no way I was feeding that to my son. My meal came next. It was okay. I think this restaurant uses the wrong cheese and too much of it. My entire plate was yellow. It's like there was a sale on American cheese and the restaurant was trying to use it all up. The beef in the taco was good, the shell tasted and looked store bought. My husband felt the same way about his plate. While they do have big portions, it doesn't make up for the lack of flavor, and in the case of the albondigas, it doesn't make up for the lack of edible food.

I was thinking "Yeah I'll give them a 4-star review!" but then I realized I have no experiences which led me to think they deserved less than five!

First of all I can't believe it took me so long to finally check this place out. Considering I live just around the corner and have basically commuted past it for over 4 years. When you come in you are typically greeted in Spanish with an "Hola" before being brought to a table. As with most Mexican restaurants they have what I would call a chip busboy. Basically a guy that is dedicated to running chips around to people that have just been seated. When you get your chips and salsa, don't forget to ask for pico as well. There is no additional charge and it is a bit spicier than the salsa. (I just dump the two together in one bowl and dig in.)

Probably the most notable thing here is the size of the plates. You're thinking "Sure, big plates with lots of garnish. Big whoop." And you're right, it's one thing to have a big plate and another to fill said plate. Azteca fills 'em so you can fill your guts. Edge to edge, 360 degrees. Ever heard the saying that empty space helps compliment the items in an area? No it doesn't, fill that spot with rice, refries, salad and cheese-enchilada sauce melted over the edges. That's right Bojangles, you can keep your tiny biscuit cheese-skirt. Azteca's is bigger, better and blankets an enchilada stuffed with delicious. (Yes, delicious is a noun now.) As far as enchiladas go, I can highly recommend the menu item Enchiladas Suizas. You will be happily plump on less than $10.

Round-out your filling meal with a few of those easy-to-drink Mexican beers. Last but not least you will receive a pie-like slice of crispy sopapilla topped with a sweet cinnamon glaze and whipped cream. You might even think you could eat a whole Azteca-sized plate of these. (Let's not push it though...)

This place is a jewel in the rough, and I think that a lot of people won't have the pleasure of discovering how good their food actually is. That's too bad, because this place has got some tasty treats waiting for you.

Came here with my Dad, and we had a really great meal. Their table side guacamole is great- nothing surprising, but it's nice that you can get extra jalapeño or whatever you want. I ordered the ostiones as an appetizer, and they were MAGICAL. White people, pay attention here:  ANY TIME you are at a Mexican restaurant and you see 'ostiones', you need to ORDER THEM. Similar to 'shrimp cocktail', Mexican raw oysters are a completely different animal from their guerro counterparts. The ostiones came with a delicious habañero salsa, which MADE the experience. Seriously, this is one of those things that you need to try in order to broaden your world. Get your mind right, playa.

I ordered a steak, and it was exactly what I wanted. Their bisteka a la tampiquena is spot-on, perfectly seared skirt steak with fat onions, rice, and beans. 

This is the sort of place that you need to come to if your only experience with Mexican food is a step up from Taco Bell. They have enough stuff to keep boring eaters happy, but they also have a few interesting offerings for the more adventurous-minded. Come and try something new- you might just love it!!!

In another life, I used to visit the Azteca on Woodlawn at lunch with some regularity, and I have to say that I did not care for it all that much.  I have to say that this location is actually much superior, and I really cannot put my finger on just why that is, though I do have some ideas.

For one, the building is so much larger.  Housed in the former McGuffey's (that should take some of you way back), it is not the cramped little space off of Woodlawn, and that alone makes a huge difference.  Add to that a better service vibe and the quick seating provided by the larger space and you are already off and running.

Recently they have added a funky little patio out back, which unfortunately means you are looking at Independence Boulevard, but still a cool space, and you have a winning combination.  Throw in some excellent food, and your standard chips and salsa - though unfortunately they currently do not offer their super-chunky-pico unless you ask for it, and you may actually be charged (apparently due to tomato shortages).

Definitely a worthwhile stop, and you are likely to be hit lightly in the wallet, and have leftovers for the next day to boot!

Came here once for lunch. It wasn't that busy and service still wasn't great. Their salsa is ok but a little bland. I got their lunch tacos with rice. I asked for soft tacos instead of hard shell and still got hard shell. No one even came to the table to check on us after we got our food. I got ground beef with my tacos and the meat was very greasy. It was so greasy, the juices soaked the hard shell by the time it got to the table. That was the exact reason why I wanted soft tacos. Their food is mediocre and so is their service.

Very nice decorations and ambiance including a fresh tortillas making station.  My husband and I  were there around noon on a Sunday and were seated right away In a nice booth.   Menu was full of wonderful options including lunch options that were available on weekends.  Fresh guacamole was just ok. It was prepared in the usual manner but they had aluminum foil lined in the pestle. That was a nice way to wrap up the leftovers to take home but not sure it allowed all the mixing needed. I had the chicken enchilada from the lunch menu. The chicken was white meat and tasty. The side of rice was typical but the refried beans were very tasty. My husband had the chicken chimichanga and enjoyed it about the same as some other places.   The chips didn't seem to have any salt on them. The queso was very good. Overall it was a good experience with tasty food.

First time being here. The decor is quite cool and the atmosphere is authentic. Even the Don Juan I had was very good. Service is average, with having to ask multiple times for things that an attentive waiter would notice. The other downside is that this is probably one of the most expensive Mexican restaurants I have ever been to in the Charlotte area. Will give it another try in the future and see.
If you don't get the carnita's you're doing it wrong. Server was attentive but never felt rushed. Dining room was lively for a Tuesday night but never loud.
Very affordable lunch meals that will fill you up.  Excellent guacamole made at your table. Super friendly staff that seems to know exactly when your chips are running low.

Awesome service and even better food! The waiter was very attentive and helpful. The dishes are huge! I ended up getting chicken and beef enchiladas and they were very good even though I wish they had a little more meat in them but they were cooked perfectly. The beans and rice are awesome! They turned out to be my favorite part of the meal.

Arrived from out of town and found this gem near our hotel. Food was good, but especially enjoyed the carved wood decor and all the staff wearing World Cup soccer shirts. Staff were friendly and attentive.

Wasn't great but wasn't horrible. My sister and I went here on a saturday night last weekend. The main reason for choosing this place is because we were visiting out other sister who had to work that night. We had limited options of where to eat as we didnt want to go to downtown charlotte (or uptown I guess as it is called down south).......with that said we had this and two other sit down places within walking distance of the hotel we were staying at (not the day's inn that this is attached to). As my sister was craving a margarita this place was the winner. 

I liked that we got sat right away- even though it seemed busy for a saturday night around 6pm. They offered us indoor or outdoor seating and we chose the indoor. We got a booth seat stat. Our waiter was at our table in a flash. drinks out fast as werer the chips & Salsa and someone came by to offer us fresh made guac. We ordered some and it was good. Not the best but good enough. Portion sizes were decent- I got a house burrito of some sort that they were known for- it was huge. My sister got some combo plate-  taco and enchilada I think? And it came with rice and beans. Huge serving. She couldn't finish and I could barely finish mine. We left full and happy and satisified. And they gave us some treat at the end of our meal- a fried tortilla with strawberry sauce and whipped cream.

We came here after we left another restaurant for dinner due to their slow service and it was like night and day!  Sure- this is your typical Mexican joint, but the atmosphere, speedy service where they really cater to you, and the price is where this place sets itself apart. I got the Don Juan entree with chicken, and I had plenty to bring home. The chicken in this dish is worth the price as it's not the dried out shredded chicken in most other plates. The mushroom flavor was evident but reminded me too much of my favorite canned Cream of Mushroom.

The chips and salsa were flowing, the mariachi band kept the patrons moving, and the food was plentiful.  I'll come here anytime I need a fix of quick and tasty Mexican food.

This is my go to place for a huge Mexican dinner and an awesome margarita. I usually get the large plate--and it's large! Mix of whatever you like, taco, enchilada with a lot of rice and beans covered in cheese on the side. You should always get a free fried dessert at the end... although the last time our server was not very friendly and didn't give us one. Usually their staff is friendly however.
This place is very legit. The foods come across very authentic. They have a guacamole cart and come around and make custom guacamole at your table which is awesome! Would recommend.

Azteca...sure....why not. I rolled in here on a Saturday afternoon while I was running some errands in the neighborhood. My craving for Mexican was taking over and Yelp led me here. 

Hubs and I were politely greeted and seated in a big 'ole comfy booth. The surroundings are reminiscent of a Chi-Chi's if you've ever had the unfortunate experience of visiting one. Mexican inspired and, well, Aztec-y. The chips were toasty and tasty but the salsa left me a bit sad. No chunks present - just watery blah. But no matter, the guacamole guy came rolling down the aisle and offered us some green magic. We asked for spicy guacamole and it was indeed full of heat...and flavor! My only gripe? For one avocado, the guac price was $7.95...that's steep IMO. 

Onto the entrees...I ordered the enchilada & tamale combo. This option came out on a massive, shallow plate. MASSIVE and covered in sauce and or cheese. Hmph. I *think* the enchilada flavors could have been nice but the cheese dumbed down most of it. The enchilada far superseded the tamale - which was super, duper bland and cakey. The refried beans and rice were standard and nothing to write home about. Meh.

While the service was friendly and efficient, the meal also ended on a sweet note with those crispy cinammon bites with a dab of whipped cream and strawberry sauce. Free little chips of wonder - I could have easily eaten five of them in a snap. Will I head back to Azteca? Perhaps, if I'm in the neighborhood and positively craving Mexican...but I'm not rushing back here anytime soon.

Had a wonderful fajita salad w/beef last night - the steak was perfectly cooked and tender. Generous sides of avocado and everything. Staying at local hotel so had it to go - best 'traveling food' I've had in a while. They were busy and still got my order done in 10 mins.  Will be back!

I orderee the pollo asada. It was quite delicious and the beans were delicious as well and i normally dont eat beans.  The chicken was flavorful and juicy. Only thing that could be better was the salsa because it was too watery.

Azteca is a fun Mexican restaurant with great people and even better food!  The interior is decorated with bright colors, Aztec patterns and designs, and the servers wear over-the-top uniforms modeled after traditional Mexican formal wear - it feels like Cinco de Mayo everyday (and gets even better ON Cinco de Mayo!).  

On weekends, a table-to-table cart makes fresh guacamole, which is incredible, and a lady makes all tortillas by hand as they're ordered.  The portions are heaping, the prices low, and the margaritas are big enough to swim in.  From what I know about REAL Mexican cuisine, the mole sauce is pretty authentic and the cactus salad is very fresh and bright.  Great time to visit is Sunday, when they have a live mariachi band that makes sure to serenade each table and takes requests.

In my humble opinion, there isn't a better Mexican restaurant in the South Charlotte area!

Best Albondigas Soup in the US!!!!  We moved to SC from Southern California, where we thought made the best Mexican Food, but Azteca Mexican Restaurant has it down like no tomorrow!  
My husband and I both ordered a bowl each. He went ahead and ordered the pork Carnitas, but I knew the bowl was going to be big based on the price, so I held off ordering anything else. First, our waitress brought a small bowl 1/2 filled with chopped white onion the other 1/2 filled with chopped Cilantro and on top was a slice of a lime!!!!
When the bowls of soup arrived our eyes nearly bugged out of our heads!  It was AMAZING! So amazing that we told our waitress to tell the manager and she got him for us!  Alex is a very concerned, very gracious manager. He was so happy that we were so happy!

You MUST try a Frozen Mango Margarita!  Again, the best we've ever had!!!!
By the way, the Pork Carnitas were very good also, it was just that my husbands eyes were bigger than his stomach and I was so very happy with my Albondigas Soup!

If you like really good Mexican Food, go see Alex and tell him Joe and Monica sent you  :)

After moving from the west coast it has been difficult for us to find a solid Mexican restaurant until now. This place is pretty good. They are very friendly and the portions are huge! They also offer a Mexican coleslaw/pica with the chips and salsa that sounds weird but is kinda addicting haha, we will be back very soon!

Went here in Yesterday (Aug 2016) with a crowd of 12. It was about 3:00pm. We were seated immediately and they took drink orders right then. I went to wash up and by the time I got back my drink was at the table. We ordered shortly after and we were served very quickly with really good food. It was authentic Mexican food. I have had better salsa but my Deluxe Burrito was awesome. Everyone loved their food and I can't speak highly enough about the service. Our Waiter was friendly and fast. Great experience.

This place was phenomenal. Huge potions, great chips and salsa, and this delicious chip thing that they gave us for dessert. Service was also superb -- there was so much food that we had leftovers, but they didn't bring us a bag, and I was just about so say something when a waitress came over and quietly bagged our boxes for us. Can't wait to go back!
I have been here twice for lunch and both times were great. Large portions and fast service. The service was good but not great. But that shouldn't stop you from having a good meal.

pros: large portions
cons:  taste/quality is average, service (saw waitress maybe 3 times total)

I ordered the enchiladas Rancheras but got a quesadilla instead. The food came out fairly quickly but the flavor wasn't that great. The chicken was rather dry and the tortilla was super soggy. Maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things? The fried ice cream was frozen inside, meaning there were shards of ice instead of smooth ice cream. We had to flag down a server who wasn't ours several times because our waitress was nowhere to be seen after taking our order.

As of now this is my favorite Mexican restaurant!  I love this place!  Every time I go to Charlotte I make sure to go here!  Not only is the atmosphere here wonderful but so are the people!  The queso (cheese dip) is phenomenal.  The chips and salsa are great as well, it even comes with what I believe is Mexican coleslaw (I could be wrong on the name but it's some type of Mexican salsa lettuce thing) but I love to mix it into the salsa.  Although I may be eating it wrong, I definitely recommend mixing it with the salsa.  I always the pitcher of margaritas here.  Now if you're splitting it between two people you may not be able to finish it, it's strong and larger than it appears!  Be warned!   I think it's about 7 margaritas (or more) but it's a good amount for the price for sure! Moving on to the food mmmm delicious!  I have only ordered the tacos here so far because I'm so hooked on them I always get one soft and one hard chicken taco.  Usually at most Mexican restaurants I've been to the soft taco is always soggy because of all the juices coming from the chicken, but here it was perfectly moist and juices didn't drip down to my elbow lol.  The perfected the chicken taco! My experiences here have been nothing but great so definitely make your way here if you love Mexican and margaritas!

Unpretentious Mexican restaurant with good food (and lots of it--portions are huge) and quick but friendly service. My go-to order at Mexican restaurants is fajitas, and I really love the marinade they use at Azteca. The tableside guac is delightful and the margaritas are BIG. Skip the Mexican joints in the trendier parts of town and give Azteca a try.

I've enjoyed Azteca for the past 2 years. However, my past experience wasn't pleasant. For starters the Camarónes de Mexicano was loaded with salt and the Pork Carnitas had barely any meat (mostly fat). When I explained to the waiter that the Camarónes de Mexicano had too much salt and that people at our table suffer from high blood pressure. He replied "Next time let us know sooner so we can make the adjustment". I find that interesting since there was more than 3/4 of the meal on the plate and the food was on our table for only 15mins.
Needless to say our frustration was reflected in the tip. There's always room for professional development or customer service training.

Needed to update the rating of this place as four stars is misleading.  I've been back here a couple of times through the past couple of years, and the food and service has slowly deteriorated.  The food issue was that the grub is not so good anymore and the service issue is there is a lack of attentiveness.

Came here at the start of 2014 with a friend to catch up on a busy December, but made it difficult to talk bc the restaurant was such an issue.  Trying to get the attention of a waiter, waiting on tortillas while the fajita plate got cold, and drinks empty for most of the time.  

I'm probably done here.  It feels like the quality of Mexican food is improving in Charlotte overall, so no need to rely on just this location.

dmo out.

The food was amazing! Huge, delicious portions at a great price. I can eat here and have leftovers for days. The margaritas are also huge and delicious. 
My boyfriend ordered carnitas and loved how tender they were. I usually get a burrito azteca and take half of the plate home. 
This is a great place for if you're really hungry or just want some authentic Mexican food. Azteca is legit.

One of our fav. places to eat.... we will miss Ricky of course however their staff are all excellent. Food and drinks are amazing... I never have had a complaint on anything we have ordered... Love this place!
Great food, drinks and fantastic service makes Azteca an area favorite. There is something for everyone in your groups taste on the menu. You must give Azteca a try.

This is one of my favorite restaurants for Mexican cuisine. My brother in law  uses a phrase , "sitting on swole", (as in swollen). This phrase aptly describes any meal from Azteca. The food is EXCELLENT and the portions are plentiful.  There is rarely a wait to be seated and if there is a wait it's well worth it. I make a hearty meal a must any time I'm  in the area. The shredded beef is OUTSTANDING! Good stuff.

I came here last night to meet up with a few friends. I'd never been here and wasn't too excited about it because I'd just had Mexican food last week, but decided to go simply for the fellowship. I walked in and was greeted immediately. I was the first person to get there so I got us a table. The waiter came right over and asked if I wanted anything to drink. I ordered the blue margarita which was actually really yummy. The chips and salsa were AMAZING!!! I usually ended up adding seasoning to salsa at Mexican restaurants because they're typically bland, but this salsa was perfect! I ordered a shrimp dish with rice, mushrooms, and onions and was surprised to see how big the dish was! Our food came out in a timely manner and looked amazing. I made the HUGE mistake of going to the restroom before digging in. As I walk in, I pass an employee standing at the sink texting on her phone. Out of the 3 stalls, two of them were dirty. A lady came in after me and went into the stall that I'm assuming was at least decent. I go into the lesser of two evils and, just to my luck, the door is broken and it won't close properly. UGH!! I was forced to go into the stall that needed attention and just flushed the toilet before using it but soon realized that I should've just waited for the lady to finish in the decent stall. I had no tissue!! I guess the employee was too busy making sure the text was sent to whomever to check the cleanliness of the bathroom. I go up to wash my hands and see used paper towels in one of the two sinks. I guess she couldn't be bothered enough to even throw the paper towels in the trash. Those texts must've been super important. I had to force myself not to think about what I saw in the bathroom as I went back to eat my food. I had to push the image out of my mind and try to shake it off. Yuck!! My food was DELISH and I was more than pleased. The staff needs to pay just as much attention to ensuring that restrooms are clean as they do the food because this makes for a complete experience for the guest. I would recommend this place but will warn you, use the restroom at home before coming in here.

I think I have said this before , but Mexican is just not my favorite food, with that said ... maybe I should reconsider, but only if we are visiting Azteca. There absolutely isn't one dish I have not enjoyed here, and the best part. Home made tortillas , not mass produced cold pockets of reheated carbs, I really could see the smiling worker making these by hand near my table . Love fresh guacamole? Tackle the member rolling the guac cart around and  get your guac specially made for you here, wait, don't tackle them... I do not want to be responsible for you hurting this wonderful person. ;)


Normally I order anything seafood related, everything has been seasoned just right and the portion sizes are huge, bring your appetite. Fresh chips with salsa while you wait for your food for free, and a tasty honey drizzled, cinnamon , whipped cream , with strawberry glaze as a  yummy dessert treat to finish. Could it get any better? YES, You must try the margaritas, especially the self dispensing vase of liquid deliciousness that can be placed on your table for numerous refills on your time .

I would love to give this place 5 stars but my husband was not satisfied with his dish. I had the Steak with Shrimp and it was delisciuos. It had rice, beans,vegetables and huge hot pepper. Chips and salsa tasty but salsa could be alittle bit thicker. They gave you a free little tortilla chip with whip cream and strawberry drizzle on it. It was tasty. Friendly and good service. My husband had the Chicken Fahitas. He ordered them due to the reviews. He would have preferred larger strips of Chicken instead of small leftover pieces. I will be back with my mama to try again but probably not my husband.

3.5 stars.  My husband and I frequent Azteca when we have a taste for cheese enchiladas, since theirs are some of the best.  

Their salsa is very good, and somewhat spicy.  For starters, we like their queso dip and made-at-your-table guacamole (although I don't think they add lemon or lime to theirs?).  

But the main course is almost always their cheese enchiladas, served with beans and rice.  They are larger than usual, and FULL of cheese.  Their beans used to taste like the canned variety, but they are much better now.  I like their rice as well.  Platters are huge, and we both always have leftovers.

As others have mentioned, service can be hit or miss.  It really depends on who you get.  Either way, we always return, because we just haven't found better cheese enchiladas in CLT.

Not the best Mexican food Charlotte but definite top five. Great family place. Have live mariachi music occasionally too. Good food and reasonably priced. Large restaurant, good for parties. Always a fun time.
Hands down my favorite place to get Mexican. I visit this location often and have an excellent experience. Food is always excellent and the queso is highly recommended!

Here is what I didn't like about This place. 

My food was underwhelming and just plain.  I ordered a taco salad and asked for grilled shrimp instead of beef or chicken.  They were going to charge me extra which I said was fine but when she said it would be $7.99 extra I almost fainted.  Why can't they substitute for the same price? Or only charge me a few bucks extra? My salad was only $8.00 so there was NO way I was paying $15 or some shrimp and iceberg lettuce.  I went with chicken.  It was so bland in taste.  I only had a few bites and didn't even eat the rest.  :-( Quacamole was good but that's about all she wrote.

New to town my boyfriend and myself went due to the raving reviews. HonestLY we were pretty disappointed. I used to work in a Mexican restaurant that was rating the best by the state and I didn't recognize half the food. Also I though it was strange my dish came with  coleslaw....and I'm pretty sure it was spoiled. The food was mediocre , but not excellent. My boyfriend insisted the chips tasted like sweat. BUT the reason I WONT go back is their margaritas. You get the choice of size and flavor, that's it . I figured I start off with a basic strawberry and I had 2 by the end of the meal. They were not worth it. 4 margs came to $34!! I was baffled. PASS

I'm traveling through Charlotte for business from Houston. I'm a big lover of all things Mexican.

Let me start by saying that the staff here are fun.  I love authentic places and this place had a lot going on.  I sat at the bar and ordered margaritas that were amazing.
