I would rather go for an independent place rather than a chain and I'm so glad that I did!!! I love this place. Tacos on point. Authentic. 

If you are in Charlotte especially traveling stop by!

It's on our regualr rotation . Great table side gauc, Good service and for the past 11 years it doesn't let us down. More food then you can eat in three days and always a fun time. I love the Chicken con crema, the ceviche, the tortilla soup. The fried ice cream yadda yadda really a stand by for us
Really not impressed. It was so crowded and took forever to get a seat. For two of us, too. Very generic Mexican food and not even that great.

Okay, having been raised in So Cal, don't expect So Cal. But, you can get close, since once you tell them that you want REAL queso in the enchilada and not cheddar they will give you the Mexican white queso.  The enchilada sauce is more Texas style, so you may want to go Verde.  The carne asada is quite good! get a side of pico de gallo and toss it in your salsa and you'll be fine.  I special order my margs, and the staff finally has seen my fat face enough to know how I like them.
If I could give it more stars I would! Amazing food! The carne asada is so yummy! I'm from CA and picky when it comes to Mexican food, but this place didn't let me down. Absolutely amazing food!!
Best old-school Mexican restaurant in town. Service, quality of food, and ambiance all deliver above what we're all used to. Don't miss the Arroz Con Pollo!!

The food was pretty decent at this place.  The salsa is rather thin, but it has a good flavor.  The cabbage mix here was basically flavorless.  It is much better at other locations.  

It was a Friday night and very busy, but we were seated immediately.  The server wasn't very personable or friendly.  He wouldn't spilt items on the bill for us and was overall rude.  He mostly had other people bringing out our food items and refilling drinks.  He also never checked back to see how everything was.  

Not a bad experience, I would try again one day if I was in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way.

Very slow service!!! It's such a shame, because I do enjoy the food. The last 3 times I went, I couldn't get refills or order my sides (like extra ranch) because they never came back to the table!!! I love the pico they serve. Food is always great! Service sucks.

This place offer large portion of food, nice service but the complementary chips/salsa was not fresh and the food was not extraordinary.
I am not going back anytime soon.

Something hilarious about this Azteca outpost being attached to a slightly retro Day's Inn. Love the weird, ad hoc additions to the architecture - thatched roof beverage station awkwardly built into a corner, odd wood and glass entry hallway made more cramped by the quarter-for-a-bronco-ride thingy. 

Everything here is slightly more compressed than the Matthews location - booths narrower, tables closer. Service more harried because they do a LOT more business here - even at a slightly off time for dinner, the place was hoppin'. 

I could be imagining things, but I feel like prices were 50 cents higher than the other location, hmm. Servings were a tad smaller, for sure, but you don't need to finish that arm-sized burrito, anyway. 

Onto the food: I got the Macho Burrito, he got the usual (fajitas). Now, I've had the Macho at Don Pedro, the other Azteca location, and here - it's a nopales burrito, so it's full of pickled cactus. This was by far the best version I'd had - because the jalapenos were fresh, so it wasn't almost too salty to eat (which, admittedly, has never stopped me from ordering it before). Goooood. A mild, almost mozzarella queso was used instead of the monterey jack I'm used to, continuing the low-sodium thing (except for the nopales). Awesome.

Fajitas were, well, Azteca Fajitas - smothered in sweet teriyaki-style flavors. Weird.

I'd come back if I were in the nabe and had a serious burrito craving, but I'd probably be thinking about the taco trucks and taquerias down the street the whole time.

Azteca is rad for a number of reasons: huge portions (come here for lunch, they have 4-5$ specials!), super-sweet waitstaff, and great decor. There's a smoking lounge here that's a mix of villa and sports bar, with high-backed booths and hanging fake foliage. Classic.
Veggie fajitas are awesome, but odd- stir-fried with a teriyaki-style sauce, the flavors aren't super-authentic. The same can be said of most of the menu, although admittedly, I'm missing a lot of it, being vegetarian. But for comfy, ameri-mexican, this place is tops. When they seat you, make sure to ask for the tomatillo sauce-- it's tasty and authentic, and if you're feeling the need to nosh on an over-sized bowl of pickled jalapenos with your meal, it will only run you a dollar for the side.

Great place to eat when you are in the mood for mexican food in Charlotte. Here's why it's a 5 star in my book:

1. Service AND Friendliness: Always great and consistant. I've been coming here over the last 2 years and the service is always quick to please and friendly.

2. Food: The quality, quantity and variety of food they offer is wonderful. I've brought many people here from work over the last 2 years and not one person has had an "average" meal for lunch or dinner. 

Their guacamole, super nachos, cheese dip, table salsa and chips, their beef, chicken and picadillo (my favorite) as well as the other things we've had on the menu..... it's simply very good to great food and the portions and prices are great. 

Bottom line is that its a great place to eat at for lunch or dinner.

Tried Azteca for the first time Friday. Certainly an authentic Mexican feel. The staff was friendly, as we were seated right after a five minute wait. I ordered the camerones del mojo y ajo (shrimp with garlic and lime/lemon). I've had it at different restaurants and this was NOTHING like it. Be prepared that the onions are large pieces that come on a bed of lettuce. Only halfway through my meal did I realize there was rice underneath. They leave the shrimp in the shell, which is a pet peeve of mine, as it makes eating a chore. However, the taste of the shrimp was good and strongly garlic flavored. My date had shrimp and fish with some kind of nuts that he enjoyed. We also had guacamole, which was not good. It lacked lime and salt (date enjoyed it though). Overall, I would recommend Azteca. Just be careful about what you order, as it may not be what you expect. I'm probably overrating this place because the service was good and my date liked it more than me.

You Got my Margarita perfect! 
I don't like it icey, but more like a Italian Ice style. It was Perfect! 
Also loved that it wasn't heavily loaded down with lime flavoring, most other restaurants do this to hide the lack of alcohol, not this place! Also, BEST Salsa around! 
They come around to your table and make fresh Guacamole if you want it.
I like our normal booth we get (the hole) it's comfortable for someone, like me, with anxiety in public places.  I would be leaving 5 stars if the meat was different.. we don't care for the flavor of the ground beef. 
Customer Service was great!

I stopped here on the way to the airport. It's connected to a Days Inn so I had to question how good it was going to be. But given the clientele I would say the food is authentic. The menu offers lots of choices and the beer and ritas are good. So why the three stars? The service sucked. I was there with a relative who lives in Charlotte and we ordered light (me nachos and she the tres Leche cake, both good) and we were basically ignored for the entire time we were there. The food took so long to come out that we both joked about it. But honestly I was pissed about how long it took to get two simple dishes to our table and about how little attention we were paid. So, food good, drinks also good, service sucked.

My experience with the food here is always bleh- the dishes always taste like something is missing. I tried their shrimp n chicken burrito this time. The taste didn't wow me. The sauces are to watered down. Needs more flavor.
Food was good, but overpriced. This is a gringo's restaurant, not one for Mexicanos. With so many choices, I would only come back if looks were most important.

Really enjoyed this place.  Traditional mexican menu.  The highlight was definitely the guacamole which was made fresh and to our taste right in front of us.  The tacos and quesadillas were good, but a bit soggy.  Service was great.  Would definitely recommend stopping by just for the guac.

When I'm thinking of going to a Mexican restaurant I never think of Azteca, but my friends always seem to love it there.  I can't say I have never had anything there that I didn't like, the food really isn't bad, its just not amazing by any means.  The service can be hit or miss, but they area always friendly.  The place is rather small, and connected to a Days Inn Hotel.  The prices are also not bad.  I have never had a Margarita there so I can't review that.  So for me its a place I would never turn down if suggested, but I just would never suggest it myself....lol.

Tonight we had to walk out of my favorite Mexican restaurant. After being seated immediately in the dining room, in the front, first booth behind the register. The restaurant wasn't very busy maybe 8 to 12 people in the dining room, but there was no wait staff to be seen, after waiting more than 10 mins for someone to acknowledge our presence my husband decided to grab the closest waiter and asked him to help us. Instead of being apologetic for making us wait, because he had already taken and returned with a drink order of a couple that came in after us, he was rude and snapped stating "I am coming now!" and we told him what we would like to drink and before he left I asked him if we could go ahead and place our dinner order(since we had been waiting a long time already and had more than enough time to look over the menu) and he reluctantly said yes. Ok I've lived here in Charlotte all of my life and I've been eating here since I can remember, I ordered one of my usuals chicken chimichanga no onions please, when the waiter quickly spoke up and said I could not order chicken chimichangas without onions... Wait? What? 
So in order to avoid what was already to be a very bad dining experience. I just excused ourselves and left... Im very disapointed with Azteca.. And I can't say I will never return but in the years I have been eating there I've had slow service but this was blatently rude and unwilling to accomodate...

Guac is always a good idea, especially if it is made fresh next to your table. There is a small and a large option. The small is one avocado and was great for two people to share. We asked for everything, which from what I could quickly see was tomatoes, onions, parsley and jalapeños and the juiciest lime you could ever squeeze. She made it so fast and I loved that she let me try it after she was done. It was good the first time but I ended up adding more jalapeños because I was feeling for something spicy. PRO TIP: She travels with a tip jar on her cart and so have some dollars handy for her personal attention. 

Carne Asada was the entree of choice. The meat was tender and portion was huge. It included beans, rice, pico and your choice of flour or corn tortillas. I also got a mango margarita, the mango mix was a little heavy but I knew it was to cover up the tequila and I'm never mad at a heavy pour. The food was very satisfying. The service was great despite being almost completely packed for Sunday Lunch.

I think we found a good one!  You could officially call me a fan of Azteca.   I came here with a party of 11.  The chips and salsa were pretty good.  I, personally, could have used a little more kick, but what can I say?  I'm a spicy kind of guy!

The margaritas are phenomenal here!  Between my fiancée and I, we ordered a pitcher.  My 3 enchiladas were absolutely awesome.  

Service was great!  They even came out and sang happy birthday to our friend.  Awesome job Azteca.  I shall be back!

THE most horrible dining experience. The worst customer service. Drinks were bad. Complained and asked for a different drink after a small swig. They refused. Ok. Sucked it up. Food came out horribly. Manager came out after we complained of food and told my  dining companions that her problem was that she talked too much! What? Then brought out the menu (which they had 2 different ones) and asked if we pointed to the picture for the order. Really? Saying we need to call the owner. NEVER AGAIN!

DO NOT ORDER CHEESE ENCHILADAS.   I got á la carte cheese enchiladas.   How can u mess that up, right?? Wrong!!   I am adding a pic to show everyone.  They were covered with cheddar cheese. Weird but I went with it.   The cheddar is also inside.  No white cheese.  Shredded cheddar cheese throughout.  Wtf??   It was nasty nasty Nasty.

I went to Azteca this Christmas for lunch. As you would guess, dining options for lunch on this day are few and far between. I drove past the restaurant, noticed there were about 15 cars there, and being familiar with the chain with other locations in Charlotte, said "what the heck," and pulled in.

This time around I got the Fajita Nachos with steak (you can also order it with chicken), and asked the server to add lettuce and jalapeños. She was polite, asked how my holidays were going, and did a great job making sure that I had everything I needed throughout the time I was there. All of the toppings were fresh, the chips were still warm, and the mixture of everything was just about perfect. What I was most impressed with was the taste of the steak. I believe they marinate the steak, and that gives the meat a certain sweetness that ties everything together. If I could make one suggestion, I would be to maybe cut down a little bit on the amount of green/red peppers that are in the recipe.

Overall, I was very happy with my choice on where to eat Christmas Day lunch. It's a meal that your expectations are somewhat high on, but it's so easy to be let down because of the number of options. The only reason I'm not giving this Azteca 5 stars is because of the salsa that's served as an appetizer, as they do at all Mexican restaurants. It's mediocre at best. The salsa they serve lacks texture, and almost resembles a salsa that has been watered down, with green onions added. If my memory serves me correctly, I wasn't impressed with the salsa that other Azteca restaurants in Charlotte served.

Oh yeah, ask for their homemade house hot sauce! It's a type of salsa verde that made up for their red salsa that's served with the tortilla chips.

Excellent!!  We got a shrimp entree and a chimichannga. Both were delicious!  The shrimp was perfectly cooked and the chicken was moist!  Definitely will be back when in the area. Yum and the margaritas were pretty tasty too!!

The food is sometimes hit or miss, but pretty good more often than not. The daiquiris are ALWAYS good and a really good size for the price. This is a midpoint between a friend and I so we meet here often for dinner and a drink. I've never had to wait long for a table but they can be busy at times. There is also always a large party. Seems to be very popular for celebrations!

I started going here years ago and the reason I always come back is for two things---the salsa and the Deluxe Burrito. It has been consistently wonderful for years. You get a fresh, awesome, slightly spicy (but overall mild) salsa and a carolina style salsa with cabbage that is fresh and delicious. Their chips are always fried well and never greasy or stale tasting. 

If your first thought when contemplating a Mexican restaurant is if their salsa is good (as is usually mine), then definitely eat here. But this location not the other ones because I've had way different experiences at the others.
Great service.  Fresh ingredients. Large menu.

When I entered the location I wasn't greeted and just stood there for a minute before I walked to the bar. While at the bar still didn't get waited on. After 10 min a gentleman asked if I needed help and the rest of the meal was great which is why I'm giving them 4 stars. The food was amazing and not to pricey at all.

One of the worst Mexican meals I have ever had. Staff was really nice and attentive, but this place is clearly catering to gringos. Burrito lunch special was listed $5.99, bill came and I was charged $6.75 pretax. Not a huge deal, but change your menu if the prices aren't accurate. Also the burrito had very little chicken and was slathered with half a pound of cheddar cheese. Next time I'll drive down to Central for something a bit better.

Solid 4 stars. Delicious Mexican food. Great staff. Incredible salsa that tasted freshly made. The decor is beautiful and menu selection is great. This is definitely our new go-to spot for Mexican. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because prices are a little high...my margarita was $8...and it wasn't bad but it did taste mostly like mixer. I hope to come back when there's some good drink specials.
We go here regularly and the restaurant is a family favorite. We've eaten most items on the menu and the grandsons love the fajitas.

I am giving Azteca 1 star for a few reasons. I called in my food at 3:33pm. Given that it's not during the dinner rush, I expected my food to get done quickly. They told me it would be ready in a, reasonable, 15 minutes. 15 minutes later I arrived to pick up my food. I told them what I was waiting for, then stood and waited another 45 minutes (one hour total time) for my food to come out. After waiting one hour I was told that my two burritos would be $38. I told them that must be a mistake, as all I ordered was two chicken burritos. There was no way they could be $19 a piece. I did add cheese to them, which I agreed to the $1.25 up charge for. They insisted that the price was right, and my two chicken burritos would be $38. (Side note: I recently went to chilis and shared two margaritas, an appetizer, two dinner entrees, and a desert, for $35)

One hour of wait time, and $38 later, I left with two mediocre chicken burritos that I could have gotten for significantly cheaper at most any other Mexican restaurant in the area. I will not be back.
This place is amazing, great food, drinks, staff. I would go every week if I lived closer.

I love Azteca!  My family has been eating here for over 10 years.  The food and service is excellent. Some could consider this to be Tex-Mex but it is more authentic Mexican food with local favorites like Arroz Con Pollo.  If you're searching for good Mexican food, look no further!  I highly recommend this restaurant and specifically the Woodlawn location for the authenticity.
Affordable prices, good food and there was even a lady that made fresh guacamole right at the table; it was delicious.

I have been coming to this restaurant for over a decade! I've always loved the service and food. It has been years since I last visited Azteca and it was not one of my best experiences here. Came in with 4 other ladies around 1:30pm on a Monday. When we walked in the manager or owner (one of the two) was on the phone taking an order. She "sensed" us standing there (she didn't look up), put the phone down (didn't put it on hold) and started to pile up menus. A waitress appeared and this lady tells her to take the order on the phone, in a very unprofessional manner to the point I was ready to walk out at that moment and I'm sure the person on the phone could hear everything. Of course this set my mood for the meal, since I'm so familiar with this place and I was with my in-law family who were visiting from another country, I started to notice EVERYTHING. The menu is basically the same as 10 years ago with higher prices. Some of the meals are overpriced for the quality of them (sopa de mariscos/seafood soup). My meal had a modification, instead of refríes beans I asked for charro beans, they were cold. My mother in law noticed that the taco salad she always gets, was only filled half way unlike other times it is over the top. Server was great and accommodating, however I was waiting for a refill throughout my whole meal. From this recent experience I will most likely double think spending my money here when I know there is better out there for less.
Unbelievable carnitas and margaritas!!  Highly recommend this place - looks like a dump but don't let that fool you!

First timer earlier this week and food was great! In fact, going back tonight...Attn: Vegetarians like me, the Expresso vegetarian burrito is great! Especially with the cheese dip drizzled over the top nom nom nom

I have previously mentioned my love for Mexican food so I have been to this restaurant more times then I care to share but I am just now getting around to writing about it!

In MY opinion, this is the best Mexican restaurant I have been to in terms of authenticity.  I know there are a lot of trendy mexican-fusion type joints but this is just your old fashioned get your grub on type Mexican.


The GOOD:  The salsa is very good...fresh ingredients give it a little bit of chunk and the flavor is perfect.  It is a little runny but I don't like salsa that has been thickened by paste or because it was pureed.  I would rather the flavor with chunks of onion and pieces of cilantro--and that is what this place offers.  


The BAD--They serve the salsa in a very small dish and they have a disclaimer on the menu that indicates only the first two rounds of chips and salsa are free.  I mean, what?  I understand we are in a tough economic situation but you can't be a mexican restaurant and charge for chips and salsa.  We have managed to avoid that extra charge so far.  We usually just ask a different person for more salsa every time...I know, a little dishonest, but I can't help it!  I expect a charge when you go to some random place and happen to order chips and salsa as your appetizer (like Chili's or something) but any standard, hole-in-the-wall Mexican place should NOT do such a thing.



THE EXCELLENT:  Their fresh, tableside guacamole!  WOW!  I had no idea avocados could have so much flavor.  It was fantastic.  The flavors were bold and boasted of fresh cilantro, onion, and lime!  It was such a perfect combination of flavors.  I have had it with the jalapenos and without...either way was incredible!  



I typically get the veggie fajitas and that is another reason why I love this place.  TYPICALLY, if I order veggie fajitas I end up with onions and peppers marinated in salt.  Azteca sends out grilled onions, peppers, tomatoes, squash, broccoli and mushrooms.  They are not weighted down with sodium and dripping in a fajita sauce....they are grilled and fresh.  It really is perfectly done!



The beans and rice and pretty basic--nothing to speak about.  The flour tortillas are great and their pico de gallo is fresh and flavorful.


One other downfall is that they don't give you the option for black beans on the side.  But, what I found out is that black beans are not as authentic in terms of Mexican food.  Muy interesante!



It is definitely worth checking them out...even if it is just for their guacamole.  You may want to bring your own jar of salsa though....just kidding

One of the worst Mexican meals I have ever had. After waiting an hour for the food !!! The food arrived salty, well done and dry !! The waitress offered to replace the meal and it took another 30 minutes. Basically we lost our appetite waiting for the food . Told the waitress not to bring the food out and asked for the manager !!! And sure enough he came and start arguing with me and my friend about the food not being salty !!! said he tried it and it taste just fine !!!! REALLY DUDE???? I said It is salty and this is not the first time I come here nor the first time I order this meal !! He said sorry but all I can so is offer you 50% off of your bill and we actually returned the plates full after taking one bite so basically we paid for something we did not even eat!!!!! He was worried about getting his $$$ not providing good customer service. This manager sucks and he need to learn some customer service !!!!

Azteca is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Charlotte!  If you go there you'll see why, tons of charm and the food is amazing!!

Great atmosphere at lunch or dinner time!  They have a tons of cheap lunch specials and you get a ton of food.  Plus, all you can eat chips, salsa and Mexican slaw...Yum!!

One of my favorite dishes they serve is the Carnitas Des Reyes (I think that's how it's spelled!)!  Sliced beef strips in a tomato-ey sauce with green peppers and onions.  Served with your choice of flour or corn tortillas, rice, beans and guacamole.  The beef is so tender and has a ton of flavor.  If you've never tried it before, please do!  If you like fajitas, you would like that dish!

I've also had their fajitas and they are the best around!  I don't think I've had a bad meal there.  

Service is always great and fast, especially at lunch time.

Oh, and at the end of your meal you get these wedges of tortillas dusted with sugar and drizzled with honey and strawberry sauce, topped with whipped cream!  One of my favorite desserts ever and you get it with your meal!  Yum!!

Don't let the fact that it's attached to a Days Inn make you not want to go in.  Just keep your focus on the food and atmosphere and you'll forget that the hotel is even there!!

Azteca is tucked behind a hotel in a strip of other restaurants and shops. Parking is a breeze and there is a lot of indoor seating. 

They have complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa has a slight kick so sensitive tongues be careful! I ordered a margarita... it was nice and strong. Such a shame that they don't offer specials.


I ordered a chicken quesadilla and the bae ordered a chicken burrito. The food came out quickly and was delicious. It wasn't the best I've had, but it was pretty good. I didn't care for the sour cream that much but it didn't ruin my meal. 

Service was good and I had no complaints. Overall, this place is pretty solid, especially for the area.

1st off, this restaurant is located literally connected to a Days Inn. Yes, it's somewhat connected to hotel. Due to the location, parking sucks. But atleast you can walk off the extra calories. Decor is traditional. Bathroom is way to small for the amount of people inside. 

Service was good. The only complaint I have is that you have to pay at the register at the hostess area. It just leads to a huge cluster of people up front if it's busy so you have to awkwardly stand around and be maneuvered around for those that need to be seated. 

Food was delicious. I got the Quesadilla with chicken, rice and beans. It was really good and was the perfect size. They have lunch specials too and servers are available to answer questions.

I was a little wary about this place. From the outside, it looks super sketch because the restaurant is semi-attached to a Days Inn. It's awkwardly positioned to the right of the hotel. But hey, sometimes that's where you get the most authentic food.

Walking in, that's when I realized, it was very cultured and decked out. I felt like I walked into an Aztecan temple filled with golden chairs/walls/tables, you name it. It may have been the color of the wood and the light that was shining just right. I felt like I needed to offer a human heart in return for my food. But we'll save that for another time ;)

The menu, like any traditional mexican restaurant was expansive. Average price around $7-12, so pretty good. I think there were over 60 items on the menu. I ultimately chose the Avocado Tostada and an enchilada. My friend got 2 tacos and an enchilada. While we were waiting for our food, the chips and salsa came out. Chips were the same as any mexican restaurant, however the salsa came with two different types: a cabbage blend and the regular salsa. The cabbage salsa was unique and sweet. Usually cabbage is bitter but it was rather pleasant. We also ordered some queso to go with the chips. 

I would say the only caveat about this place was the service. It was a bit slow and forgetful. We ordered the queso and we didn't receive it until we got our meal (which was 20 minutes after we ordered). Water refill was slow if not at all (we had to hail down our waiter). Let me tell you though, it was alot of queso, so definitely your money's worth. When we got our food, it was served on this gigantic plate (~20 inches wide). The food was spread out, but it was still alot of food. Avocado tostada was a bit disappointing as I only got 2 small chunks of avocado.

Regardless, the experience was amazing. We got sopapillas at the end. It's essentially fried chips with a sprinkle of strawberry drizzle and powdered sugar. Nice way to polish off the lunch. Til next time amigos.

Not sure what everyone sees in Azteca. I have been several times since 2013, my last review, and am just not impressed.
Service is always horrible and I always feel very rushed! They try and turn tables and it is not a good customer experience. 
As for the food, the salsa is runny and the cabbage slaw always has a rancid flavor. As for entrees, nothing really stands out. Most recently I got the fajitas and the Chicken wasn't great and the vegetables were even cooked. The beans and rice are okay but I feel like they sit on the plates and get heated up right before being served. Half the time the rice a overcooked because of that.
I will say the fresh made guacamole is good. Definitely don't pass that up.
Drinks are not fresh...the Margarita tastes like a pre-made mix, very sour. Learn to make a fresh Margarita.

There are definitely better Mexican options in my mind and probably will not return.
Best mexican restaurant in Charlotte!  Food is out of this world (my favorite is the Carne Asada) and everything is very reasonably priced.

Our go-to Mexican place.  The fresh guacamole is reason alone to go here. They make it table side and you can let them know what you want in it. Always good to bring a couple of bucks for the guacamole cart tip jar.  Service is usually good and they will customize plates however you want. Not too expensive.
Frozen margaritas and tres leches cake for us tonight. "best tres leches on this side of the boarder" they say and I agree.

Used to be really good, but I guess they got too comfortable. I used to be a regular here. Then I went once earlier this year and noticed a huge downgrade in quality of the food & ingredients used and in the service provided. Hoping it was just a bad day- I went back again but had the same less-than-stellar experience. Don't plan to go back.

2 young adults and 2 adults.  Extensive menu.  Excellent service but it was only 5:30pm on a Friday and the music was blaring way too loud and I asked for them to please turn it down.  We could not hear each other talk.  Tableside Guac fantastic.  I asked the waitress for onions for my  cheese enchiladas.  She asked me if I wanted them on the inside or on top I said I would love them on the inside.  I never got any onion at all but we had so much food on the table (Guac, nachos, then the main courses that it didn't matter by then).  If you look at Map Quest or Google maps it shows you making a right turn into the restaurant where there is no road.  It shows a dotted line where you drive thru a ditch and bushes! LOLOLOL  We had already figured it out before we got there. We will be back soon.

Five years later, still good. Azteca has all the stuff you would want in a Mexican restaurant - Telemundo on the television, burritos and tacos, rice and beans, imported beers from south of the border, chips and salsa, and a wait staff that understands enough English to bring you a carne asada with flour tortillas.

Food is good. Chips are good. Salsa is good. It's A-OK.

For Mexican food, I love to visit this Azteca location.  The service is excellent and they will substitute items on the menu.  As a shrimp lover, a favorite dish is the Carnitas Camarones which is prawns sliced and fried with onions, green peppers and mushrooms served with rice and beans.  They usually have a margarita special (mango = yummy) along with a beer special.  The restaurant is always crowded for dinner on the weekends.  Although the restaurant is pretty large, I suggest you arrive before the dinner time hour so that you don't have to wait.
Food was simply amazing! Our waitress was sweet, polite and quick. We watched as tortillas were made fresh in front of us. I recommend eating here!

I have been going to Azteca on Woodlawn since I was a little kid. It has always been my favorite mexican restaurant in Charlotte and never dissapoints! Their queso is the best and the chicken enchiladas are my go to dish! You  cant go wrong with anything on the menu
Very ethnic feel. I appreciate that they are open late. I bought dinner for my dad and he almost ate the plate!

Had lunch here yesterday.  Been a while. I keep forgetting about this place even though it is basically across the street from my office.  But it is buried deep in a strip mall type area. 

Anyway the lunch was great. I had a deluxe beef burrito. It was huge. Otherwise nothing unusual at all. But very fresh, tasty, and satisfying. 

Service was friendly and prompt. Prices average for this type of spot. 

All in all a winner. Not a go out of your way place. But if you're in the area, and feel like Mexican food, worth the stop

I ordered lunch to go. I had the chimichanga lunch plate that came with rice and refried beans. They also gave me chips and salsa, which I was not expecting because I though they only gave that to customers who would dine in, so that was a special treat. Now the food, was okay. Nothing spectacular. My rice I don't think it was cooked all the way because there were some grains in there that were hard as if they were not cooked all the way. The ground beef in my chimichanga to me it did seem a little on the cheaper cut of beef.  Ur overall, I liked my food. The restaurant was nicely decorated and it seemed liked a good atmosphere. I would recommend this Mexican restaurant if you're in the area...I just have to try this place for dinner.

Kids menu: B, we didn't actually see the kids menu but the server said they could do just about any item on the menu in a kids size. So for that, they get a B!

Kids review: The beef and bean burrito had too many beans, not enough meat. We liked the rice and beans. And churros!

Parents review: We only ordered beverages on this visit Order the top shelf margarita, so smooth and not too sweet! They also have Dos Equis Amber on draft served in tall, icy mugs. The food looked fine but nothing to write home about.
Loved this Mexican restaurant! Great food, ambiance and drinks! I'd go back here anytime!

I am from New York and was visiting Charlotte with the boyfriend. He loves mexican food. So we decided on this place because of the great reviews. We arrived and was served with house tortilla chips and salsa. The salsa was a bit too spicy for me but the tortilla chips were hot and were good. I ordered the chicken carnitas and the boyfriend ordered the arroz con pollo. The food arrived in extra huge plates and it was not what we expected. The food was delicious but it was so much that we both couldnt finish it. I would recommend this place to friends who are visiting Charlotte.

It was 7pm on a Sunday, St. Patricks day, and we were out-of-towners looking for dinner near our hotel in Charlotte.  We were surprised to find that most restaurants were closed.  Azteca was the fourth one that we tried and, finding it open, decided to give it a try.

When we walked in, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming.  There was a plate of food on display which looked kind of congealed and gross - it had probably been there the whole day - and made me question whether dinner there was a good idea.

There was no wait for our table.  When we were seated, they promptly brought us delicious chips and salsa.  Our waitress was very kind.  We ordered four different dishes and shared - they were all fabulous.  Large portions for great prices.  There was also a woman walking by with a cart making fresh guacamole on request.  She was adorable and I loved that she made it right in front of us.

Overall, Azteca was not a place I probably would have chosen first but I'm really glad we stumbled upon it.  A great find!

Went to dinner here for a late night with my family  on 7.23.16. I was actually trying to decide  between Don Pedro's and Azteca . I decided to go to Azteca since I had never been before . Upon reviewing the menu , I noticed it looked eerily familiar to Don Pedro's, after chatting with the waiter it was confirmed that they are more or less the same restaurant and share the same menu , interesting !

Anyways  back to the dinner , the waiter took our order without  any issues and came by to see how we were doing prior to our food  coming out and seemed  like a pretty nice guy . Unfortunately that was the last we heard of him ,He just disappeared after that .  The food came out and everything was ok .   A lady named  Ana ( who seemed really nice ) , was able to get our check and let us pay . I was never told of what happened to our waiter .

 Within hours of eating the food ( Fiesta Chimichanga and chips and salsa) an explosive sickness came over me like no other and left me running to the  bathroom from 4am to nearly 10am . Yikes !!!   I definitely didn't order a side of food poisoning or whatever that was , with my chimichanga . Nonetheless I'm glad it didn't last too long and after about a day I'm feeling pretty darn good again :) . Probably won't be going to either Don Pedro's or Azteca for quite some time.

This place is pretty hidden up in the North Lake mall area, but it is great!  I did not have high hopes for it, but I have been there 3 times now, and each time has been awesome.

The Margaritas are huge! (order the Cabo Wabo margarita)  The juices are fresh and the tequila is strong.  Two of these will set you up nicely for the evening, and they aren't even that expensive.  

For food, the queso is delicious, but the real highlight is the steak quesadilla.  The steak is delicious and has soo much flavor.

I love coming here, even though it is 15+ mins outside of the city.  It's under the radar, but I will keep returning.

Thought I would give this place a try. Went on a Monday night not crowded at all. When we sat down the waiter was quick with the salsa and some type of slaw. Had the table side guac made and it was excellent. The food came out quick and was very hot and good. I will be back.
Food is always good here. The bartender knows how to make a good margherita on the rocks! That's always a plus. I wouldn't skip desert either. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
Solid authentic Mexican food with an interesting vibe. Not sure if I'd take out of town guests here since it's in a Days Inn, but overall has great service and food is priced well.

Quick, efficient, good food, excellent drinks, average priced.
We went on Cinco De Mayo and it was great! Great environment and everyone had a great time, will be back!
Wow.....GIANT beers and awesome food. Got the 2 Burrito plate with chile verde and chorizo. The rice is fantastic also.

My second favorite Mexican Resturant in the area. Outstanding chips and salsa. The BEST table side guacamole anywhere.  Any of the steak dishes are amazing. Great service always.  And a large beer is a LARGE beer. Truly a outstanding restaurant.

If you are one of those people who say the guac ( and not the guacamole) at Cantina is so delicious... you either 1) have not been to Azteca or 2) are too drunk from the margarita to notice that it's bland.

Azteca is the place to go for Mexican because it is authentic and has more to choose from than just tacos and buritos (although it does have them).  When you sit down the server automatically brings you a basket of hot freshly made chips, salsa and awesome pica de gallo.  You should also order the guacamole that is prepared table side.  They cut the avacado right there in front of you and add the ingredients (e.g. onion, cilantro, lime jalapenos, salt, pepper, etc.) based on your taste (more spicy please).  Not like other restaurants who claim they make the guac in front of you but bring out already cut avacado and pre-measured ingredients and spices. 


Azteca has a huge menu and everything I've ever ordered have been delicous.  And I've had quite a few things such as queso, guacamole, carne asada, pork carnitas, steak fajitas, seafood soup, fried snapper, puerto vallarta and other dishes.  When you order your food they give you the option of flour or fresh made corn tortillas.  Definitely get the fresh corn tortillas or ask for it if they don't tell you about it.  They also give you complimentary sopapillas drizzle with honey and strawberry sauce top with whipped cream.  Every time I eat there I feel like they have to wheel me out because they give you so much food but I still look forward to and save room for the sopapillas.

Also I don't think I've mentioned how wonderful their service is.  My boyfriend drinks a lot of sweet tea and they never leave his cup empty.  All the servers are super nice and accommodating.   We go there so often that the people there know we like to sit in the outdoor section (when weather permits of course).  This southern girl can't handle the cold too well.

OOHHH. I forgot to mention, their margaritas are delicious.  They also have margarita specials Mon - Thurs.  Definitely try one.  It's a great place to have dinner with your significant other or a large group of friends.  The mariachi band also add a fun element to your dining experience.  The band is at the Woodlawn location on Friday nights and at the Independence location on Sunday nights.  Ask them to play something crazy and look forward to a good time!!!
Recommend getting the large guacamole with everything on it and a lot of lime juice for your appetizer

Our waitress was rude and pushy and the food was absolutely terrible! I will definitely not be back. Watery salsa and overcooked chips to start the meal. We decided to get the table side guacamole and neither of us were impressed. My meal was mostly rice and beans and the chicken inside the burrito was not good. I have almost nothing positive to say about this place besides their decor. Not sure why they're getting 3+ stars because honestly chipotle would've been better and worth the money.

I'm trying to think of anything I dislike about this place and I cant.  The guacamole the woman with the cart makes is great, the queso dip is great, all the food I've had is great.  My personal favorite is the "Dos Amigos" chicken and shrimp in a sour cream sauce oh my god and if you want to get the real deal ask for the handmade corn tortillas.  If I could eat here every day I probably would, and then I wouldnt fit through the door.

Also, I came here on my birthday and they brought me ice cream and sang me happy birthday while banging on drums.  Way better than red lobster.

Went down to the Carolina Rebellion last weekend, upon checking out of the Marriot Courtyard near by I hit up Yelp and this place popped up about a mile away.
Fantastic service throughout, top notch. Lunch specials were cheaper than what you can pay for some fast food spots. Atmosphere was festive and the margaritas were off the chain. I'd recommend this spot to anyone looking for all around, great Mexican food and outstanding service!

I have been to this location many time and this was the first time we have ever received poor service. Normally we come during lunch when it is super busy and receive very good service. Not sure what happened tonight but service was just as slow as the business. I left super unhappy and upset. 
When we got there the hostess seat us in the bar area. Table was really small since there was 3 of us and a newborn. It took about 10 mins before someone even came to take our drink order and food order. It also took forever for our food to come out. Had to wait also for our drinks to be refilled. Asked twice for more salsa since they only gave 1 small bowl for 3 ppl to share and that didn't come till after our food hit the table. Which then it wasn't needed. Our whole dinning experience took an 1hr and 45mins. At the end of our meal we got tired of waiting for our missing server to give us the check so we had to go up front to the rude hostess to pay. 
Your servers and hostess need to be train on customer service. The food was good but service was horrible. I will never return to this location.

I really hate giving a 2 star but in order to give a three star, I have to least want to go back and I just can't say that I want to.

The service was on point - our server definitely stayed on top of providing us with excellent service. So my 2 star is in no reflection of that. 

Chips and salsa were banging. The rest of our food was just mediocre. I can't even remember what we ordered now - that is how much it left an impression on me. My son ordered a burger and while it was pretty big - it tasted like they ran it over several times. It was just so tough and dry.

They give you complimentary dessert which is nice but it is just some fried tortillas with cinnamon and sugar.

I have had to revise my previous 5 star rating for Azteca because of the LACK OF
SERVICE.   The past couple of times we've been here for lunch, I've noticed the
server barely comes back to see if you need a drink refill or anything else.  Today
after he brought our food, he never came back again (and yes I wanted more tea!)
until lhe saw the plates stacked at the end of the table and he asked us if we wanted to order anything else. The .50 tip I left reflected the level of service.

Also, as some other reviewers said, the salsa was very watery and the pork was
fatty. Not the Azteca of a couple of years ago.  I'll go back because it's close to work
and the taste of the food is good, but the service is lousy.

Have eaten here a few times when I'm in town and the food is just wonderful. Only causes I have for complaint would be the horrible mariachi band that roams from table to table, interrupting both conversations and meals AND the last few times there's always some type of panhandler outside by the door or in the parking lot. The restaurant is right in front of a ratty Days Inn and not in the best part of town, which likely explains this. Personally, I wouldn't go there in the evening by myself, but two or more in a group offers a bit more protection. At any rate, the great food makes it all worth it.

Had dinner and drinks at Azteca this weekend with a friend of mine. The restaurant itself is quite large and had a festive aura. Upon arriving, I sat at the bar (as I waited for my friend) and had a top shelf margarita. The margarita itself was strong. As a bartender, I tend to like mine a bit more subtle w the alcohol, but I'm a bit crazy like that. The bartender was affable and hard at work. He ran the bar nicely.

When my friend arrived we grabbed a table. No reservations on weekends keep in mind. Our server was quiet and a bit hurried. I understand that because it was a Saturday night. When we did order (burritos and a chicken dish in a cream sauce) our food came quickly. The chips that came with salsa were bland and too thick to me. The entrees themselves were on plates larger than a small country. It was aesthetically funny to look at. Our meals were good. Not amazing but not bad. I will say the chorizo burrito was quite tasty though. 

The pricing was inexpensive. Like most Mexican places, you get a lot of food for the $$.

Would I return. Yes. For what is in the area, Azteca is a decent spot for a quick and filling Mexican dish.

Great Mexican restaurant. My family and I have always used this place for special occasions. It shows you how good a place is when it is slammed full on a Friday night in Charlotte. Both locations can get full, so that is a sign that they are doing something right!

OK Mex.

Went here on a early Sat evening for dinner. We sat outside on the patio which was nice.

I had the two Amigos with grilled shrimp and chicken in a sauce of sour cream and
melted monterray jack cheese.

It comes with refrios and lettuce with a choice of flour or corn tortillas.
The taste was somewhat bland.

Their salsa was very heavy on onions which I didn't care for.

This is about as authentic as you can get north of the border.
Most all their staff is Latino.

They will mix up fresh quacomole at your table side, Armando barely spoke english.

They have excellent lunch specials for less than $5.
Grande portions and sabroso mex!

I just flew in and must say I was very pleased.  I checked yelp for a Mexican place and while this was only 3.5 stars it was close by so I took a chance.  It was clean. Staff was nice. Not too expensive and food was pretty good. They even bring u a little desert chip. Which is a nice touch. 
Orders the chicken fajitas. Not the best in the world but really good.
